this is a really great laptop I bought for one of our workers. It works well and has a good battery life. It's good value for money.

I think Happy Ranger did a great job. The laptop came in excelent condition with the exact same model I ordered.

I wanted a laptop to play videogames and work. With this laptop I could play Cyberpunk in ultra with no lag to give an example of how good it is.

Now I'm going to mention the things I don't like. But this is mostly stuffs with ASUS.

It heats a lot. It can easily go to 90C very fast. Of course, this laptop have some configurations to speed up / activate the fans which can hold it and I won't go father than that. Also, most games won't have this problem. You can always buy a cooling pad so this isn't big deal.

The battery. Just working as a programmer works around 2-3 hours using linux on balance. Gaming last around 1-2 hours depending on what you are playing. If you use the special configurations on windows it can last a bit more but isn't a big difference.

The screen of the laptop have some weird colors. You can make some configurations but it won't look perfect. My old laptop had a better quality screen. It has a HDMI so you can avoid this problem an use a real monitor.

Despite this little problems, I'm very happy with what I brought.
It is the same product I ordered and it arrived in perfect condition! I'm really happy with my new laptop!
I can only say wonderful, amazing
Awesome seller and genuine product really loved the 32gb ram

This is a great, powerful machine. My word of caution is that its battery life is awful. On battery saving mode with the touchscreen turned off, an hour of light programming depletes a third of the battery. This is likely due to its powerful processor combined with the display. I could see this being a good fit for someone who will primarily use it at a workstation where its constantly connected to power, or someone who is usually near an outlet to charge.

Additionally, the computer gets very hot after an hour of use. I would suggest getting a cooling fan or elevating it so the fans on the bottom can circulate a bit more. This is also likely due to the compact case in addition to the powerful processor. This leads me to believe the processor power is not being fully utilized due to the heating issues.

If you already have a bigger machine and are getting this for on-the-go, I would go for the i5 and the base display. The display quality wont matter on this size and you wont notice the difference in processor speeds because of the overheating issues I mentioned earlier.

Overall, its a beautiful machine and I love the size and weight of it. It feels solid and the display quality is amazing. I can have multiple IDEs open, running a local dev server, tests, and browse the web without worrying about lag. I use it mostly at home on the couch or in bed, with it plugged in so the battery problem sucks but isnt a dealbreaker. The cooling issue is something I have with my MacBook Pro as well, so a cooling fan has been a good investment regardless.

This a laptop was absolutely perfect. The touchscreen was great, really fast, was very comfortable to type, incredible design. This laptop just looked so premium in features and appearance. However, you could feel so much heat coming from the bottom that in half an hour I couldn't bear it upon my legs. And the most important downside was, it had really poor battery performance. It couldn't last more than 3 hours of battery life, even sometimes lasted only 2 and a half hours just using web browsing. No video streaming or any other demanding application. I contacted Dell and they said that this is the battery life time it is supposed to have (which I don't entirely believe, and contradicted what they say in their product website). They changed battery and problem still persisted. At the end they proposed to change both hard disc and motherboard, when in that point, I finally decided to return it to the seller for receiving full refund. It was heartbreaking for me to return it because I loved this laptop. However, this battery issue was unacceptable for me because it completely took any portability off from the laptop. I don't know whether any other laptop of this model has the same issue or I just got unlucky.

There is a known problem with the cheap Meditek wi-fi cards they installed on these.  After spending dozens of hours on forums reading about 100's of people with the same problem, it's not clear if it's just janky hardware, or Asus just can't get the BIOS to work properly with the card.  Every time windows updates, be prepared for endless wi-fi problems which will eventually be fixed by a BIOS update from Asus.  Asus refuses to acknowledge the problem, and will not send you a replacement card.  Their customer service completely stonewalled me, and pretended they had never heard of the problem before, even though it's been going on for over a year now.  The only real fix seems to be to just get an intel ax200 replacement.  They're around $30.  Obviously not a huge expense, but ALOT of time wasted with Asus customer service getting no result, then hours spent on the forums trying to solve it myself.  Won't buy an Asus again.

The same day we opened this laptop the unit began to shut off. This was a gift to my son who didn't make me aware of the problem until AFTER the Amazon return date. I sent the unit into ASUS and they charged me $130 for a repair. Once we received it back,  the problem still persisted. They did not offer a refund for the charge.

Dealing with ASUS has been a nightmare and as of today,  months and months later, the unit STILL shuts off randomly and glitches the screen out. My son was so excited to start gaming and has not been able to due to this defective device. Extremely disappointed and out of $1700+ dollars.

Honestly, I want to love this laptop, but their BIOS update has completely tanked the Wifi. I've tried every solution, and the only thing left would be to return this laptop, but then I'd need to update the BIOS. So, really it's busted.
Broken wifi 2 mts in needed to buy wifi attachments, some keys stopped working using external keyboard. Now just a desktop. Oh runs hot, need to buy a cooling mat too.

I purchased this Asus TUF Dash 15 from the "Lucky Tech, LLC" Amazon store. I have had issues for the last month with the machine crashing/locking up sporadically with increasing frequency. I thought it might be a bad video display driver. So, I made sure everything was up-to-date but the problem persisted. I did a few system restores, some from the local Windows copy and some from the cloud.  I spent a lot of time trying to isolate what the problem might be. While this was going on, I noticed disk errors starting to show up in the System event logs. At this point, I really thought it is a hardware issue. I reached out to Asus for support and they sent me a link to create an RMA. However, when I tried to create an RMA, it said I needed to go to Best Buy. I went to Best Buy and, even though I am a Total Care member, they would not honor the warranty because I did not buy the laptop there.  I reached out to "Lucky Tech, LLC" about this and they directed me back to Best Buy, even though I clearly told them in writing on multiple occasions that "Best Buy would not honor the warranty because I did not buy the laptop." The only thing that makes sense is that they are reselling laptops they buy from Best Buy and the warranty is not transferrable.

Bottom line, I am the proud owner of a $1700 boat anchor. This is really impacting my business. I would not do business with this seller.

Package came in good condition, IPS Screen have a good black color, RGB keyboard can control color and brightness, runs fast, it comes with two RAM of 8 GB (total 16) and you can change to two RAM of 16 GB (total 32) but check the warranty conditions before,  maybe you should change the memory in the store. I played battlefield 5 for a hour and the heat was not extremely and the noise of fans was tolerantly, if you will play for a long time you should buy in addition external fans.

Worth every penny. I'm actually writing the review on this laptop (physically using) 8 months later! So needless to say I have broken it in. Full disclosure, I modded this right out of the box. I added in an additional M.2 for another 2TB of space and upgraded to 64GB (2x32) of RAM. The SSD and RAM ran me about $250 (USD) and it was breeze to install. The laptop runs great, no cooling issues, no frame drops or lag. I cannot speak to the battery life because this lives on the desk next to my workstation and I have not traveled with it. But lets be honest, no one games aggressively at the coffee shop. If you are playing an intense, power demanding game you are likely sitting at home. If you don't want the bulk of a PC tower and you want to sit anywhere in the house on your computer than this is the best there is for you. The cherry on top is that this is from ASUS and in over 10 years of using their products I have nothing but great things to say about the company and what they produce.

I previously posted about receiving this computer as a refurbished product. I am removing that post because Ted and all the folks at the seller recognized the mistake right away and jumped through hoops to get me the new product I ordered within 24 hours. I cannot say enough good things about folks who recognize a problem and offer real solutions, and then follow through on those solutions.

 It runs hot, of course, so get a quality laptop cooler.

This is the second ASUS machine I have tried to use.  The first machine was returned due to a problem with the WIFI being totally inoperable.  I fought with that machine for about a week before returning it.
As I really like the first machine overall, I decided to give the ASUS TUF series another try and went with a bit of an upgrade from the first machine.
Initial start up and Windows 10 set up went flawless and easy.  Wifi connected quick easy and fast.  From my first experience I was able to go through and do a lot of basic setup with the ASUS utilities and basic Windows preferences.
Everything worked fine until the first BIOS update to version 309 installed.  After that the wifi became quite erratic.  It might or might not connect.  When it doesn't connect, the wifi won't display any networks at all.  In some cases the hardware will shut down and there won't even be a WiFi option.
Pros
It is a big screen and decent keyboard.  Backlighting is somewhat programmable for overall color and there are apparently some basic special effects that can be turned on with the ASUS Armory Crate utility.  In this instance the machine came with 16G of memory, 6G of graphics memory and a 1T SSD.  I never really got to try out the gaming or usability of the machine as the WiFi not working is a deal breaker.

Cons
The NUM LOCK key has no visual light or marker to indicate if it is on or off.  A small LED like the Caps Lock would have been fine, but it has none so you have to find out the hard way.
Once all the basic Windows 10 stuff is set up from original install/set up the machine runs quite well and was a lot faster than the first machine I had.  When Windows 10 starts doing the upgrades/updates, DO NOT ALLOW THE BIOS UPDATES!!!!!!!!!!!  The WiFi problems are due to faulty bios starting with versions 309.  Versions 310 and 312 completely shut down the ability for the wifi to work at all.  If you don't have a Cat5 cable to plug in for internet, you will be out of luck.

Heat.  This is a powerful machine and the processors generate a lot of heat.  There should have been some kind of built in stand offs on the underside to give more air space under the fans.  As it is designed it sets too close to a smooth flat table for enough air to flow.  It really needs a laptop cooler if you plan on doing any real gaming.  If it has about 3/4 of an inch under the machine at the top end, it seems to stay fairly cool if you have the fans running at all.  (I actually can't hear them myself)

I will probably be returning this to Amazon.  I would not recommend ANY of the ASUS computers at this time due to the BIOS WiFi issue.  For me, the lack of WiFi access makes this a boat anchor.  Of course ASUS isn't really saying anything about this ocean liner slamming into an iceberg.
Be aware that there are a lot of "make do" fixes online for the ASUS WiFi issue.  I suspect it is going to be worse before it is better.
The first machine started having problems the first evening.  Through the following week the WiFi became more and more erratic until it just wouldn't work at all.
At this point THIS macnine is ONE DAY OLD and the wifi is completely shut down.

This thing is amazing. Large (as I knew when purchasing a 17 screen) but very portable, extremely tough chassis. Fastest piece of equipment Ive had my hands on in a hot minute. Beautifully simple to install extra hardware. 9/10 Id buy it again, although a couple of their competitors look like fun too and variety is the spice of life, right? This product has changed my life. I can do so many things with it from video editing to music production. the only negative is that The battery life goes really quick. I have everything in low power mode and still it is dying super fast. Great computer to stay at home with but if you are constantly on the go then this battery life is not for you!

This laptop is FAST. I have a dual XEON server for editing video but am finding myself doing more and more work on this laptop. Because Its also very fast at editing video.

It has a great feature that automatically switches between the default Intel GPU (energy/battery saving) for everyday tasks and switches to using the discrete NVIDIA RTX3060 (performance) in games and heavy video editing.  You can manually specify in the NVIDIA Experience app to run specific games ONLY using the NVIDIA GPU because sometimes it will try to use the slower default GPU. For most windows tasks the Intel GPU is great.

 It does run hot, so I would recommend a laptop cooler if you going to play demanding games. The fans do a great job at pumping the heat outside the laptop. However, It must have plenty of ventilation underneath to allow proper airflow. Extremely warm air is ejected from three places (left side rear, right side rear and right side.

The fans (x2) when in silent mode are just that  silent. However in turbo mode they are very loud. Not a big deal for me because I use noise canceling headphones that totally eliminate the fan noise.

I upgraded the RAM in this laptop soon after purchase from 16GB (2x8GB) to 32GB (2x16GB). This is the kit I purchased and confirm that they run at full 3200MHz speeds with timings of CL 20 RCD 22 RP 22 RAS 42 on a JDEC profile.

Kingston FURY Impact 32GB (2x16GB) 3200MHz DDR4 CL20 Laptop Memory Kit of 2 KF432S20IBK2/32, Black

https://www.amazon.com/gp/aw/d/B097QJ25NY?psc=1&ref=ppx_pop_mob_b_asin_image

Hope this helps.

Although I didn't buy this from Amazon, this is the laptop my work has provided me and I love it so much I'm starting to save up to buy my own & figured I'd add my review in the meantime. In the last five years of my career, this truly has been the best laptop I have used. It's fast, it's got a beautiful image resolution, it's lightweight, and there hasn't been a single issue with it in the last two years. Even being a Apple/IOS over-consumer, I prefer using this laptop over my personal mac computer because the software doesn't get outdated as fast, the camera is better, it's overall clearer, brighter and more sleek in my opinion.

The laptop keyboard includes buttons to easily lock the camera off so I don't have to worry about accidentally turning my camera on in a meeting when I'm still in my pjs. For similar reasons, I also like that there's a mute button on the keyboard as well as volume & brightness keys. My millennial brain still needs the satisfaction of a clicking-key keyboard and I'm able to use my usb/bluetooth paired keyboard & mouse without issues.

The price is not ideal but like I said, I'm saving up to buy one for my own personal use because I can't recommend this laptop enough!

Navy vet who is going to grad school at UNLV here. I absolutely LOVE the 8th gen Intel XPS laptop/notebook. The laptop might look small but it packs quite a punch. It comes with an 8th gen intel core I5 processor, 8 GB of ram and 128 gigs. It is very light weight and that is good because carrying that around campus in the summers, when it is over 110 degrees can be challenging. If you fly all the time you will appreciate this laptop because it is easy to carry. I love the infinity edge, the retna display on the camera and the battery life. What I don't love is the keyboard, it is a bit mushy and with Dell, upgrades are expensive like apple. I was going to get it from amazon but Dell offered a lower price, with my military discount. I was able to get this when it came out for $900 out the door. I highly recommend this notebook I am not a play video games on my laptop guy but you can use it for that, of course there are better laptops if that is what you want. This is perfect for the student or businessperson who wants a professional looking laptop. I also picked the silver color because it looks nice. People often mistake this laptop for a macbook pro but it's a Dell.

no flex to the case, extremely fast, has a PCIe SSD (NOT NVMe) screen quality is perfect, battery life averages 11 hours with very light usage, like 7 with heavy loads. Got one when it first hit Amazon around 2 months ago. Terrific deal and it indeed does include a HD touchscreen. The SSD is a bit small but I always upgrade the SSDs anyway on these laptops to the fastest ones on the market. Mine was shipped in two days with free shipping to Hawaii. So far no problems with it and it indeed is brand new with a 14-month warrantee from Dell.

Beware as a lot of deals on Ebay are actually refurbs for around the same price. Also a lot of the sales and promos direct from Dell you need to check the fine print as many of the 8th Gen XPS laptops do not include a touchscreen.

That being said, due to the small 13" screen size for best use of the touchscreen you need a stylus not unless you have real small fingers. In the same vein, getting the QHD screen in touchscreen is a waste of time and not worth the extra bucks.

Update: Downgraded to 3 stars because I finally got around to running CrystalMark 6.0 on this machine, only to find out that at 500/500 R/W speeds, the vendor installed a SATA III drive, not an NVME PCIE drive, which comes pretty much standard on computers sold in 2018. The ad here on Amazon is carefully worded to state only "SSD", with no indication it is the faster and more commonly used NVME drives, that is why I am giving it 3 stars for deception. I am currently in the process of upgrading to a 1 TB NVME PCIE drive, which I got for $270 (they normally run close to $400 but prices are continuing to drop).

The most important thing to note and the item that caused me the most consternation -- the ability, or lack of ability to charge via USB-C.

This laptop WILL charge via USB-C, despite the warning on screen that you are not using a Dell charger!

I did NOT want a laptop that needed the traditional plug, cord, brick, cord, proprietary barrel tip set up to charge. Happy to report that the charger by Vheonet sold on Amazon works well to charge the XPS 13 9360: https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07K1ZVBFH/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_asin_title_o01_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1

Other than that, I love the screen, the keyboard, the size, weight and overall feel of the device. This is the 2nd XPS 13 we have had in the house and the 5th Dell computer. Hoping is holds up as well as all the others.

Track pad stopped working after only six months of non-daily use.

I bought this as my carry-around computer because it is small & light. Wanted to have the minimum amount of accessories. Unfortunately, since the trackpad died, I'm going to have to get a mouse.

Also, the fingerprint ID feature is really unreliable. If it doesn't work the first time, forget additional attempts, they don't work either. Then, instead of asking for your PASSWORD, the notebook asks you for your PIN. You aren't given the option of password or pin. IOW the security features on this device are a hassle. The touch ID is unreliable & the lack of options on answering an alternate security feature that you have actually memorized kind of blow with a computer that is your primary carry-around device. If I'm taking the computer out of the house, I want security features enabled. I want them to work like they are supposed to & not obstruct ME, the owner, from getting onto the device.

Returning this piece of junk after less than an hour out of the box. It looked shiny and new, but Amazon's refurbishment "experts" clearly have no expertise whatsoever. The PC was running incredibly slowly (far worse than the one I was trying to replace, which is suuuuper old), froze every time I tried to download software (all I attempted was Firefox and AVG Antivirus, I didn't get any farther than that). I had to do a hard shutdown with the power button after each download in order to access the installation file in my "downloads" folder because of the system freeze, and then the machine would freeze again if I tried to run the installation - these little installation wizards normally fire right up and take all of two minutes to complete. When I tried aborting the frozen process via the task manager, the PC would go totally blank (screen turns white, nothing on it, and again have no option but to shut down with the power button and then try again). I did six hard shutdowns in half an hour, trying to install the most basic functionality software. The 10 year old refurbed Lenovo I bought in a parking lot from a guy on Craigslist a year and a half ago works vastly better. The power cable that came with this machine (which, by the way, is super short, which might be an issue for a lot of people even buying the same computer new from the manufacturer) was in a crumpled mess in the box, so it doesn't seem like they're really trying to even create the appearance of professionalism. All Amazon's "renewal" program did was tie up $650 of my money for a while (I'll get the refund sometime after they receive the returned machine, supposedly...). I definitely won't be buying any product that Amazon is involved in making or refurbishing again, and when I get my money back, I'll just buy a brand new machine with less impressive specs for the same price - discounted pricing for better specs is useless if the machine doesn't actually work.

This is my "go to" travel laptop. It is cheap, fast, and has held up well to dragging it around the airports of the world. I did add memory (two additional banks) and a SSD drive (500MB) so it is probably as fast as a new model. The hard drive also works well as my backup storage since all I needed was a case for it. Best of all, it has both a VGA and a HDMI port for output... very handy for interfacing to older projectors and older video equipment. HDMI to older video equipment is always a big question. I use to carry five different types of adapters and hoped one would work. Now the E5410 works every time... YES!

You could probably spend a lot more but this is a great solid piece of gear that will do well on the road or in the office... And you can get a camera for it for $20 if that is important to you.

So when I was looking for a decent gaming laptop, I made an unprecedented turn to Lenovo.  I've never bought from them before, but with the deal (it was on sale) and the configuration, and honestly the reputation in the professional world, I decided to give them a try.

The good:  It is a 2019 era laptop, it (to me) was bought when they were starting to ship the 20 series nVidia gfx, literally if I waited 3 months, they were out..  That being said, the mobile 1660Ti is an amazing card and the i79750H packs a punch.  I mean, until you get to the bad part of this, the system "IS" really good.  Not too heavy, not too light (it is a performance laptop...) and a good screen on the LCD.  A real win.  Until.......

The bad:  Exactly 2 months after warranty expired (1 year warranty), one of the fans started making noise, then within days of infrequent use, stopped.  I tracked down the part number for the fan to replace it (helpful and useful info available on the Lenovo site, yea!!).  They use this company called encompass for all their official parts sales (this is the BIGGEST PROBLEM).  The part was ordered, and long story short, took over 6 months (ordered in October, received part in april, no joke).  This ONLY happened after I called Lenovo after several contact attempts with Encompass, who at one point CANCELED my order, only to then jack the price of the heatsink/fan combo (more on that later) from 58 to 89 dollars.  After complaining to Lenovo that they canceled my order and jacked the price up, my original ticket was reopened at the original price.  Still took 1.5 months (6 weeks) for a part to show up.  When it did, IT WAS USED!!  Had old thermal paste on it, but at that point I just didn't care, I used it as I was desperate to use my gaming laptop.  Mid April I installed my 'new to me, pad for new, got a used part' heatsink/fan.  3 weeks ago (so 2.5 months) IT DIED AGAIN.
I contacted encompass and did get an RMA, which I sent my bad unit back to them, at which they would send me a "new" replacement.  Guess what..  Shipping date ALREADY moved back 2 times, and now is saying the same thing it said the first time, "NO ETA - FACTORY BACKORDER".  I bet actual Lenovo tech's have no problem getting the part..  But I digress..  So two funny sidenotes about this.  1.  Encompass current price for the originall 58, then 89 dollar unit?  $160 bucks.  BOY has that thing gone up in price.  Funny bit #2?  The fan they use is actually a VERY common fan.  It is used on MANY HP, DELL, ACER and ASUS (if not more) laptops.  The difference is that Lenovo uses some form of plastic injection molding/melting process so the heatsink and fan are ONE assembly, whereas most other manufacturers use screws so at least if the fans fails, a tech or customer can easily remove the fan(s) alone and not have to replace the fans AND heatsink assembly.  To Lenovo's credit, it does seem at least one other version of the Y series laptop does in fact use removable fans, but I'm unable to tell if it was before or after this design.
It is simply for this reason I absolutely cannot recommend this product.  I shouldn't have to complain to Lenovo about their official parts supplier.  I shouldn't have to endlessly wait for 6 months once, and who knows how many more months for the next one to ship, based on my previous experience with them, this still practically new laptop is going to be useless by the time I get to actually use it again.  And will I have to call Lenovo AGAIN to actually make a part show up?  IDK, but it's not worth the hassle, and has absolutely left me scarred from making another Lenovo purchase.
The sad thing is, I work in a tech field, and our company uses hundreds of Lenovo laptops.  Their on-site repair team is top notch.  Their systems (they aren't GAMING units, business/enterprise class) run amazingly well.  (And yes, their tech's confirmed to me back in like December when I was in the middle of waiting the last time, THEY have that part, there's no shortage of ANY part to them).
The takeaway is if you are going to buy one of these, I would definitely buy an extended warranty through lenovo.  When it worked, I loved it, but since I've owned it, it's sat apart waiting on a fan more than I've gotten to use it.  Ugh.

We now have two of the Samsung Galaxy Tab 4.  These are a good size (8") tablets.  I like the 16gb memory plus we added another 64gb with a micro sd card.  If you are considering purchasing a Samsung Galaxy tablet and are considering saving money by buying the 8gb instead and getting the large micro sd card, Don't Do It!!  The problem is all apps have to have a small amount of storage on your device regardless if you store the app on the sd card.  We have never had a problem running out of space with the 16gb SamSung Galaxy. We also have a third Samsung Galaxy 8gb, but we can't down load all the apps we should because of the issue I mentioned above.  I really like this Samsung Galaxy Tablet 4.  It is a really great Tablet.  The only issue you may find is that there are not many tablet cases designs to choose from due to the 8" size. However, that does not reflect the great performance on this device.  I recommend the Samsung Galaxy Tab 4 SM-T330.

The IDEARACE Intel i5 CPU comes with a power adapter, mini WiFi antennas, a HDMI cable and some SATA cables. It has 2 USB 3.0 ports and 4 standard USB ports, 2 HDMI display ports, 6 serial ports, and a speaker / mic jack. The mini PC measures about 9"W x 7"D x 2" H with mounting holes on the bottom which could be used as a rack mounted unit.

The mini PC comes with Windows 10 Pro which is nice. It booted up clean with no bloatware. After loading the mini PC with essential basic software such as Norton antivirus and Chrome browser, it still has about 210 Gb of storage available.  The Wifi connection is also quite decent with the dual antennas.

Just like all the new PCs I received, I ran the PCmark benchmark on this unit right away which has a score of 1988. This about the same performance of a lower end 2018 Microsoft Surface Pro i5 laptop. Not a bad score but it is definitely not for high speed applications neither. The entire mini PC's case is made of good quality metal with heat sink type shapes all around for better heat dissipation. The unit does feel warm  but not burning hot neither when I laid my hand on the unit.

Overall, this mini PC is a good candidate as a general purpose desktop replacement. With the abundant amount of serial ports, it can be easily configured to control external hardware with additional programming.  It does not come with a user manual so some good experience with PC setup would be helpful.

First thing I would have to say about this mini PC is a fairly small computer. You cannot really install any additional attachment such as a low profile graphic card or another computer processor that is a bit stronger. You can however upgrade the ram and hard drive space if needed but you need to ensure that you get the appropriate ram and hard drive.  From what I can tell, it only has one slot for a single ram (standard 8 gb). This does run on older ram which is DDR3 (little disappointing). The hard drive it uses looks like an mSata drive and not an M2 drive which makes it a bit harder to upgrade as msata is not exactly new. Regardless of this, the system runs pretty well for just a mini PC. It does come with six serial ports, four x USB 3.0, four x USB 2.0 (why not make them all 3.0?), and two audio connectors. There is also two wifi antennas on the back that will pop out and you will need to ensure those do not get bent or broken as they are hard to replace. It comes with 8 gb of DDR3 ram which can be upgraded but I am unsure up to how much. It will be at least 16 gb but I do not have anything higher than a 16 gb for single stick to test that theory. There are only two HDMI ports to use for video output so you can actually run a multi screen build with this device. I did try it out and it ran okay. It was able to do your basic tasks while also watching a 4K movie on the other screen. There is no display port or DVI port which is a bit of a bummer. That being said you will get decent video quality using the HDMI port.  Upon opening it up, I saw that there is no fan in this and it does not run too hot. It runs pretty warm even when I push the computer. I found that to be a fairly decent design. It is a whole metal design so it is able to distribute the heat well throughout the computer. You are unable to install a 3.5 or 2.5 drive into this as there is no power or data connectors in this device. Although you can use this a media center computer, it works best with network and servers as you can plug in your network devices via serial ports on the back. You can easily access this device from afar when needed. There is no internal built in speakers so I would recommend if you are using this as a desktop to get a monitor with built in speakers to keep clutter down to a minimal. The device does feel a bit sluggish with the drive it is running on. There is built in wifi for 2.4 or 5 ghz. I would say it has enough USB to support the mouse, keyboard, and several ther things (most likely printer or webcam) if you want more then you will need to get an adapter. The mini PC is not too heavy as it is passively cooled. Can it run games? You basic games like minecraft can be run on it but it is not exactly meant for heavy gaming. I did try your basic games and it actually got really warm but nothing too dangerous to the PC. I also played multiple videos on there from my TV and it worked fine. It does come with windows 10 installed already so you do not have to purchase your own copy. There is bloatware that are installed on this really slows start up and I had to get rid of those. Overall I think this is a good size for a mini PC but I do feel like it does get throttled in performance due to not wanting to over heat the system. I also feel like it should have all USB 3.0 ports at this point. If you are looking for a PC that is really quiet and for your basic every day use than this will work. Just know that it does run on some older technology and you will be unable to make any real big upgrades to it.

I needed a solution for remote access to deices that had serial console access and this fit the bill. Know what you are buying.

This specific notebook has emmc HD storage 32gb, What does this mean?  It means there's no removable HD. It is physically soldered onto the motherboard. You can not upgrade the HD, no sata port at all.  With that being said this also comes with 4gb of ram, you can upgrade it your self to 8gb at a cost of around 30.00 this will help with speed.

It comes with Windows 10, the sysem will  upgrade itself eventually on you.  When this happens it will download a large file.  At the end of  this you will be left with about 4gb of free storage.  When you upgrade windows will create a file on your C drive called windows.old it is roughly 8gb, Thats the "old" version of windows 10.  Windows will automatically delete that file with in 10 days, or you can manually delete it. This will leave you with 11/12gb of storage for other applications, etc.

If you just want to surf the internet, random zoom meetings and check email. This could be for you.  Otherwise look for something more capable.

I love the physical size of this computer.  But it can't handle Windows 10 and shouldn't be sold with Windows 10.

I bought it for travel, for weekends at my beach place, and a backup for when speaking.  I only need it for some light word processing, responding to email if it takes too much typing for a phone, and maybe projecting powerpoint if there were a compatibility problem with the host's computer.

The lag caused by Windows 10 in only 4 GB of RAM is tolerable for such light usage.  But 29 GB of storage is too little for Windows 10.  It leaves only about 6 GB for files and is too small for Windows to download updates.

Solution was simple and free. (a donation is appreciated)  Replace Windows with Linux.  I used the Mint flavor [distro] with the smallest version, xfce.  In some ways I like LibreOffice better than Microsoft Office.  Firefox is better than Edge.  As a bonus, your computer should be safer.

So I only gave four stars because I had to take the time to change the operating system.

I owned the bigger one and now own this one. Reading the reviews are simply ridiculous. You have one reviewer giving it 3 stars because he didn't get the right license-which has absolutely nothing to do with the function of the laptop and then you have the other one reviewer who has forgotten it is a 12.5 inch screen laptop-So I will add my 2 cents on actual use.
1. First of all-It is considered an "ultra book" or small laptop-That is the FIRST thing you have to remember..
2. It is has ALL the high end features you find in larger laptops (14-15.6) in a 12.5 screen.
3. The screen is nice and crisp however the colors are a hit or miss...depending on what you are watching (seems that way even with TVs hence the various video options but remember..this is a small laptop)
4. Touchpad....its a touchpad-unless you have Hellboy hands-its just fine for normal people.
5. Speakers are just fine for a small room but then again-gotta slap yourself and remind yourself...its a laptop and a small one at that but it does have a speaker output for headphones.
6. Mic-It works as well as any other laptop. Using Audacity has proved 100% success.
7. CPU-Aww gee..I gotta remember...this is a laptop and a small one...but the i5/i7 cpus are perfect, especially with 16gb of ram and a 1tb SSD/NVME-its fast however I am not going to be making movies or anything major because if I was...I would get a bigger screened laptop..duh!
8. KB is just fine and its lit up.
9. Wireless-Just as good as other laptops but with 5g capability AND a sim card input for broadband on the go.
10. Portability-Woah...now we got to the meat section. Its light...its thin and its easy to carry
11. Battery life...woaaahh no more negative nancy here...10-12 hours on one charge..Now all that petty complaining turns out to be...pointless
12. Applications-Runs multiple apps at one time-no sweat. Very fast wake up from sleep and reboots are seconds..
13. The chassis-Strong and durable. made of magnesium and feels solid.
14. The touch screen..yes...it comes with a touch screen.

So folks...these are low in price now. Which is why I waited...its well worth it if you get one now-it was worth it back then..but before you call yourself an expert...make sure you are buying it for what you need.

Screen:
Terrible viewing angle. IT has a sweet spot of maybe 10 degrees. The colors are washed out or too contrasted. There is no 'good' angle.

Touchpad:
Too small. The click buttons dont feel great.

Speakers:
Inadequate. Too quiet. They face the desk.

Microphone:
Low quality. Hard to hear if there is any background noise.

CPU:
Undersized for a laptop pushing 1200 dollars. We use these as development laptops and this computer is the bane of my existence. It has turbo boost up to 3.8ghz or something but because the cooling for this laptop is so inadequate I can rarely sustain that speed.

Keyboard:
Meh. Not terrible not great. It works.
Good design and strong performance. But its screen has only 1 viewing angle, the resolution of only 1368 is too low and not sharp. This is a big minus point of it.

Only purchase phones and tablets with external storage available and of course this tablet has it. I am a retired old fart and it does everything I need except maybe a nice lady to meet and have coffee with. ha.

it's an ok tablet - nice size..  but pretty much the photos are horrendous. they turn out dark, & if what you're taking a photo of moves even a fraction of an inch, it's blurry. i didn't think the camera was supposed to be that bad, but it really is. if anyone knows how to improve it, let me know. i already tried putting it in sport mode, but it doesn't do all that much. since i was planning on using this when i go up north to take some photos (even tho i have cameras), i'm pretty disappointed in it & wonder why on earth i bought it. my older galaxy 2 epic took better photos than this thing! perhaps it'll be a little better if i'm outside & there's some sun or something..

we needed a cheap tablet for our Point of sale system at our small shop.  This one works perfectly!  plenty big enough for the square app, fast speed, no wi fi issues.  Just great overall.  Only small issue is it doesn't seem to like having more than one bluetooth device connected.  It can do it, but it gets finicky and may drop one device over another.  Irritating since we have to have one of our square readers connected via bluetooth but also want to stream music in the shop on bluetooth speakers.  I'm sure there's a workaround.

Purchased as a refurb - everything appears to be perfect except some very minor scratches on the screen.

Tablet works perfectly - fast and smooth.  It even rendered a rather large detailed drawing in a reasonably short amount of time, allowing scrolling and zooming seamlessly.  Rear camera took an adequate picture, and the front is of course fairly low resolution.  Screen was bright and clear, gave a good enough picture on Netflix and YouTube to be easily watchable.

Physically the tablet is very light and slim.  It feels as if it's a bit fragile, so I'll be very careful with it until its new case arrives.

I have had good luck with my last 2 Samsung phones, so when the time came to replace my tablet Samsung was a natural choice.  Ordered from Amazon Warehouse Deals, Prime shipping rocks.  The tablet works great, lags a bit loading some Web pages but that is to be expected.  Downloaded all of my apps from Google within the first hour and synced all my emails and accounts.  Seems to have plenty of ram and processor,  and the SD slot allows plenty of storage.  Haven't really tested the battery yet but it seems to last as long as my phone, about a day with intermittent use.

I purchased this mainly to cast music to my amplifier via Bluetooth and MDC BluOS. It works well for all of the things I use my Galaxy S7 phone for except making calls. It is nice to have a larger screen with my old eyes. The unit performs flawlessly. It has exceeded all of my expectations. With an added 64GB memory card I can easily store my music and photos. I use it when I visit my mother who is in a nursing home to show her photos of the family and friends. Before I would bring my laptop.

I got this tablet to replace an old Lenovo that finally bit the dust. The Galaxy tab A 8" has a nicer resolution. It works great for light games, surfing the internet, email, and videos. This tablet is user friendly and the processor is quick and handles applications easily. The picture quality for videos is pretty good and the sound isn't bad either. As far as picture quality goes, I'd say that it's so-so, but I didn't buy it for it's camera. Very convenient for me to take along while travelling abroad because the battery life in my opinion is excellent! Can't beat this for the money!

Bought in May 2019
Took 2 years to find a case which fit as model year was ambiguous 2017 or 2019? Samsung likes to confuse people as tablet model dimensions and controls locations are moved every year.
Apart from that, tablet speed was never very good and has degraded in past 2 years. It has gotten so bad I am getting rid of it and will use it for target practice. Piece of junk.
Also memory usage is crazy as instead of 16 GB, usable memory has degraded to almost nothing 1 GB or less. I don't store pix, video etc in internal memory and haven't downloaded many apps from playstore.
Device refuses to tell me where is all the storage going. Very frustrating.
I won't buy Samsung tablets again!

I am in love with this tablet. I was torn for months on which one to get after my Kindle broke. I'm happy to say that I'm very pleased with my purchase. The screen is an ample size, the device itself has plenty of memory, and there's tons of customization options. Sometimes with Androids, though, where the settings are can get a little lost in translation. So you have to go digging for them. But it's no issue.

The only downfall is the speaker is down on the bottom of the device, near the home button. . . which is just weird. But okay. I can live with that. For a cheap tablet, it's really a live-able mistake.

Performance doesn't feel that great even when is brand new, but then, it is old technology and it is for my mom so not a lot needed.
It all depends what are you looking for in it. If all you do is basic tasks, browse your social media, read articles, books, pay your bills, etc, this is enough.
If you do more advanced takes, I would not recommend it.

Great tablet in the price range.  Has all the features you would expect from Samsung.  Took a 64GB micro SD card and now it has lots of storage.  No issues with wireless or bluetooth connectivity or range.  It plays movies and runs apps without issue.  The screen is not as nice as my Tab Pro, but it is still daylight visible and crisp.  Have had several Samsung tablets and will continue to buy them.  I usually upgrade when I lose one.

Works good. I got this for my nephew. He's into games and music so it works great for him.  It has 16 GB of storage and works on a 1.5 GB RAM. The size is perfect for him. 8" is a good size for a tablet in my opinion. Runs on Marshmallow. I was a little disappointed because it does not have the Samsung Theme Store but its not a big issue.
Good for kids or people who just want a tablet to watch videos and do light gaming.

I wish I had read the specs more and realized how low the memory was...but outside of that it has been an amazing tablet.  Picture, sound and performance is really good.  I typically use it for recipes, games, music and streaming videos and has never had a problem.  I have been a huge supporter of the Samsung product and think its far more superior than other brands. I love that I can manipulate my own data as I please and not having to go through an app to change, delete, edit or add - Yes, Samsung has a lot of bloatware but can be removed.

This arrived in a very timely fashion, and It looked new to me.  After running all the updates the device worked perfectly.  The packaging was very secure and easy to open.  I am very happy with this transaction.  The product itself is a very functional tablet.  Great for quick research when you don't want to get up from the couch, great for watching movies on a plane.  I love how dark it can get as i like to read at night in a dark room and a too bright screen can give me a headache.  Overall I am very pleased with the product.

One complaint: Why no info on how to see/download/obtain a user manual?  When I finally contacted Samsung by phone I was e-mailed a lengthy link to download a copy ... and the first instruction in it was to read the manual BEFORE using the device.  (Of course I had been using it to try to FIND the manual.)  I like the device itself though I have yet to figure out how to use it as a full-function e-reader --- or can it do that?  As you can tell I am not a "techie."

I understand that this is a used product but that being said I have a question. Does anybody sell Fully functioning used equipment? This unit works flawlessly. The charge port however does not. It will act as if it has been plugged in but barely charges sometimes, next time it will charge just fine as long as the cord lays a certain way. Yes Ive tried 3 different cords including another brand new OEM Samsung cord. Just tired of purchasing broken stuff from dishonest sellers.

Happy, happy, joy, joy. I was super tired of watching Netflix on my phone! I wanted a bigger screen. My kid shouldn't be the only one that can have a tablet. LOL. This does exactly what I need it to and it works quickly and well. Definitely recommend if you're just needing a tablet for basic day-to-day stuff. I haven't tested it out for more work related tasks but I'm happy to say it comes with Microsoft Office Works as well. I pretty much see this tablet filling every need I may have.

What else can I say?  This tablet does just about everything the average user would need. It is relatively fast the speed depending on what WiFi you are connected to.  The size is just about perfect for carrying around with your choice of cases. My recommendation on the cases is that you purchase two of them. Buy a Poetic Turtle Skin Grip Corner/Bumper Case and also get yourself a thin leatherette HDE  Case - Ultra Slim Lightweight Folio Smart Cover. Check these out on the Web I think you will agree with me. I researched this thoroughly.
I would recommend this tablet to anyone I know.  Get one (a new one) before they sell out..!!

I've had this tablet a few days and so far I'm very happy with its performance.  The battery life is good as I've only charged it once in the two days that I've owned it.  The speed at which it operates is good too with the Android 6.0 OS.  App speed and app download speeds from Google play are good too.  The size of the tablet is perfect for viewing movies and videos with decent resolution.  I added a micro-SD card for increased storage capacity.  But because of the tablet's slim size, I found that having a decent case allowed me to hold it better.  Overall, it was a good buy at that price.

Still not sure how to rate this thing, has been problematic since day one.  I bought it mainly to watch movies from my massive PLEX servers which stream high data rates but yet the tablet rarely connects to the servers.  The tablet shuts down without any input within 10 seconds from last command.  Still having trouble with Facebook, YouTube and e-mail so I'm not sure if this is user error or just a bad tablet.  I'm having my nephew go over it to make sure it is the tablet and not me (I've been around since the telegraph was high-tech, lol) just in case I need to return it.  I was able to find a PDF file with the entire operators manual for it but at 110 pages it seems like a lot of reading to just use some simple aps and commands.  I'll update in the near future to let people interested know the outcome.

This thing is great so far. The battery seems like it will last very long on a full charge and its the perfect size when holding horizontally. I wouldnt say its blazing fast but for the price it runs very well, Id be surprised to find a better value out there for a tablet. Im struggling to find anything that I dont like about it so far, and the only thing Id point out is that the back plastic is fairly slick. It wants to slide out of your hands a bit while your holding it but I imagine thatll change when I put a case on it

These are 2015 models. I bought this tablet for my wife to use for her video chats on places like Messenger and Skype. This tablet is using Android 7.1 currently, and it is the latest update. The rendered picture during a video chat is extremely dark.  You cannot even tell who is doing the talking unless you put a flashlight in the speaker's face. I have tried it on two different chat "systems," and same result. I have tried several changes, and even reset everything back to the default settings. Some internet critics have stated this model needed a software correction two years ago, yet Samsung has not provided a correction. Other performance items of this tablet are okay. Still pictures are good, performance is nice. It is just terrible during video chats. I have only had this tablet for just over a week, but I am considering returning it.
I had This Tablet Since July 2016 And It Broke Last Year Mainly Cause me if I didn't done what I did I would still have it.

My second try with an Android device, and my experience is a little better but not great. I'm constantly bumping the screen or causing the screen to pop a series choices I don't want, I can barely get through an article I want to read. Play You-tube videos is frustrating since I inevitable hit a different video half way through and there's no back button on the terrible YouTube app. On the positive side  the screen is very nice with great detail it is useful for reading emails and responding. In general I still think Android is the problem, it still feels like a cheap imitation to IOS, I don't like the behavior of the home screen or how I have to select apps, I don't like having to root the device to get rid of Chrome which I neither need or want and considering the space used by native pre-installed apps I was hoping that I'd have more control with Android. I originally bought the device to read magazines, and this it does very well using Google News stand app. Would I recommend this device, no save you money and get an iPad like I will end up doing or just get a cheap Android tablet, Android isn't worth spending a lot of money on. I was really hopeful that I'd love this device, I'd seen it in person and I'd liked the hardware, but I see I will just sell it and by an iPad.

Sigh...I can't review it.  I bought it for my mom & she never uses it.  I wish I knew if it's good or not but sadly it will eventually become obsolete & sold for pennies on eBay.  ...Sigh...  She said she wanted a tablet on Black Friday so I got her a good one.  She soon realized she doesn't know how to use it nor is she willing to learn how to use a tablet. ...Sigh...  I think she leaves it out in plain sight when I visit cause it's always near the couch but I know shes not using it...  ...Sigh...  That's my honest review.  ...Sigh...

I bought this as a Christmas present for my 7 year old daughter. She was using an outdated Kindle Fire and she was getting frustrated because it was slow and she could not download Google Play games. She loves her new tablet! I bought a similar one for son last year so I knew this tablet would be good. This tablet is even better than the Samsung my son has. The screen is a lot bigger and it has more memory. It was easy to set up and it has Samsung Kids if you want to make sure little ones aren't viewing inappropriate content. I would definitely buy this tablet again!

First, this thing is so slippery I had to cover it with masking tape just to keep it from slipping around like a slimy fish. And where ever the screen is touched, some function turns on or off.  Trying to read a book on it is almost impossible unless you are comatose and can't move or breathe. You find your place and when you touch the device to set it down somewhere, it suddenly magnifies/decreases the page, turns on or off, goes ahead/behind to another chapter/page. Pick it up to correct it and it slips through your fingers like a wet fish.  After you have climbed out of bed to catch it again and find your place, and maybe even set the timer, then you have to place the weanie speakers right up to your ears because if you are the kind of person who likes to breathe, you won't be able to hear it because the volume is on the back of the unitand is very very weak.  So you can't see what you're doing plus HEAR anything at the same time.  Forget about listening to this thing in the car on the way to your knitting class.  Also, every time you turn on the wi fi to say, download a book, prepare to wait about 15 minutes and to lose about 98% of your battery before you can actually use it again.  When all updates are finally finished you only have 2% battery and have to recharge before listening to your audio book or checking your email. In the middle of doing anything it freezes up because suddenly you have 17 mysterious gigabytes trying to run at one time.  It is nothing at all like the more substantial Tab 2.  Its a fail :(

Our 1st generation ipad mini has come to a crawl after all these years.  We made it a kids tablet for our little one and needed a replacement but without the "premium" tax.  For sub $200 category, this offers a lot.  The display isn't anything to write home about, but for it's screens size it gets the job done.  it's nice and lightweight that my wife can throw in her purse or bag.  it has a good build, it doesn't feel disposable.  i don't expect this too last as long as the 1st gen ipad mini but that's fine because the android OS update support stops after 1-2 years anyways, which gives us a reason to get another one since it's very affordable.

Giving this rating for now because there might be an issue with the battery.  As soon as the tablet arrived I opened it and immediately without powering on the device I plugged in the charger and it displayed a battery power of 56%. I  initially charged it to full capacity. The table was not used at all after the full charged; I packaged it up with the power off. The very next day the table will not powered on.  I was shocked as to why it would not turned on after I had already gave it a fully charged. I thought it is a defected device; I connect the power charger on and the battery life level is at a zero power. How can this be!!! when it was at 100% just the day before and was never used and in powered off.  So ended up having to charge it again from 0% and charging is very slow.

I bought two - white and smokey blue.  Ironically, the same problem occurred with the other table.

For the price, I doubt you can do much better than this. Fast, feature packed, and functional. My only real gripe is the resolution. I knew it wasn't going to blow me away, but I did expect it to be better than what it is. The apps on the home screen look pixelated, and Web pages aren't as pretty as they are on my Galaxy S5. Netflix looks fine, but it still seems lacking. I feel kind of silly complaining, for the price you can't do better, and I'd gladly sacrifice a little resolution for a <$150 tablet. But I still thought it'd be better than what it is.

Yes! First off,  I love Samsung products, and when I heard about this one, I was eager to purchase it and replace my dinosaur of a tablet. The tablet has a lot of great features especially Sidesync. It would be awesome if you could see the tablet on the phone with  sidesync.  Don't know if that's possible yet. I really love the 8 inch size. It's "Goldilocks "(not too big, and not too small).  It's great that Microsoft software is pre-installed on the tablet. I don't have any major complaints except it doesn't have Swipe. I'm so used to using it on my phone. It also would be nice to be able to put like apps in one folder (just a little bit OCD on that one). Otherwise great tablet and I'm glad I purchased it!

Decent tablet for the price, nothing too fancy by any means, but has a good display, super light weight and it's a nice iPad Mini like size.

I would recommend anyone in this price range either spend a little more or find a used iPad Mini instead. This isn't a BAD tablet, but it's a $199 tablet at best. Over all it's fine for web browsing and reading books but not good for anything more than that. It struggles with anything graphic intensive. Even just loading webpages and apps it's not very fast. Just slow performance from something that's brand new for 2015..

It's a tablet, it does tablet things. It looks nice, it's lightweight. If you like the Samsung ecosystem you're good to go there. I wish the menu / back buttons on the bottom were illuminated like they are on the Samsung phones..

My last issue is there is a lack of accessories. Just a bunch of "folio" type cases.. I'd prefer something more rugged. But that's a result of the tablet being so new.. so not really a fault of the tablet.

It's okay. Not too impressed. Just a tablet by Samsung.

Great all around tablet.  I have three in my family.  It does what you expect it to. Resolution is decent and it never has connectivity issues.  The apps are smooth with little lag. The rear camera is mediocre at 5 mp. Low light shots are abyssmal.  This is a tablet and not a digital camera but many people take pictures at family events/gatherings. Samsung really cut corners here and must do better with that. Battery life is very good surprisingly. All around it is very good for daily use and streaming movies.  There aren't many decent tablets being made from any manufacturer.  This one is a good value for the money.

I needed a replacement for a four year old Asus Transformer tablet that was near top of the line when I bough the it.  I didn't want to break the bank and wanted something smaller, more book sized for reading and travel. For the prove this tablet has been great.  Good screen,  good battery life,  great form factor. The only thing I wasn't keen on was the built in memory and Touch Wiz.  The default amount of built in memory should be 32GB.  Touch Wiz puts a lot of crap between you and the OS, but it's not horrible and at least it's stable. I'd recommend it to anyone looking for a good tab at a good price.

This Tab A if awesome,even though the screen is low rent and what i mean by that is that it isnt 1080p it is 720p but it looks very nice,Sammy does very well with color saturation to make everything "pop" viewing movies on this is very good and it does very well with games even though is only has 1.2 GHZ , wish it had more space,having 16 gigs is like having 8 gigs in today's world.its quickly fills up,but being able to add more storage is a good thing i have 64 gig micro sd card in my tab but iam not able to move eveything over to the card so thats a bummer,but back to the tab,its an excellent tablet for the budget minded.i would highly recommend to my friends,ooh btw..i bought 2 of these tabs and havent had any issues whats so ever with frieezeing or crashing,they both work wonderfully.

I've had the Tab A for about a month--have been using it with an OMOTON smart case, an Anker Bluetooth keyboard, and an iKross collapsible stand.  I love it. Very portable and convenient-it does what I want (mainly email, internet, writing).  More inviting than a full-size laptop and easy to use anywhere (the car, the kitchen table, etc.), which makes it easier to get past writers block  (I can use my smartphone as a Wi-Fi hotspot for internet connectivity if need be). The 8" is just the right size for me--screen is big enough to read web pages comfortably but still very portable . No complaints about the screen resolution (I don't watch video on it or play games).  Bluetooth connectivity works well (occasional, rare, connection blips).  Long-lasting charge.  Got helpful free phone support from Samsung. [Note:  The advertised free Word and other MS Office applications are extremely limited--not worth downloading.]

I forgot how good it feels to use droid! After using my apple phone for so long I was afraid to buy the Samsung tablet, mostly for fear of its complexity. However, I love this tablet. I was originally going to purchase the 9.7 inch version because I wanted a large screen for videos and Web surfing. After reading those reviews and finding the resolution is similar between sizes, I chose the 8 inch for cost efficiency. It's the right size for on-the-go and the resolution is beautiful. I was able to get this tablet, a one year warranty and a case and screen protectors well under the cost of the 9.7 inch tablet. I am extremely happy with my purchase (no buyers remorse) and if you want a fun take with you tablet, this Samsung galaxy A is an excellent choice. I hope it stays this way after the "honeymoon phase" is over.

I own an ipad mini 2 and was a bit hesitant purchasing this tablet but upon receiving it I was very pleasantly surprised by it.
I had checked it out at a box store and was going back and forth about buying one but now that I did I am very happy.
Everything is great. This is a fine unit for the price.

I wish it had two speakers but that is not an issue as I will use my bluetooth speakers when I watch something on it. The picture is quite clear and I have not problems in reading text either.

The sound is not as good as my ipad but that is not a big issue.  The screen and body size is almost the same .. Sometimes I forget which unit I am using..

This a a nice unit.. I highly recommend it.

A great tablet for the price, but it gets slow sometimes. The screen is nice and sharp. It came with Microsoft Word, Excel, & Power Point which are nice to have but I think they might be taking up a lot of space. There was less than 6gb  remaining with everything loaded. You might be happier getting 32gb. Also, the camera sucks (hence the 4 stars). Camera on my IPhone is much better, but I did not get this tablet to take photos. I use it for FB, email, playing games, and checking the internet while I am at home. As I said, it is a nice little tablet, but you need to decide if it's what you're looking for.

I love my new tablet!  I am still learning about so I can't discuss everything I have sent reviewed here.  I can tell you that it has plenty of storage for me.  I wanted access to  games at the Google play store that I could not get through Amazon.  Another reviewer here complained about there being not enough storage for games.  Not true for me.  Before purchasing this tablet I checked to see how much space and memory  was taken up by my on line activity and games.
It was much lower than the limit on this Samsung tablet so I bought it. Kindle Fire HD 7 is great as a reader.  The program within the reader has updated so it has most of the features I like so this is a win win purchase for me.

I bought a NEW Galaxy A tablet from Liz's High End Products. I couldn't be happier. The tablet came earlier than I expected! The delivety was by priority mail instead of standard delivery! The seller also included a FREE case!  Liz's High End Products can't be beat! The price was so reasonable. The tablet is excellent. Just the kind of tablet I've been researching. I'm  so impressed with the quality of this seller's products.  I've already ordered another tablet. I can't wait to get the new one!
I'm  now a loyal customer. I'm telling all my family and friends to check out
 Liz's High End Products. I'm searching the seller's  products right now. Christmas isn't that far away. Great items for great gifts. Thank you so much for surprising me with the FREE case. Excellent deals at excellent prices!
I'll be ordering  from this seller from now on!
Maggie Morabito

This order got lost in the mail and was refunded, but purchased another one.  My daughter and I absolutely love it!!!  We both have gone through two tablets each, so that's a total of four tablets,  and the longest one worked was about a year.  I can't afford to buy new tablets at this rate and decided to go with a top brand name and do my research and it paid off.  We both love this tablet so much that I bought a second one!  My daughter has download so many games on her tablet that I didn't think it was possible to have that many.  There have not been any issues with the tablets and we use them everyday. If you're looking for a new tablet look no further because this is it and I'd recommend it to anyone.  This is why I trust and love Samsung.

Had an ipad 3rd gen loaned to me for a few months. Thought it was the coolest thing. Pictures, music, youtube... everything. I had to replace it after it was returned. The old laptop just didn't do it for me anymore. Ipads are expensive I found out. Always liked Samsung products and the specs looked great so I crossed my fingers and ordered the Tab A. I don't know what others are doing with their tablets but for my needs this Samsung has it all over the ipad. It's thinner, lighter, less power hungry, has a durable great looking screen. It plays nice with my pc,  unlike the ipad. It also has direct data or file and folder accessability. Don't know what Apple was thinking. I think cheap, fast memory has made it moot.  Anyway, the point is,  I am very happy with my purchase.

This is my first

We purchased these Samsung Galaxy Tab A 8" devices instead of laptops for all our social workers to use in the field with our clients and they absolutely love them. No one has had any problems or complaints. The tablet is lightweight and small enough to fit in their bags without taking up too much space, set up is a breeze, the screen quality is great, the processor fast enough for their needs, and multitasking between screens  has been flawless. This is an older model tablet that performs very well for the price. I liked the performance so much that I bought a Galaxy Tab S2 for myself that I am completely in love with. Our company will definitely be purchasing more of these budget friendly Samsung Tab A's as our staff increases.

I got this item years ago and never had the time to review it. When it first came, I cannot lie it was something I've always wanted and I can use for things that my phone is too small for. Now with the added years and use, I can honestly say this item is only good for awhile and does start getting slow with wear and tear. I'd definitely would recommend this for someone looking for something to begin with.

This is a very nice tablet. I also have a Ipad Pro 9.7, and although the Pro's performance is better, for 119.00 dollars you can't beat it. Do yourself a favor, get the cover that is not included. I found the tablet to be fairly well made, however, if you drop it, I doubt it will survive. With the cover on, it has a sturdy feeling, and feels well protected. I wanted an Android platform, and though different from Apple, I found it very easy and works well with Google Play store. The price is very nice and does 90% of what the Apple Pro can do, at least for what I use it for. Mileage may vary for other users who use the Apple platform. I would recommend this tablet to anyone, it's 8 inch screen is nice, and the tablet runs Apps quickly. It also can use Cromecast, which is effective for videos.

I initially bought a All-New Fire Kindle HD 8 for a 7-year-old child but I was disappointed by the screen, which even at top brightness seemed too dim and whose speakers did not go very loud. I also didn't like that it was all Amazon-specific and did not include the Google Play store.

I decided to order this one instead (basically the same price as the 32GB no-special-offers Kindle) and I am so glad I did. This is a beautiful tablet, with great bright screen, powerful speakers and good battery life. It runs games, Skype video conferences, and everything else we tried without a problem. It does not feel at all like a budget device. The only disadvantage compared with the same-price Kindle is that it has less memory (16GB) , but it does take microSD cards, so I am not concerned about that.

We paired it with the BMOUO Samsung Galaxy Tab A 8.0 Kids Case, which is also excellent.

I bought this tablet last year, and it still works good as new.  It has proven to be extremely reliable, and as a college student, i recommend it because it comes with MS office built in, which comes in handy as a student. I've used this device to write essays, assemble power point presentations, and even used one note as scratch paper while doing algebra.  Its small, but not too small. Its powerful and reliable.  Its not as beefy as some of the other galaxy tabs, but you really get a good machine in a small package. It can even run pokemon go (if you have a phone with wifi hotspot with you as well). This device has given me an edge as a student due to its capabilities in relation to its size. It does everything a tablet should do.  If you're looking for a consistently reliable tablet for a fair price, this one fits the bill.

The tablet is everything that was claimed.  The unit is light weight and the screen is beautiful. The battery lasts a long time and recharges rapidly.  However I am transitioning from a Windows 10 based tablet and am new to the Android operating system.  I expected most things at the OS level to be different, but a computer is a computer and the underlying features should be more or less the same.  The Android documentation is simply awful.  In summary, the tablet is great and what I have been able to work out with Android has been successful without glitches or crashes, but if you don't already have Android experience think twice.  Five stars for the tablet, two stars for the operating system.

Loved the tablet till it wouldn't charge consistently.  My wife has one also and she has had no problems with her unit.  I had to send it in for repair (on Dec 3) and still do not have it back (now Dec 26).  The repair was completed on 12/7.  We think it is lost in the repair facility because UPS has never received it.  Communication with Samsung Customer Service is not good.  They answer the phones and try to help but getting transferred to a supervisor who can actually do something is next to impossible.  My wife achieved this today after being on the phone for a total of over 2 hours and having been disconnected 3 times.  The 3rd customer service representative actually called her back and eventually transferred her to a supervisor.  We are supposed to hear something by the 28th the latest.  I will update when this is resolved.  Hopefully it is an isolated incident!

Overall: This Tablet was great for the price (getting 16 GB for this price, awesome). It works really well. The tablet speed is good, it battery last for a good amount of time and it doesn't take long charge. Like all of Samsung product, this product held up to its name. However, the only down side to this product would be the fact that sometime it would not charge or come on. If this happens, I would have to hold down on the power and the volume keys for about ten seconds and it would work again. I am not saying that this may happened to everyone or work  for everyone, but this was something that happen to me and the solution that works. I have this tablet for about a year and it  still works in tip top shape.

After my kindle died I wanted a tablet that will be used mainly for reading (including complex PDFs) with an episode of Netflix sprinkled in and for those purposes it's perfect!

The first thing that I wanted was a tablet that was larger than 7 inches (which this 8). My phone is about 6 inches right now and an inch more screen space wouldn't justify a new device purchase.

The next thing I wanted was a micro SD card slot...pretty obvious as to why. For reading I wanted a 4X3 aspect ratio, this is important because a lot of tablets are made to watch movies and such in 16X9 or 16X10. When put in portrait mode 4X3 gives you a wider screen to view text. I'm going to post photos to show how different reading types fit on the screen.

 Finally I wanted something that will last a while - especially since I love to read for hours on end. So far it's done everything flawlessly.

My first was underpowered, the second, not a main brand name, towards the end began glitching so often it an unfortunate, angrily frustrated end, and the last before this one was an Amazon model which - though I should have known better - was too much of a store front device. Returned it almost the same day and ordered this one the next.

Use this Samsung mainly as an e-reader and media remote for chromecast. The Youtube app while generally stable has recently begun to just stop for no reason when broadcasting to my TV, Vimeo won't run properly unless ou navigate from the video being looked at - again, this is a broadcast to TV issue - but otherwise so far every other app works well.

Don't really game with it but games I play run well enough on it.

I purchased this tablet for a 60th birthday gift for my future brother-in-law and so far so good!  Bought him a tablet so he could have the mobility in and around his house, and not have to be stuck at his desktop PC all the time. He's been using it for about a week now and has enjoyed it so far. This is his first tablet and he has been able to figure things out on his own.  He's accessed the Internet, figured out to get to the Google Play Store to download apps, has actually downloaded and used some game apps, and taken pictures with it so far.  He's enjoyed the learning process and the mobility of having a tablet.  Now he's able to sit outside on the deck and play Sudoku!  Hope this helps!  Will provide another update in a few weeks. If you have found my review helpful, please indicate below.

I love this tablet! It`s just  what I needed. First of all, I needed something portable that allowed me to use office. This is perfect. It is OTG enabled, so with an adapter, I can use a mouse and a keyboard. I can also plug in a printer and print right from the tablet.  It is also great for watching Netflix, YouTube and surfing the web. The speed and resolution are  not going to superwow you, put they are  pretty decent.
I have owned the tab 3 and the tab 4 and this is a very good update.
It is a beautiful device, looks very nice and sleek.  I'm glad I went with the 8 inch model, because it's a perfect size and compact enough to carry in my purse with no bulk.

I've been using it for about three weeks and so far no complaints!

It's an okay tablet.  The newer android version means you can't do things with an SD card that you used to be able to.  The fact that there's pre-installed MS apps:  If you need them, great.  If like me you don't need them?  You can force stop/disable, but there is no way to uninstall them.  that means there's apps taking up a lot of room when added together.  Have just a few apps I d/l, nothing fancy or super huge.  But since you can't move apps, etc. to an SD card (bought with - don't even know if it works!) you're looking at using up a good chunk of the 16Gb this tablet comes with.

Screen is nice and clear, easy to hold, fast enough.  The camera (I know, tablet cameras usually aren't super) is terrible imho and I'm talking about the back camera.  Also do not like where the back camera is.  It's just not serving the purpose I bought it for at all.  Very disappointed with Samsung and this tablet.  I don't buy things often and when I do, I don't buy something to be completely frustrated by it.  Will be returning and guess for now I'll just stay with my Samsung Tab Pro 8.4 even though it's far behind the current android version.  It's not like I'm doing anything sensitive on it.

I bought two of these 8" tablets for my kids, and they absolutely love them. They are the perfect size (a child doesn't need a huge display, but 8" is still pretty big!), a perfect balance of features, and run very well everything they do and play on them. The 16 GB internal flash drive is more than enough for dozens of games they keep stuff in their device, and even better - I could add another SD card (I added 32 GB) for storing things like photos and movies and leave the 16 GB just for apps. A welcome surprise is that unlike many other devices, this one supports out of the box dozens of languages (including the one I cared about, Hebrew).
I really recommend getting with this tablet also this cover, which protects the tablet from all directions (including the screen), and makes it easy to turn the table on and off just by flipping the cover:

I was looking for a tablet or reader for travel. After doing a bunch of comparisons, it came down to the Amazon Paperwhite, Kindle HD 8", or the Samsung Tab A 8.0 (I really wanted the Samsung S2 or S3, but couldn't justify the cost). The Paperwhite screen was only 6", which was too small for me. So, the Kindle vs Tab A. I finally decided that I didn't want to lock myself into the Amazon ecosystem, so I chose the Tab A.

So far, I'm loving it. Perfect size for reading (about the size of a hardback book, definitely bigger than a paperback). I downloaded the Netflix app. Yes, I prefer a bigger screen, but it's perfect for an occasional flight in a cramped seat. My MP3 files sound great, and all of my reading apps run flawlessly. The only wart is that the Tab A 8.0 only has one speaker, so the only way to get stereo sound is via external speakers or ear buds. No biggie, since I bought this for its portability.

All in all  I couldn't be happier.

Fed up replacing the "Fire" for the 5th time (literally) due to faulty charging ports, i finally got smart and looked for a suitable replacement . Here she is

After weeks of searching, reading reviews, comparing prices, pros and cons, i decided on the Galaxy 8 and couldn't be happier.
