That is one of the reasons I wanted to get away from Windows, and now it is starting to be the same with Chrome. So unhappy with Alphabet/Google. Maybe i need to start considering Apple.....

We've had three different "budget" Chromebooks, the Acer C720, Acer Chromebook 14 and this HP Chromebook 14 G5.  Of the three, the C720 has lasted the longest. We have young kids who are hard on the machines and only the C720 lasted.

This one only lasted one year. The trackpad is caput. It felt sturdy and of similar build quality to the C720 but ultimately it couldn't stand the test of time. Even the Acer 14 seemed to be more fragile despite it's aluminum body but that one we got two solid years of use out of.

I have to say we're disappointed with the longevity of the HP 14 G5. I was hoping it could permanently replace the C720 but it didn't.

If you don't have young kids who abuse your electronics then this is probably a fine option. It had the juice to run Android apps and we never felt it was underpowered for general web surfing, Google Docs or remoting into a work desktop with Google's remote access tool. I'm sure if it were better cared for it would have lasted much longer.

Let me start with saying, the chromebook is really nicely designed. Very lightweight. Love that it can go from computer to tablet..... BUT I feel that since this is my second purchase of the computer, I can leave an honest review. The first purchase we made, the computer kept restarting. We could not do anything. We returned it (to the store) and we purchased the same one online because we figured the other one was defective. No.. It does not restart constantly but it still restarts making the computer untrustworthy.  I wanted to use it for my son and also my nursing classes but unfortunately I am forced to purchase another one (DIFFERENT brand).

This Chromebook is a powerful thing. I can see things way better on a 14 Screen rather than a 11 Screen. The Color on the display is true-to-life and very vibrant. The color of the laptop exterior is my favorite part. HP Laptops have always been reliable, even more so with chrome inside. The laptop is super fast and very lightweight. I am definitely glad this thing comes with a warranty as well, seeing accidents happen at home or school. I intend to use this for the incoming school year and hope it meets my expectations.... so far so good. The price was very good for such a great laptop and definitely recommend.

When we bought this the first time, it worked great. One afternoon, I was minding my own business, using the computer when suddenly the screen turned grey, and then shut off. We were then unable to restart it. We then purchased the same computer again, and the same thing happened to me just today. We only got about two to three weeks use out of both of them. Therfore, it's probably not a good idea to buy these computers.

I love my new HP "14 Chromebook (14-ca040nr).  I basically use this Chromebook like a tablet.  Put another way I don't use it for work, nor for heavy duty computing.  I use it to stream videos, check email, shop on line and visit websites, to gather information.  For these type of activities, this product works fabulously well.  It is very small and light.  So far, it seems very durable and well built.  I am extremely pleased with the battery life.  10 hours is not an exaggeration.  The screen quality is also very high and video detail is excellent.  I'm very pleased with my HP Chromebook, and have no complaints thus far.

I bought this laptop to type my notes while i'm at work and at home for watching online dramas. This Chromebook  is fast and lightweight. Defiantly worth every penny I spent on it, and since Chromebooks are cheap. That's saying something. Great investment. I should of bought one sooner.

Loveee this laptop! The pure white color looks so pretty! I think it is so cool that it is touch screen and a can convert into a tablet. I teach students online and this has been a life changer. My previous laptop is bigger in size and slower since it is a few years old. This one connects well to my wifi and the video connections does not lag. I also like that I can carry it anywhere since it is small and lightweight. I have been using it for about 3 months now. To have the features of this laptop for such a cheap price is a dream come true.

*Update: Feb 6, 2020
Used this almost everyday since I have purchased it and it is still running strong! I am still in love with it!

**Update: Dec 2, 2022
I no longer have to use this laptop as my occupation everyday, but I do use this for my own leisure and it's still going strong!

This review is for the NON-touch screen 14-ca040nr.  Reviews get lumped together, so it's good to know which product you're reading about.

I'm a semi-retired IT technician, so this review comes from that standpoint.

If you're not familiar with the Chrome operating system you may want to do some independent research before purchasing a Chromebook.  While they are designed around Cloud computing (with most data being saved in Google Docs rather than locally), it's quite possible to work with the machine offline.  You can specify in Google Docs that files should be available "offline"; a copy of the file is kept locally and syncs back to the Cloud when WiFi becomes available.

Google Docs (word processor, spreadsheet, presentation software) all come with your Gmail account and is the "base" set of applications used by most folks on a Chromebook.

I've enabled Linux on the HP, and installed LibreOffice - primarily because there's no database application in Google Docs and I do a bit of work in databases.  Linux works very well on the HP for that purpose.

Linux also allows the installation of GIMP, which is a PhotoShop type image editor.

[EDIT 9/30/18 - I should note that Linux documents (such as you may create in LibreOffice) should be kept within the Linux folder structure.  Keeping such files on an SD drive doesn't work - Linux can't "see" that drive.  There may be a method to guide Linux to the proper folder.  If I take time to figure that out I'll update the review.  In the interim, plan on using a bit of the 32gb of internal space for LibreOffice docs.  The upside is that, of course, such documents are totally independent of the Cloud, just like they would be on a Windows machine).

I've enabled File System For Windows (another app) which allows me to contact to my Windows 10 Pro machine and transfer files to and from while on the same network.  Chrome RDP allows me to take control of the Windows machine while on the same network and Chrome Remote Desktop allows access to the Windows machine from wherever there is an Internet connection (without direct file transfer - if you need to swap a file, just drop it into Google Drive).

If you're a DropBox user, you can install File System for DropBox on the Chromebook.

Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, OneNote, OneDrive, Outlook, etc. are all available from the Microsoft web applications.  Microsoft Access is not available on the web apps.  There are also Android apps for Microsoft (which I don't use, I use the web apps).  If you have encrypted Word or Excel files the M/S web apps can't open them.  You can install the (free) WPS office suite and it can open password locked Microsoft documents just fine.  If you enable Linux, LibreOffice can also open encrypted Microsoft documents.

Splashtop for Business works using their web app, and from that I can log into remote Windows machines (including  Windows Server 12r2).

As you can see, quite a bit of work can be done using a Chromebook - it all depends upon your needs and the setup.

The HP has a decent, but not great, keyboard.  Battery life is excellent.  Be advised - there's no dedicated "delete" key or "caps lock" key.  You can remap the "search" key to emulate a "caps lock" key but that affects cursor movement if you're working in Google Docs.  If you haven't used a Chromebook before, Google for how the keyboard works.  Takes a little getting used to, but it's doable.

There's a micro-SD card slot (I'm using a 32gb card, but it will accept larger cards if need be).  Remember that, while Chromebooks are fairly secure, the card is not encrypted by default.  There are encryption apps available for locking down the SD card.

The screen (the non-touch version) is O.K.; it doesn't come close to the Pixel screen but it costs only 1/4 as much as a Pixel.

The charger (included) plugs into either of two USB C ports - one on each side of the machine.  The machine also offers two USB A ports.

The touch-pad is good - it doesn't get in the way when typing.  However the "mouse clicks" on the pad are 'way too hard and loud.  In a library setting it would become annoying very quickly.  Better to use the 'double tap' on the touch-pad rather than click the corners.

The speakers, for this size of machine in this price range, are excellent.  (I'm not an audiophile, but they sound pretty good to me).  Unlike many lower priced units the speakers are on the Chromebook surface, not underneath or to the sides.  [EDIT 9/30/18 - Using the on board Bluetooth I was able to successfully "pair" the HP with an Amazon Echo.  Playing .MP3 files from the SD card using the on board Audio app works fine.]

Printing is still a bit of an issue with Chromebooks - if you've not used Chromebooks before, do some research on printing lest you be surprised.  Remember that Chromebooks don't accept ".exe" programs (so you can't load M/S Office from a DVD) and you can't load printer drivers (there are work-arounds but you'll have to look 'em up on your own).  Google Cloud Print is supported.  Still, most printers aren't 'plug 'n play' by simply plugging in a USB cable.  I'm printing to a Samsung, a Kodak 7.1, and an old HP4050n which is hooked up to a Windows 10 machine via Ethernet.  It may take a little more effort than you're used to with "plug 'n play" Windows.

There's no Ethernet port on the machine, but you can get adapters that use the USB C ports and have Ethernet connections.  Wi-Fi and Bluetooth are, of course, supported by default.

The power switch is above the "backspace" key and not likely to be hit accidentally - an improvement over my last Chromebook.

One note on Cloud storage - Google offers a 100gb "free" upgrade for two years (after that if you use more than the 15gb that comes with a Gmail account you have to start paying).  You can Google that - but be aware that if you have multiple Chromebooks (as I do) assigned to one Gmail account, you can't "stack" or extend the 100gb offer.  It's 100gb total for each account.  IMHO Google should change their policy on this and, if a new device is purchased for the existing account, the 100gb offer should be extended from the new date of purchase.  YMMV.

YouTube videos seem to play well - I don't play games or watch Netflix on the machine, it's more of a workhorse for me.

Out of the 32gb total internal storage, after Linux and all other apps that I use are installed, I have 18gb free space (not including the SD card).

Fit and finish is good (although the machine is basically plastic) and it weighs about 3 pounds (again, the non-touch screen version).  It is, for me, a true "laptop" machine in that the bottom doesn't get too hot to hold when it's in my lap.

Overall I'm really pleased with the HP 14-ca040nr.  I've read reviews that say that Chromebooks don't work offline, or don't offer software - and those reviews are wrong.  You just have to set the machine up properly.

HTH

Regards,

Jim

size

I chose this to replace an older Chromebook that is no longer supported.  These are quick and easy workhorses.  The setup rebuilt all my files and apps, login's and passwords for me. Too easy.  I use it for Gmail, Facebook, maps and news feeds.  Seems to last as long as I need it to daily. I also enjoy reading books on it.  Turned to portrait position, It's just about the size of a book page.  Yu can enlarge the type and it keeps up with where you are.  Nice tool. I split time in tablet mode and keyboard mode.  Touchscreen and mouse pad are fine.

This is a no nonsense workstation for whatever workloads you can throw at. Graphics is crisp with the RTX 3080, and the memory as is sufficient (and you can max out to 128GB if needed).

For the uninitiated, this laptop and any ThinkPad for that matter, is not known for its looks, but more than makes up in performance and ease of use.

This is a heavyduty - both in name and performance - workstation. The charger (230W brick) is heavy in itself, so you'd better get a padded backpack to carry this if you would be lugging this along.
A gift for my son,  he loves it. Uses it a lot.
I am very happy with my purchases. Also I got the items very quickly, which was great!
Fantastic tablet. Powerful processor runs apps super fast. Beautiful screen for reading or watching movies. Would definitely buy again.
This is a great tablet. It's fast, works well, has good battery life, etc.
Great Samsung tablet, colors and graphics are phenomenal and the screen sensitivity is excellent
Love and live on this thing and with kodi now ive seen every movie there is out there.
Best gift I ever bought my wife (other than her Anniversary bands)  :-)
My wife loves it and if she's happy, I'm happy.
I love it... have it for a year now... still works wonderful plus, great pictures quality... very fast
I have owned kindle, Kindle hdx, Samsung Galaxy tab 4 10 1", now the S2 9.7. This one is perfect.
It is all that it says it is!  I enjoyed the fact that I could download the Hunger Games trilogy for free!
Ive had this tablet for 4 days and have done pretty mich nothing with, once i did decide to use it It out of the blue gets stuck on the logo screen and wont turn off.
Better than expected ordered a WiFi tap s2 9.7 got a new cellular cdma WiFi s2 9.7 bonus works great
Speedy tablet but the battery life is sub-par
Love this Tab, so much cheaper then the air and the screen and speed is so posed to be better.
It is great.  Was nice to get it at a discounted price.  It was my daughter's Christmas resent.  She uses it everyday.
Got this as a gift for my wife and she loves it, makes me wish I had one.

Great product, but it made my eyes hurt. I adjusted the settings yet my eyes was still uncomfortable. I bought the Samsung 10.1 tablet and no issue with my eyes. The only drawback... no finger print scanner on the Samsung 10.1.
I use this constantly. Looked at countless reviews and opinions...  This is the best one I could find , and very happy with it!!!
Nothing to say except LOVE IT!  Quality, ease-of-use...everything. Easy to set up as well.  Blows all my other tabs that I've had out of the water.

We ordered this product for use at work, got it started and set up, then within 2 days the tablet stopped taking a charge. Attempted to call customer service from Samsung who stated it would be WEEKS before we would get it back. Our house is run by Samsung and we have two phones that need to be upgraded, but after this poor service we are very hesitant to remain brand loyal.
The picture is INCREDIBLE. I love this tablet in so many ways. Since I also have a Galaxy phone,there was no learning curve to using the tablet for me.
Perfect
I ended  buying  this after going through  three  of the Samsung  10.1 580 tablet in two weeks this one has far  seceded my hopes
Got this for my MiL for my FIL to give to her for Xmas. She loves it! I got a similar  erosion for V-DAY from my husband and REALLY love it!
Be aware it doesn't support partition larger than 2TB via OTG drive, and it doesn't support Unicode filename completely - file gets lost with Unicode characters.
My most favorite tablet I have ever bought! It's fast, HD, and lightweight! Use it to play games, watch movies, browse the internet, and much more! Great work, Samsung!
Nice feel.

Ordered this brand new and it came in already opened with some scratches on the side of the metal, hair all over the rim of the reapplied plastic film on the back, and the micro sd tool came in a plastic lunch bag. I know this is a decent product but I did pay for brand new not used.
Got this for my fiance as a Christmas present and he absolutely loves it. He likes his Samsung smartphones so that is why i decided to go with the Samsung tablet. Glad I made this purchase.
Love my new tablet. I have been using Samsung for about a decade now. I had been using the 7 inch note before this. The jump to 3G  of ram was noticable, the screen looks amazing.
i love the way it runs but volume button damage on it. not sure it was brand new. still works great but i paid for new. so 3 stars.
Very happy I purchased this tablet.  When I ordered  the Galaxy,it was a toss up between this and a kindle fire.  Both are good products but for me the Galaxy is better for my needs.
Best Android tablet I have ever encountered.
Perfect size and weight for ou use.

Half of the apps don't work.
Good battery life.
Good camera.
After a while stopped recognizing the external SD card (Samsung EVO) and destroyed all the photos it contained
i really like this tablet. the screen is very clear. it is very fast and i like  that it charges through micro-usb and not a special plug like the other galaxy tablet that i bought 3 yrs ago,
I love it. Great tablet it really surpassed my expectations for it. I used to think a tablet was just an oversized phone but now I think tablets  have established themselves as a standalone product.
Works like a boss with my phantom 4. Leaves my ipad air 2 in the dust. Games are faster, video is better, and price is waaaay better. Not sure why I was an apple fanboi before.
This is so much lighter,thinner than my older Galaxy tab. I love it. It doesn't have a stylus pen, but then, I rarely use the pen on my older tab.  Very easy to use and so convenient. Love it.
Like it overall, except fingerprint feature that doesn't work well

Fits perfectly, with almost no margin for error. Surprisingly easy to install given how exactly it must be placed. I had to pull it off twice to adjust its placement but I ended up getting it on perfectly.
Work good hard to start sometimes and deleted email mails
This is just the best.  Easy to use, easy to see and comes with all the bells and whistles you could ask for in a tablet.  I haven't used my laptop since I got this great tablet.
Works great but it has the worst battery life

Wow! I absolutely LOCE this tablet originally purchased the 8.0 screen but returned it for the 9.7 and I am so happy I did. Tablet is ultra fast..it displays such beautiful vivid colors. I am so pleased with this Samsung product. Buy it! Seeing is believing!

This is my 5th Samsung for my own use and this certainly seems to be the best.The screen has great clarity and processor is fast. Like it a lot. I do like the larger screen size on my other tabs but the picture on this is superior.
My wife loves this tablet. It has a great screen and is light yet solid.
Easy install but one corner seems to have a rough edge and no matter what I do it won't lay down.
Works great.  Likexpect it better than my ipad.  Only downside is battery charge doesn't last quite as long.

I was very sceptical to order a refurbished product after reading few reviews where they reported scratches or tablet not turning on etc..However the one what I received looks like new and it works perfect. Am happy for the purchase.

I love this tablet. No complains so far. Beautiful line and design, good sound and resolution. The battery life is ok. I have to recharge everyday for at least 30 min, but that is to be expected. I wish it came with a better file manager but I guess there are apps for that.

I love the tablet when it works. It arrived as what I am assuming, a brand new item. This is my first tablet I have ever purchased/owned so wasn't sure what to expect. This tablet is constantly shutting off on me and wont respond/turn back on for about 30 seconds each time. Super annoying when I'm in the middle of something like trying to read an article, watch a video, or play a game. Not sure if other people were or are having this issue or if it's something I'm doing to cause it? Even when I don't touch anything, it does it.
The tablet is good but it's highest sound is low. Even if noise in room increases little bit the sound from this tablet is not audible enough at full volume also.

Great product so far! Just received this today. It is the first tablet I now own, so I am no techy, but I am impressed with the fluidity of the screen and I am getting used to the tablet format of things. This is gonna be my on-the-go buddy from now on, especially with the Microsoft Office apps.

I ordered the tab s2 9.7 inch 32GB. I took a risk in ordering a product that had minor cosmetic damage. Well knowing that it might just be the box That's damaged. I received my tab s2 today excellent condition no scratches brand n
new just the Box had the plastic seals ripped but it's nothing noticeable. 100% Satisfied
I like the tablet mostly, except that support is so limited.  I have spent hours trying to get my Samsung or Google calendars to sync between my Samsung phone and the tablet.
This is a great Tablet.  My only complaint would be run time/charge time which is just a little on the light side.  Operationally, it does everything else well.  I would recommend it.

Wife loves it. She'd complain about her iPad all the time, slow, lockups, etc. The tab runs fast and with no problems. Only problem is when she has to recharge is, she hates having to use her notebook. Might cost more than the cheaper noname brands, but well worth it in the long run. Invest in this, you will not be sorry.

Great job Samsung ! This pad is fast and smooth. I would guess that the screen on this is about as good as you make it for the human eye. Pretty much every just pops when you request it to load. Very happy with it. I  have had four other tablets and I didn't think I would very see one this smooth.

I have purchased 4 Samsung tablets of varying qualities from Amazon.  This was just out when I purchased it.  It has seen daily use.  And I took excellent care of it.  It stopped taking a charge recently and will not turn on.  Every Samsung tablet I have purchased to date has had this problem. It just stops taking a charge after around 1.5 to  2 years of use.  I will not be purchasing another tablet from Amazon.  The protection policy I bought was no good either.  Amazon did me a disservice.

With all this scary stuff going on with the Note 7 don't let that prevent you from getting this tablet. It is amazingly light, lighter than my iPhone 6S Plus and feels great in the hand. The device is fast, can run custom roms and be rooted. The screen is beautiful as well. Just buy it.

My IPad needs repair and I thought this might be a good alternative.  It works just fine though I miss the feel of my Ipad.  The Tab S2 is amazingly  thin and light weight and, for the money, a very good value.  I haven't bought a screen protector or case yet, but I have dropped this twice and there is no visible damage
I love my tablet it's everything and more then expected, this was a hot item and you guys had it...awesome product I will buy again from you...

So glad I got this instead of another iPad to replace my old iPad!  It took a long time, but after first starting it up and signing in, it downloaded all my apps from my Samsung Note 4 phone, so it was super easy to set up!  Fast, powerful, great picture, takes a 128 gp micro sd card, thin, and light.  Definitely recommend over the iPad!!

I like it a lot, only complaint so far is that when deleting emails you can only delete one at a time, unlike gmail where you can check the mails that you want to delete and then delete them all at one time.

A little marvel. The tablet is exceptionally light and well made. I haven't found anything yet to slow it down: everything works really fast. The much praised OLED screen is a missed blessing though: you do get perfect black with it, but the green tint really shows itself when view angle is not strictly perpendicular.
But hey, you want good colours, you buy a PC monitor that costs two times more than this tablet.

The product came as advertised. New packaging and obviously a new tablet. So much faster than my four year old 10.1 Galaxy tab. Soooo much faster. Absolutely love it! Samsung makes upgrading so easy to with smart switch. Copied everything, including apps, from my old tab to the new in under an hour. The display just blows away the newest Ipad side by side. Got a great price from the seller and love my new tablet.

What's not to love about this SG Tab S2!  I chose the 9.7" size which is just right...can still slip in most of my handbags.  Amoled screen is beautiful. It is very fast.  I added a 64 GB micro SD card for any apps that can be moved there to free up device storage.  Also use to store music, etc. Tab use is easy and intuitive.  I highly recommend this Tablet...thin, lightweight, easy to use.

My wife had an iPad prior to this tablet, one day all of a sudden, the screen went black.  We took it to the Apple store and they could not repair it. Normally I am not an Apple guy the only reason we purchased it was because there was an application that I could not get on android. So we purchase this tablet and it has been awesome my wife loves it

Amazing tablet - especially after having the original iPad one!  Display is gorgeous, easy to use - especially correcting text and has a delete key, which is something the iPad didn't.  Sound quality just w/ the tablet is amazing when using Spotify. I vetted this between the new iPad and reviews said the iPad had a higher quality than the "plastic" Samsung and wondered about that, but it is extremely high quality and I couldn't be happier w/ my choice.

I used this for 3 years now and it realy is a great tablet. It gets everything working. The battery is a little short living after 3 years of heavy usage, although it still lasts one day wihtout problems. Now you probably have better options. But this is a great one if you are on budget.

This is a great tablet I like how smooth it runs.no lag issues alot of the apps I use run so smooth on this beautiful tablet. It is great for game play or any other purpose. The screen is bright and vibrant. The octa core is very handy in keeping this device running smoothly, I am happy you can expand your memory with an SD card. I use this daily. Ice used many samsung tablets in the past this is definitely a huge step up.

Too expensive. Great tablet, but still second best behind Air 2 (I know the spec is bettter in some area, but Air 2 still better device when actual hand on. Just like I had a low end digital camera that took much better pictures than expensive high-end pixels canon). Tab S2 will not win over Air 2. I bought this tablet because I want android tablet. If I don't mind IOS and itune. Air 2 is a better tablet even for same price. A copy cat and 10% more expensive is just a bad way to do bussiness in general.

Quality midrange priced tablet that is as good or better than jpad. Google play app store is great and so much better than amazon Kindle app store. Tablet is fast and easy to use. Onscreen keyboard is better than ipad (has alphabet and numerical on same keyboard). Tablet also has built in back button on tablet as well as home and multi window button. Battery is decent - watching movie on 3 hr flight only took battery from 100 to 85%. Only downfall would be the android OS which can be buggy.

Awesome screen. Super light. Wicked speed.
My first one arrived with a weird defect on the back cover that I thought was only cosmetic. Within two days though the letter M in Samsung came partially detached and gave me a paper cut (its made of some thick foil). I decided that for $400 I deserve one that isn't going to pick my finger and exchanged it through Amazon. Great customer service with Amazon, too.

Beautiful, thin, fast, and easy to use tablet. It is shockingly thin, though as you'll see in any reviews you read, this does have a negative impact on battery life. Still, the tablet is fast, comes with all the benefits of Android, has a nifty fingerprint scanner that works just like the TouchID on Apple products, and has a gorgeous screen. Strongly recommended for anyone looking for a top of the line Android tablet!

Really well made tablet. I purchased a 64Gb card to add to this and it has everything we need for a mobile device like this. We use it for our travel and for around the house when using a laptop is just too much. For example watching a show on tv you may get an idea and want to research it. Performance-wise it is very responsive. Seems on par or slightly better than the iPad we had in 2015. The Pictures are VERY clear and the shutter responds rapidly. I like the flexibility if storage and applications this has over the iPad. I can see why it is becoming so popular.

Great tablet.  Lightweight, thin, excellent screen, great sound.  But if you turn it off, then plug it in to recharge, the tablet turns itself back on.  It is very difficult to get the think to stay off while it is charging.  This seems to be a common problem with this tablet.  I hope it gets resolved soon.  ...If not for this problem, I'd give the tablet a rating of 5 stars.

very quick and smooth tablet .  the charger that came in the box was defective so both samsung and amazon sent me new ones.  very pleased with  Microsoft Word and all other features.  accessories I've added are: Vostrostone  Samsung Galaxy Tab S2 9.7 Keyboard case, KuGi  High quality Ultra-thin Detachable Bluetooth Keyboard Stand Portfolio Case / Cover+ Free stylus & OTG cable for Samsung Galaxy Tab S2 9.7 tablet,  and, Tonor Bluetooth 3.0 Wireless Mouse Ultra Slim Portable Optical Mouse 800/1200/1600 DPI  both work great with Bluetooth and handy for typing and editing.  truly portable.  tablet Bluetooth also connects to my little speaker for Pandora or Netflix

Purchased for my son for Christmas.  I had purchased an earlier generation of this tablet for him about 4 years ago, and he was complaining that it is finally wearing out, so I chose to get him the same brand again.  I also had to buy him a new cover for this tablet, since the cover for the earlier model didn't fit this one - evidently, manufacturers change their dimensions marginally in one direction or another so you can't reuse your covers.  I must leave it to a more technologically savvy reviewer to discuss the performance, but suffice it to say that my son likes the Galaxy tablets very much.

This brand of tablet was highly recommended to me by 2 friends from work & I see why they also loved this tablet.  I have been using it now for 6 months & it has run flawlessly.  The weight of it feels just right & even with the case that I added to it: https://www.amazon.com/Logitech-Keyboard-Samsung-Galaxy-920-007985/dp/B01798WM38/ref=cm_rdp_product , it is not too heavy.  Love the convenience of the additional storage card option.  This is my first Android product & it took me a bit to get used to the operational aspects.  I love it, my wife doesn't, so I guess we know who is using this most......easily recommended product overall.

I bought this tablet because my old one was running too slow. It gave me nearly five years. The tab S2 is very fast and responds quickly to commands. With 3 gigs of RAM, it can get in and out of programs very quickly. It has a high def display. The screen is absolutely beautiful. It is important to note that these new tablets are built similar to phones which is why they have both landscape and portrait displays. At 9.7 inches, the screen is more than big enough. Very good investment.

At the price I picked this up (<$200), it is great .  I work a professional job where I am meeting clients at their offices, and I use primary for basic office functions (sheets, docs, ect)/ email.  It works great for that, internet surfing, online shopping and watching videos.  Great screen quality and fast enough.

For slightly more intensive apps like games, this might not be ideal being that it is a few years old.  However, for a low price, this is a great economy tablet.

Bought one for my wife. Used it while setting it up for her. Why should she have all the fun. Bought one for myself. It is a superconvenient tool for the web, movies, pictures, reading books, all on a bright, highly pixelated screen for its size with outstanding clarity. I looked seriously at the 12.2 /Samsung but the nearly double price wasn't worth the small additional viewing area. Treat yourself in 2016. This is a beauty of a machine. Got mine in Wi-Fi, I have a Samsung Note smart phone for out of the house communications. Picture taking results are outstanding. Would have liked a longer lasting battery though. Samsung do something about this. I am on this honey most of the day. Teamed them both with a ProCase Folio Case Cover. Life is good.

Great screen, numerous options and configurations. Can hook up blue tooth mouse and keyboard for a laptop-like experience but Android is not optimized for that. Does not ever seem to get hung up when I run apps. A Windows 10 version would be even better. Great for media consumption as the screen is very rich and has high contrast. Web pages and video really pop.

Don't buy this for lots of productivty work. You need a full operating system for that. The Tab s2 9.7 is great at what it is - a Tablet for media consumption, email and web surfing. Don't try to make it what's it not and then hold it against it. Also - the 4:3 aspect ratio on a screen this size really helps make icons pop, and the interface big enough to click.

To be fair, I just received this two days ago. When it asks if I want to use Chrome or Internet, if I choose Chrome I get a pop up that says "Unfortunately, Chrome has stopped." Every time. No choices but to say Ok. It's not Ok. What is up with this? I also want to move my contacts over, but that hasn't happened yet, either. However, when I opened my Calendar for the first time, my husbands entire calendar was there! We have no connection except both use gmail. But how did his calendar get over and not mine? Another mystery. I love my Samsung Note 3 phone so thought it would be a seamless transition. Not so. I might be sending this back. Too bad as I bought a case and screen savers and keyboard to go with it.
Update: I had to uninstall and reinstall Chrome. Then I had to install another app to bring my contacts and gallery over. I'll use it today and see how it works.

Very happy with this purchase. Beautiful, light, fast and completely functional tablet at a great price. The HD Super AMOLED screen is a plus with its vivid colors and crisp images. It's refurbished, but you couldn't tell as it looks and works like new. I only give it four stars because it came with a generic charger that took at least seven or eight hours to charge from 0 to 100%. Bought a Samsung original charger at Best Buy and that solved the problem. Now it takes 3 to 4 hours to get a complete charge, which is normal considering this tablet doesn't have fast charging capabilities.100% satisfied!

I would have given this 5 starts except for two reasons:

1.) The plastic case is very slick. My old Nexus 10 had a bit of rubber on the case giving it a nice, natural grip when holding it. This tablet is just a slick plastic that I feel could slide out of my hands unless I am lifting it from the bottom.

2.) The speaker is pretty weak. There is only 1 and it is on the side, not even front facing. I get they did this to reduce bezel and width, but I felt like they could have added at least another speaker on the other side to give more a stereo effect.

Other than that this tablet is great. Bright, crisp screen. Very fast and responsive. Everything I am looking for to replace my old Nexus 10

A month in with this tablet and I'm generally really happy with it. Samsung's Android skin is extremely smooth, adds function without clouding the Android experience. Hardware powers through websites and apps without a second thought. The screen is gorgeous, deep colors and crisp blacks. Its difficult to look at my new LG G4 phone after looking at this screen; it just pales in comparison.

Big gripe, though: the battery on this thing... well, it sucks. Its really bad. It will not last more than a 3-4 hours of a lazy afternoon's heavy use (browsing imgur, a video here / there, web browsing). I have to turn it off whenever I'm not using it, otherwise it has to be tethered to it's charger.

Lastly, the thumb print scanner is not functional. Not worth the headache of setting it up. It fails no matter how carefully you replicate your initial placement. Would be nice to have an update where it continued to learn your print in the future, to make the scan more efficient.

All said and done, this is very likely the best Android tablet on the market.... for now. Google's Pixel C tablet comes out soon and I need to figure out a way to swap this Samsung for that new beast.

The tablet is very thin and light.  Very easy to hold with one hand for reading.  The screen is beautiful, and it has plenty of power for playing games.  There are just a couple of small things I wish they would have added to the tablet.  It doesn't seem to have any notification lights like you have on phones.  So, if I get messages when the sound is off, I don't know that they came in.  It also doesn't seem to have a vibrate setting, so notifications are either muted or noisy.  Having a Galaxy S5 phone, so I expected a USB3 charging port on the tablet, but it just had a regular micro-USB port.  The battery lasts a long time, and I've often charged it over night, so I'm not sure how long it takes to charge, or if having the USB3 port would make it charge faster.  Overall though, it's a great tablet.  I'm very happy with it.  I'd recommend it for sure.

Okay, its not a big secret that I am fans of the Samsung tablet lines. The screen looks great when I look at my pictures, there is no complaint there, the 4-3 ratio is a little bit weird unless you are a reader than it will work out well for you. Watching HD movies is not a bad thing, but you will notice that there is some wasted space. Apps, now when you star your device there are a bunch of choices to pick from. Yes there is pre installed software but most of it was things i was going to use anyways. there are two app stores to chose from but i normally just use the google one. The cameras, while not the best, I find that I dont normal use the cameras for much more than when I am video chatting with friends. I find that I normally use the tablet for a few hours at a time but never have to plug in unless I am going to sleep. I dont have battery issues so i guess I got lucky. The storage is never an issue bc you have the 32 or 64 gig and than you also have the option to add an SD card too.
All in all I find myself enjoying my new tablet and turned the slower one into a media device. Its worth the upgrade and if you are thinking about this one and wondering, Yes this is worth it.

This is a pathetic device. Since beginning the device had issues related to charging. The tablet used to display message to use original charger in order to charge it quickly. But this message was not coming very frequently. But now after 2 months, device is showing this message all the time and device is not getting charged at all. Its a big CHEATING by seller. I tried to charge it with my another samsung cable (original USB cable that came with my earlier samsung new device), but still this tablet is showing me the same message. It seems there definitely a problem with device. I would not recommend this to anyone. I want my refund back but amazon.com website is saying that their return policy is for only 30 days. I am feeling cheated. I want my refund back

If you are looking for a tablet and not obsessed with getting an iPad look no further!  I am very familiar with both iOS products and Android products.  I have owned a Nexus 7, Galaxy S5, Galaxy S4, Nexus 5, Nexus 7, iPhone 6, and iPad Air 2.  The Android products are what I choose to use at home and for personal use.

I debated for a long time between getting an Android tablet or a new iPad for my own personal use.  Based on my experience with Android devices, especially Samsung devices, I was concerned that the user experience and operating system would not be smooth.  My Galaxy S5 and S4 both experienced glitches and flaws that would sometimes frustrate me.  But Apple products are just so much more expensive and not easily customizable.  When Black Friday rolled around I was able to snatch up this tablet for $340; if the product turned out to be a dud I could always return it using Amazon's excellent return policy.

I don't know what Samsung did to resolve their issues but this tablet operates very smoothly; much better than my previous experience with their devices.  First there is absolutely no lag when swiping or loading apps; everything transitions smoothly and provides the kind of experience you would expect from an iOS device.  Secondly the device is very thin and extremely appealing; I chose to get the white version.  The battery life is excellent, I watched 6 hours of Netflix and still had plenty of battery life left.  Thirdly it is very customizable which is of course one of the primary reasons users choose Android in the first place.

You should get this device if you are on the market for a tablet and not obsessed with the idea of owning an Apple device.  I have a hard time imagining a better tablet on the market right now and especially for the price point.

I LOVE, no, I ADORE AMAZON.  Their customer service is EXCELLENT!!!!

First, let me say that I adore this tablet! The clarity in picture, and functions are amazing. I have been super happy with this product. I did A LOT of research before finally deciding on The Samsung Gallaxy Tab S2 with a 9.7" screen and have not been disappointed with the performance of the tablet except for one thing...The charging port. I don't know if I got a defective port, or if this is a weak point for this product, we shall see.

I purchased this tablet about a year prior to the problems with the port. At the same time I purchased the tablet, I did purchase a two year protection plan through Square Trade for $40. Unfortunately, the warranty through Square Trade would not kick in until after the Samsung warranty ran out. I spent a very frustrating morning looking for HELP through Samsung regarding their warranty on the tablet and what to do when something went wrong with it. I found NOTHING. I looked online, made a few phone calls that lead no where. I thought it would be so easy, but it wasn't. Samsung needs to fix this. If you're going to offer a warranty that comes with your product, include information with the product so a customer may follow through with help in the event there is a problem. The information included with the tablet, gave me nothing but dead ends. I called the numbers in the booklet, and the numbers were not up to date and with no help whatsoever to resolve the issue.

My partner could see my frustration. I wasted time, and energy leading to dead ends, and he suggested I call Amazon for help. I thought there was no way Amazon would be able to help because it was an issue with the warranty through Samsung. NOT TRUE. Not only was my problem SOLVED, but Amazon sent me a REPLACEMENT tablet in TWO DAYS and gave me 30 days to send the tablet with the defective port back!

AMAZON STANDS BY THEIR PRODUCTS. GIVES THE MOST AMAZING CUSTOMER SERVICE SO THE ***CUSTOMER*** IS HAPPY WITH THEIR PURCHASE AND CAN PURCHASE WITH UTTER CONFIDENCE!!!!

I would NOT want to purchase items ANYWHERE ELSE if I can purchase them though AMAZON. I ALWAYS check Amazon FIRST before I purchase ANYTHING. The prices are competitive, the customer service is OUTSTANDING and without a doubt STELLAR!

Thank you AMAZON for turning around a very frustrating situation into an experience that ended up being RESOLVED painlessly. THANK YOU THANK YOU THANK YOU!!!!

Love on first sight!!! this tablet is fantastic, fast, light, full of storage and Ive got it with a very good price. After just 7 months of use,  the original fast charger which is included stopped working. I'm not complaining the seller,  which by the way is very good, I'm complaining to the quality of Samsung and the rest of technology suppliers which are not cheap but have decrease the quality to an extend that we don't find a good quality device any more at reasonable prices.

Pros:
1. Very lightweight and comfortable to hold.
2. Great screen.
3. 4:3 screen ratio is so much more comfortable than 16:10 or 16:9 I used previously on tablets.
4. Very fast.

Cons:
1. No notification light. That's very surprising move from Samsung. Why remove it?
2. MicroUSB port is located far to the right, so it is highly unlikely there will be a charging cradle/holder for this tablet. Or it will be made specifically for this tablet and useless for all other devices because of weird location.
3. Headphone jack is located on the bottom just like on the phones like Samsung Galaxy S6, but it is great for phones and not so great for the tablets, especially this one as it will be used vertically most of the time... I wish it was on top like on iPads.
4. 3 physical buttons are not easy to use when using tablet horizontally. I wish there was an option to turn virtual buttons (app switch, home, back) in this mode.
5. No wireless charging. Small weight is nice but wireless charging at expense of some weight would be amazing.
6. Require case because of the camera unit.

Excellent tablet, even for the uninformed masses like myself.  It it so airily light, there is no arm strain from holding for hours.  Good battery life, likely to last you all day from average use.  I like the screen, both in output and dimensions though others may crave a 16:9 ratio I like the 4:3 more myself.  I love the expandable memory; just dumped a bunch of movies on there on a 128gb microsd card.  Very responsive performance, no percievable lag or slowdown at any point.  Worth the money.

WOW.  This tablet is crazy awesome!  I've used an iPad Air 2 for a while but I really wan't like iOS.  I like my iPhone but I played with a couple of android tablets at best buy and decided that was what I wanted for a tablet I use for reading comic books, books, and watching movies.

I bought a Fire HD 10 recently but the screen resolution and os stability was off, stuff worked but not very well.  I ordered this 9.7" model after playing with a friend's 8.0" model and it's just impressive.  It's fast, no stutter, the apps work, the screen is beautiful and it's light.  Even with a cover attached, it's still light.

It was kind of more expensive than I would have liked but I'm using it heavily and it's just great.

Before I purchased this tablet, I owned the Tab A 9.7 and loved it, except the lower resolution. Finally, I decided to step up and upgrade to the Tab2 S 9.7 and I am so glad I did as I state the reasons why below:

PROS/SPECIAL FEATURES...

+ Size/Weight/Ease oh holding this S2 9.7 - I had the Tab A 9.7 and before that Tab4 10.1. Both of my old tablets were THICKER and heavier compared to the S2. This tablet is feather light for a 9.7 and more comfortable to hold and to carry in my purse or backpack.

Screen Resolution, Brightness and Other Info  The resolution on this is 264 ppi compared to 132 ppi (pixels per inch) of Tab A 9.7. This is more than double the resolution. And note that the colors, pictures, videos, everything is so sharp and clear. The screen just pops with color! And I find it easy to read eBooks, watch videos, etc on this tablet. Even at a higher price for this tablet, I find that the tablet has been a wonderful purchase.

* The screen aspect ratio is 4:3 vs the 16:1 type of screen. For me, I like this 4:3 screen because I found that the webpages are easier to read and clearer, I did not have to scroll to the right. Also I found that the pictures on a website were easier to view. I compared this tablet with my older Tab 4 10.1 tablet on my frequent webpages and while I viewed this tablet, I could read the larger text better, read my eBooks much clearer, emails better etc. This is my personal discovery from my testing of this and comparing it to my older tablet.

+ Battery life/Speed  Good battery life, but not quite as good as my oldercaTab4 or TabA. For me, I have found that I am constantly on WiFi (Internet). One of the reasons is the screen is noticeably brighter (Tab S2 has more brightness nits). So I had to lower the brightness.
The tablet I find is quite responsive and peppy with no lagging. The Lollipop 5.1.1 runs this tablet wonderfully.

 WiFi Connecting/Speed of WiFi and MORE - This tablet connects SUPER quickly to my home WiFi and has never ever dropped the WIFi signal no matter where I am in my home. WiFi is VERY STRONG at 144mbps, vs 72mbps on my other tablets. Also, my internet loads super, super fast in all browsers that I tried.. And even when I am far from my router I still have 4.5 bars! I went to Settings, pressed on WiFi and it showed speed on my tablets. A,lso, to test this WiFi and compare it to my other Android devices, I went to the Playstore and got the free app called WiFi Analyzer. This is a MUST HAVE app for any Android device as it gives you a visual report on the WiFi strength of your tablet, phone etc.The Wifi speed on my Tab S2 is near double of what my TabA had.
Also, there is 32GB Ram in the Tab S2, this is double Ram of Tab A or Tab 4. And this tablet is super fast, no lagging at all!

+ SPECIAL INFO about INTERNET CONNECTION - Yes, this is a WiFi only, but when you are away from an WiFi internet hotspot location, there are ways to can get onto the internet such as MiFi and there are ways that you can purchase equipment so that you can have data when you do not have a WiFi hotspot available.

+ Internet & Webpage & Video Viewing - The stock browser does a wonderful job and it opens up webpages very fast. Also I tried Maxthon Browser and this worked very well yet I still prefer the Internet App. Also, I tried out the factory installed Chrome Browser and liked it OK, yet again, I went back the the stock Internet App (this is my preference). Note that the Playstore has many very good (FREE) internet browsers as Dolphin, Opera and many more!

+ EXTERNAL SLOT FOR MICRO SD CARD/Internal Storage. This is a must for me as I keep my personal files, photos, and music on my internal SD card. I installed a SanDisk 64GB SD card and it works great on this tablet and I placed my music and files on it and have plenty of space left. This tablet accepts up to 128GB SD card.
The internal storage of 32GB is double of my Tab A 9.7 or Tab 4 10.1 that have 16GB. Even after Android OS, factory apps, Facebook, Twitter, Kindle App and many more personal that I installed, I still have  just at 23GB of internal storage left!

- + Camera / Video Camera - This has a camera of 8MP with no flash on this camera, however, in good lighting the pictures came out much better had I expected. However, I rarely use this camera as I prefer to use my Nikon digital camera for my overall picture taking...the camera on this tablet is OK for backup camera, taking pictures to send in an email, etc). Do not expect the camera on this tablet to replace your digital camera since it does not have a flash.

+ Home Videos - The stock video player is OK and plays MOST home videos, however, may I suggest QQ Player (Free App from Playstore and the ONLY one I recommend as it plays every home video I tried)..

+ Music Player/Sound Quality - This model has the regular MUSIC App, which plays by playlists, songs, albums and even folders. Also there is Google Music app is pre-installed in this tablet and does a fine job. However, I installed the FREE app called Rocket Player from the Playstore and love this music player! As for sound quality - The best way to really enjoy music is through a high quality Bluetooth speaker or Bluetooth headset as the sound quality is superb this way and you can walk about your home listening to your music!

+ OTG USB Compatible - This tablet comes with a free OTG On the Go adapter cable. Just plug in your flash drive and you can copy files to the flash drive so easily or view files that are on the flash drive. *Note that portable external hard drives and portable DVD/CD drives will not work using OTG in this tablet because they require a lot of power.

CONS:
-  Battery life is so-so, not the best out there. In fact, I had close to 2 hours less per day on the Tab S2 over the Tab A!  But this is not a deal breaker for me as I still have enough battery time, and I always keep a spare charger in car/purse.

- Cost is pricey compared to Tab A line or the Tab 4 line. The price difference us about 100 dollars more for the Tab S2 9.7, however, for me, I believe that I received a very high end tablet, so it was worth what I paid.

Bottom line- Yes, this is a pricey tablet, however, I believe that the old saying that you get what you pay for is true. This is a very high quality tablet.

Should you buy this or the Tab A or a less expensive tablet in my opinion?  While this is an exceptional tablet, I also recommend a couple of others below....

TAB S2 ... Yes you may want to consider the Tab S2 9.7 if you want a higher resolution tablet with larger Internal space, 8MP camera and other high end features and you do not mind paying about 100 dollars more for higher end features etc.

TAB A 9.7... Yes if you want a good tablet for a reasonable price and do not mind lower resolution or 16GB Internal, 5 MP camera, etc, yet this is good because the battery lasted me 2 more hours daily than Tab S2. The TAB A is a wonderful tablet for the money) or Tab 4 10.1, or other lower priced tablet. A 5 MP camera us OK on a tablet for emergency pictures, 16GB Internal is OK if you watch how many apps you install on the internal storage.
Also, the Tab A is a GREAT BUY and excellent for someone new to tablets.

If you have questions, ask me in comments. I am kind of a techie person and will answer promptly.

Thank you for reading my review.
Amazing laptop

First: The included charger was very small and the first screen I saw when I turned it on tells me "You have plugged in a lower wattage power adapter. Your system will continue to work, but may not perform at its peak." Really? $700 for a refurb and you cannot even send the proper charger? So I continue with the first boot and choose region and keyboard as usual then am greeted with a screen asking me for my Booking.com email address. What? I do not even know what booking.com is and there is no way to bypass this screen. See attached photos. The first screen informing me of the too small power adapter also had the Dell Service Tag number so I went to Dell to look that up. Turns out this service tag number has Dell ProSupport Plus until 25 September 2024. Wow. That seems too good to be true but I learned the machine needs a 65W adapter and you can see in the last photo the included adpater is only 45W. I might forgive the 45W adapter but I have never had a new Windows 10 machine ask me for my Booking.com email address upon the first boot. I cannot imagine what other surprises would await if I knew how to bypass that screen.

Update 9/29/2023: Thank goodness for Dell support. I was able to download and install the factory image from Dell so this laptop now appears to be okay and usable. I have no idea what the refurbish company had put on this machine but it was not a clean windows 10 pro image. HQCapital support has been very responsive (+1star) and is sending the correct charger for this machine.

I had it for a few weeks and then when I grabbed my backpack it came flying out and shattered. Totally My Fault, and that's why I just ordered another one. The $20 dollars I am saving I will use for the insurance. Great little Tablet and I am still not in the Cult Of Apple Products!!!

I am very excited to own this tablet.  the colors on screen are vived.  the speed to connect online is very good.
having received it about 2 weeks ago, I am still on the learning curve.  I use it every day to become more fluent in the use and potential of this tablet.

Great 7" tablet running Android at a great price.. Has everything equivalent to my iPad, but more control over your device.. Only reason that I didn't rate it five stars is due to Samsung's design... The tablet is very slippery & slides out of your hands easily.. Definitely buy a tablet case/cover if you purchase this item!!

Purchased this on sale so the price was great. I bought this to use as a universal remote thinking I could ditch the multiple remotes laying around. All of the control features are app based and I have not found the right one for my needs yet. Works well and holds a decent charge.

I bought this to replace a defective tablet of another brand, that I had purchased my grown daughter for Christmas.  It was a good price, and there have been NO problems at all.  She uses her tablet on a daily basis, carries it with her and she loves it.  Rarely does she ever use her laptop anymore as this does all she needs to do.  Would highly recommend this, and the price was VERY good, much lower that the box stores.

This was a gift to my son for Christmas!  I worried that the 7 inch might be too small, but he says it is just the right size for his busy graduate student lifestyle.  Not as bulky as some Tablets can be.  We added a leather case with a wireless keyboard to complete the gift.  He couldn't be happier.  It's fast, it's efficient, it has a lot of features.  Couldn't be happier with this purchase.  Well worth the money!

The samsung tab 3 is a great tablet. I was searching for a relatively small tablet for portability. Don't let the size (7 in) deter you. The screen clarity and resolution are top notch. I typically use this tablet in conjunction with video viewing apps such as espn, att uverse, etc. The small size allows you to keep up with sports games and tv shows while grilling, cooking, or doing household chores. This was by far my best electronics purchase of 2014.

I do love my iPad, but I will say for something small and portable, this is very good. Had a great price point and fits good in my hand. Registration is a bit of a pain, and there is no iHeart radio in the samsung app store, but it still has a majority of the other major apps.

I was worried the 7 inch screen wouldn't be big enough but it's perfect and easy to stash in my coat pocket and carry with me.  I useit to follow the stock market during the day at work and it connects easily to wifi wherever I am.  I didn't think I would like the onscreen keyboard and would need a separate Bluetooth keyboard but so far it's not been an issue for me.  I highly recommend this tablet and I think you'll really enjoy it.

This thing is impressive. I know it is now outdated, but I thought it is sometimes nice to hear the long term satisfaction.  My Jr High boy has had this for a year and a half. He takes care of his stuff, but this thing has performed flawlessly for that long. Still works fantastic. I am really impressed. He puts hours and hours on it. Games, netflix, texting, blah blah blah. Seriously, I see why people like this.

I have read review after review about what is the best tablet. I have to say for the price this one was perfect for what I needed it for. I have not experienced any issues with my tablet picking up Wi-Fi or lagging. It does what I need it to do when I need it done. I haven't weighed it down with too many apps so that my be a factor. I use it more for leisure if that helps, and I am currently happy with my tablet.

i gave it a 5 star rating because I was really impressed. It offers so much more than the Kindle. I like thst its quite user friendly. I was worried about the color, because I really wanted a black and the white one looked like a toy, so I was happy to see that the gold-brown, was dark enough and so kept the sleek, sophisticated image. I would recommend this product to anyone who is interested in having a light mini computer at his or her fingertips.

This tablet is very practical and comfortable to use, helped me a lot to synchronize multiple computers in my house with the apps that I downloaded, and you can download an endless number of applications to be used, I have no complaints of this tablet, it has simplified my many of my tasks both at home and at work.

Initially, I loved it, but it does have some serious design flaws.

The most serious design flaw is that the receptacle for the power cord is not well secured to the housing, and eventually (as in 10 months) it got pushed inside the device, so that it can't be charged, and therefore can't be used.

The other problems with it are that the WiFi seems very slow, and that the "return to previous screen" button is placed just where you want to put your hand to hold the device, so that programs quit seemingly at random.

I own a TAB2 and I must say that the performance is the same. However if you dont have a TAB 2 get this since the design is superior. the TAB3 gives a more sturdy hold since i feel like my TAB2 can roll out of my hand with its rounded smmoth design, not so with the TAB3. Also with the TAB3 actual buttons for home and back its more convenient than the TAB2 which had a display touch screen home button which can be a hassle with screen rotation.

I ordered 3 Tabs for presents. 2 work fine, but 1 Tab flickers when the back light setting is turned down to its lowest setting. It was sent back to Samsung. If 1 out of 3 Tabs had this problem, I feel there is a pretty good chance of getting one that doesn't preform properly. The other 2 are nice.

I got this product pretty fast in the mail practically "brand new". The only thing wrong was a dent in the packaging. I'm still learning how to use it but this was a good buy. My only cons on this product so far would be that the screen sometimes is very sensitive but overall I'm satisfied with the product I received.

Device challenged, I bought this tablet after reviewing the list of devices that would support a "Square or Jax".  It does not support these e-commerce additions because it was the wrong version.  I was disappointed but realized I could input credit cards manually so decided to keep it and upgrade later.  However, my Son may be right, Apple products may be more suitable.  I noticed it has a pretty short battery life.  Not what I had hoped for and wish I hadn't bought another one at the same time as a gift.  Think I'll return the second one.

I am sorry I waited so long to buy one. However, I'm trying to figure out why there is no multi- screen. I am using it as a wireless keyboard and mouse in connection with my laptop when I'm watching in bed. I am also using it as a remote connection so I can use my laptop anywhere. It works great.

Aside from no flash this is a great tablet. Links up to wifi with no problem. Easy to use with nice sounding speakers and even better sound with headsets. HD picture is great. You can load lots of music and pics on SD Card. Apps install quickly. If you want a tablet to use with wifi only consider this one.

A pretty nifty little gadget. It's not a cellphone, it's not a pc, it's the perfect tablet. It fits comfortably on your hand and is not tiresome to hold but is not too small either.

With this one I got an issue. One night it discharged completely and the next day it didn't wanted to turn on. Even after I left it charging for a long time. The next day I brought it to work and connected it to the pc for a long time. It worked perfectly fine afterwards.

This tablet is great. Only wish I could have afforded a bigger screen version, and  I think it should come standard with a screen saver already on it . I bought my kid a Dell and it came with one already on it, perfectly
perhaps tablet makers can either follow suit or make it an option. An option that they could charge an additional, nominal fee, of course
aside from that I'm very well pleased with this tablet. It does all I need and more. Always been a Samsung fan.

When I received this item it was sealed in its original box as if it was brand new.  Everything was there no problems with the devise and I have used it everyday since I received it.  It is my alarm/nightstand/music desk clock.  I love the color.  I bought an Otterbox outside case with stand and it is the best tablet I have seen or had.  Fast and I can sync it with my Samsung Galaxy S4 cell phone and Dell Laptop.  It's great at this price.

Is a very good tablet sometimes freeze and need to restart when I use Google Maps and try to use Street View. This 7 inch model does not allow to use multi-user I don't know why this feature is very important nowadays, because I bought this tablet for all my family and each one has their own account. But is OK for this moment.

I'm a Mac person. iPhone, iPad, iMac, Macbook.  I'm taking a class in cloud computing and we are working on Google drive.  I thought I'd buy an android device.  I thought android would be more compatible with all the google apps.

This Tab3 is really clunky.  I found it s-l-o-w.  While supposedly running a 1.2gb processor and 8gb flash memory and 1gb memory.  It became really annoying while trying to open an app, then it would automatically close.

I tried to load some music on it.  I found on Youtube, a suggestion to connect it as an external drive than upload.  I unloaded one album, but could never find the music.  Another suggestion was to download an app called 'Kies' -  Kies asks if I wanted ALL my music, and i checked 'NO' I then downloaded one album, when I opened my Galaxy Tab3, I couldn't find the music, but i did find my entire iPhoto library.

Trying to delete my photos was impossible, unless I deleted them one at a time.  I had over 4,000 photos uploaded.

Finally getting so frustrated, I wiped it, reset to original condition, repacked it and sent it back to Amazon.

I've had this tablet for four months, and barely have the energy to try to use it. To wake it up, I have to press the button repeatedly, or even try the power button. Eventually it does turn on, and that's when the challenge begins.

Most times I am trying to watch a video, the tablet freezes and makes a maddening noise. The only way I was able to stop it was by trying to turn it off repeatedly, since I couldn't figure out how to open it and remove the battery.

Typing anything when browsing the internet is a challenge. I press a letter and it takes a few seconds for the letter to be entered. And it freezes or opens other pages when I simply get my finger too close too a link. If I try the back button, it usually doesn't work or simply kicks me out of the internet.

I should clarify that I have not overloaded my tablet with apps. The internal memory has more than half left. Samsung support suggested I clear my internet apps completely, but this didn't work. I simply hate this product and will have to try to get it replaced or just throw it out the window.

Seen some bad reviews for this.  I have to say that I don't agree this tab is great.  If you are familiar with the Android system then the useage of this tab should be no problem at all.  If you have a gmail account it will sync with it and load all apps and info to it that you have on other Android devices.  It does have instructions but like all Samsung products you have to go online to get the manual as that's how they do it to save paper.
Excelente tab

The galaxy tab 3 7" is quite a good gadget. It meets most of my expectations though I'm still acquainting myself with it. I give it a 4-star rating because I am yet to fully explore all its features and do not know what I will find and because the battery life though ok, is not quite as good as I expect it to be.

I was very satisfied with my Samsung Galaxy Tab 3 until it fell out of my hand and the face shattered.  I think the best improvement that can be made is to make the face shatter proof.
This tablet takes beautiful pictures and one of the features that I like the most is that it can control any TV.  On, off and change channels.

I wanted to get a tablet and after looking around I chose the Samsung.  This 7 inch is small enough for my handbag and light compared to the others.  Amazon was the only place I could get the brown one.  I can't say much more as I haven't really got into it yet but the kids are doing fine.  I think if I was going to use it for pramarily for reading I would get the 8 inch but the 8 is a little heavier so it would be a trade off.

I ordered the Gold-Brown one but received the black in instead, which was the first time I ever had that problem.  I have another Galaxy through Sprint that I pay $15.00 a month for.  This has no monthly fee and works great with my internet service inside my home or outside.  I order this one for my daughter  as well as Chromecast, she loves it!

Met all expectations and research prior to buying. Easy to set up and intuitive, user friendly. My wife wanted this Galaxy Tab 3  for health care provider applications. She likes it a lot better than previous devices like Palm Pad. This 7" is a very good size for transport and screen viewing. Excellent resolution and pretty generous memory. Even with Epocrates healthcare software loaded, I have not needed to install a memory card that is available. So far, no issues with battery life either, a pleasant outcome. A lot of capability for under $200. I highly recommend.

I was hoping the other reviews about picking up the wifi just had to do with other peoples wifi connections, but it is doing the same with mines as well. I have perfect internet at my house, but you have to be close to the router in order to get good signal otherwise is very slow.  Love that you can print from this tab, which is a plus

its $150, what are you expecting, it works great for what i wanted it for, but compared to my galaxy s3, the camera is worse, the screen has a lower resolution, it is noticeably slower, and it has less ram, however it does have a nice screen, and an infared blaster that can be used as a remote control for your tv, or others if you want to have fun.

I received my Samsung Galaxy Tab 3 and had no problems setting it up. Two days later when I went to use it the screen was frozen and would not allow to use the tablet.

I made three calls to the Samsung Tech support people This did NO GOOD at all. I felt they were lacking in solving the problem. Their answer was " you need to send it in for service" I called Amazon and they provided me the option of a refund or a new device.

In all fairness I elected to try the tablet. I can only say Amazon is the BEST. I will post  a updated review.

This is my first time using something other than an apple product and I love it.  I have been an iphone and ipad user since they arrived on the scene and have been drinking the cool aid ever since .  My experiment with Samdsung galaxy has been an eye opener.  The Tab 3 7 inch works great for me.  I do recommend getting versions with built in wifi.  This version is great around the house and anywhere wifi is available.  ALL stars from me.  Samsung Galaxy,  out of the park.  M

I did what I thought was a good deal of research before buying this. Unfortunately, none of the review articles (and certainly not the Samsung site) will let you know that this device will not work with many of the accessories. Most important is the lack of an HDMI connection via MHL/micro-USB port (I also wasn't able to get any of the micro USB to USB connectors to work with this device and couldn't get the Peel remote to control the TV). I didn't find this out until I had already bought a MHL/micro-USB to HDMI connection and tried to get it to work. Don't bother, it wont. If you want to attempt to connect this device to a television, there is no good way that I can think of. Apparently the 8 and 10.1 models have this capability. Nothing on the Amazon or Samsung websites point out this discrepancy. Even the older (Tab 2 models) can be connected via a dock, not the Tab 3 7-inch though. Returning my 7 inch tablet as a result.

I purchased for just for the sole purpose of playing games for my 5 yr old daughter..and watching movies in the car..it is alittle sluggish at times..not the fastest..but I knew that from watching reviews and the price..but would recommend to others..great for the price and good function..I have used it as a big Navi screen on a small trip..worked great..I jus turn on my Wifi on my phone and good to go..

Sadly, I didn't read all the reviews or the description carefully enough, or else I would have known that 8GB wasn't going to be enough. My son has downloaded about 15 apps, and that's all she wrote. Internal memory is almost full, and since you can't move apps to the SD card, well, for every new app he wants to download, we'll have to uninstall one. Of course you can't uninstall all the preloaded crap (why do they keep doing that to us?!).

As for the rest, the picture is beautiful and great for watching Netflix. The empty SD card is waiting for when my son is interested in taking pictures and listening to music.

It's a great machine when it's working fine, just like my Galaxy 3 phone but has a tendency to freeze often when playing games and has to be restarted.  It was given to my wife as a gift and she started to complain about the freezing.  When playing Angry Birds it acts kinda whacky.  I know that doesnt say much except that Angry Birds becomes un-playable.  The screen flashes, the birds do not react to the correct finger movements and go off in the opposite direction.  When play slots it will just freeze.  I hoping that Samsung will address this issue and put out a software patch to fix this soon.

We bought two tablets for our daughters for Christmas.  Each received the Samsung Galaxy Tab 3 (7 inch).  Our daughters are 11 and 9.  It was a perfect gift.  First, the price was very reasonable for a quality product.  They use their tablets each day playing games, skyping with relatives and friends, email, etc.  And what I love most is that they enjoy it.  It was hard to justify buying an ipad for them when the Samsung offers everything for them that an ipad would.  And our experience with all Samsung products has been a good one.

I bought this to use with my credit card reader for my business and now I don't really need it. I decided to keep it to put my finished photography pics on it to show people. After 2 weeks I finally figured out how to do that and I'm fairly good with computers. Unless you have readily available wi-fi, it's pretty useless.There's no real manual for it. What happened to manuals anyway? It has apps I don't want, need or can't figure out a use for. It seems like every app has to go thru google + and who likes google +? The screen is clear and the speakers are OK. I feel like I bought an expensive radio.

The tablet is great it works very close to my samsung phone the only reason I didn't give 5 stars is I wish I could move apps over to as  card without having to connect to computer.I thought I could but my mistake in assuming all samsung android devices were alike.I got the 8GB but I would highly recommend 16GBP especially if u like to download lots of games but overall the tablet is a good tablet

Within 2 weeks of giving this as a gift to my dad who is retired - he has been enchanted with all the features, the convenience.  He loves that with a wireless router he can sit in the living room with mom  and play his games, read his e-mails and check his stocks and not have to sit alone in his office at his computer.  The quality is good and with all the apps the opportunities to learn and discover is endless. Dad is 81 and his mind is very, very sharp.  This will keep his mind active and healthy.  He loves it!

I wanted this tablet cause I figured It would be like my phone and it is the problom is its almost exactly like the phone its to restricted from certain on the web I wanted a tablet that was more like a laptop like my last one. I like it but I dont love it it often freezes and the worst freeze and kicks me out of what im doing. It has a fairly slow response on almost everything but otherwise its ok. I think it has a pretty good battery life.  But if I could I'd probably get something else. Maybe my expectations were to high but thats the product I have so im slightly disappointed.

This was a simple and elegant solution for my wife.  She wanted a pad, but did not want to have a data plan.  She uses it on our WiFi at home and at her office.  She uses it mainly for Google searches, e-mail (Yahoo), and Facebook.  It does all of that well.  For most other computer work she uses the home computer, which is in heavy competition with my daughter using it very often.  Anyway, I've been using a Galaxy 3s phone for some time, and It appears to be the same high quality item, essentially working like a great big smart phone.

Super excited about my first tab, and it'll be just like my phone, which I freaking love. Yeah...Not so much. It's glichy and slow, and has done some really concerning things- like shut down and reboot and be at factory settings with none of my purchased apps! I rebooted it, and they were magically there. Just a weird thing. Also, none of the accessories I've bought for it fit. (and I made sure they were the right ones!) They're all to big and floppy, with holes in the wrong place. I love my galaxy phone, with all my heart. I just wish my tab was as fast and with it as my phone. It's the slow stupid version it seems. Poopy.

I have been viewing email, web articles, etc on my Samsung phone. I decided I wanted a bigger screen, so bought the tablet. I  looked at Kindles and IPads, but decided I wanted to stay with Samsung. The tablet feels very familiar after using the phone for some time (also have good luck with 3 Samsung TVs.). I got the WiFi version as I can use the Samsung phone as my WiFi hub to the web.. and I always have my phone. Works great. It uses our home wifi when I'm home and the phone when I'm out. Still learning to use various things, but recommend the tablet without reservation.

This tablet is great, I bought 2 of them, one for my girlfriend and the other one for me. They're great for web browsing and watching videos.
The tablet is not the fastest on the market but first I want to use it and test it before purchasing a bigger/faster one.

The only complain I have is that I bought 2 Items and neither of them arrived in it's original box but in a plastic-cardboard pseudo-box, the description said that everything was in like-new condition and all the manuals were included but for one tablet they were missing... One tablet had only minor cosmetic details on the back.

I bought it because I got tired of lugging around a heavy laptop on vacation. It is very small, lightweight and convenient. It doesn't have the computing power of a laptop, but the display is sharp and high quality. I don't have a smartphone, so it is my first experience with apps too. I find them problematic, for example flash is NOT supported by Android, so most videos won't play. That sucks, but it's not Samsung's fault. Overall I am very happy with the purchase.

I really love this ! It charges pretty quick and the battery lasts a long time...
I can watch movies great pix.. read books play games I also listen to books on the road !
