and I am sure it does a ton more !  I haven't put my music on it yet.. I hardly ever use my ipod anymore since I got this ! The only thing it doesn't have is facetime which is a bummer but I can Skype ,,, anyway its great !

For the money, this is hands down one great device. It works smoothly and seamlessly. But it doesn't do all those wonderful things anyone owning an iPad or similar will have become used to. Games and apps are great, google play is getting there now, and this thing is sturdy and easy to handle. Can't do iTunes of course, and can't play Amazon movies either - which for me is a big disappointment. My kid loves it, also cause its compact and easy to carry around.

Samsung is making leaps and bounds above the others! I bought one of these for my wife after she was constantly complaining about how much she hated my smartphone! She quickly learned Android so she could play games and the like, and now SHE has a smart phone! Next, I bought another for my Grandson, He's ten and it's time he had his own computer, I warned him it's fragile and got him a case telling him, if you break it it's gone and won't be replaced! Another lesson for him that is working. He's keeping his grades up (straight A's) and he's taken good care of the machine he loves. I couldn't be happier!

I already had a Tab3, and love using it.  It's fast, has a very clear and bright hi-res display, and is priced right!  My kids wanted their own tablets for Christmas, and I cannot justify the iPad mini for kids, so these Tab 3 units fit the bill nicely.  I'm not too concerned about the 8GB onboard memory, because I can install 64GB microSD cards, and have more than is needed.

I'm really picky about devices like this, so giving 5 stars is a big deal, but I am really impressed with Samsung.  I also have a Samsung Galaxy S4 phone, and they are laid out identically.  That's a bonus!

This tablet lasted about three years until the battery just gave out on me. I mean, it's fairly good for it's price. Nothing really to complain about except that the battery completely died. Worth it, I think. I would buy it again, but I'm trying something a little more expensive to see how I like it. Worth the purchase, though, if you just need a tablet to read or watch netflix in bed!

Pros: The tablet works well, very clear, just the right size to carry around without adding too much weight. Its been 3 days but i love it
Cons: Amazon promises to "Pre-loaded with free content including Hulu Plus membership, Google Play credit and Boingo Wi-Fi Access" Not true! theyre actually referring to the Free memberships we already get, there is no added benefit. Notice they dont even mention how much the google play credit will be. It was all very sneaky of Amazon and I am very surprised and disappointed with them

I got this so I could put my textbooks on it and carry it to class. I wanted something lighter than my laptop. It has been working pretty well. I have a problem  with one textbook it is very sluggish, but it is a very large textbook and the other 3 do not have that problem. I used Google drive to put them there. I liked that all the apps from my phone went onto the Tab. It has been pretty good. I'm still learning some things but so far I'm happy

This was a gift for my wife. I have a Galaxy 2, and she had a Nook, but wanted to be able to get Kindle Books.  She has been delighted with her Galaxy 3.  It is everything that she wanted and more.  I pointed out some apps that I thought that she would like to have, and she has been using the Galaxy even more than she thought she would.  This was one of the best gifts that I have given her in our many years of marriage.

I'm a Apple user that is being converted to Samsung.  Family got the phones so I decided to try out this tablet.  I really like it and will be adding a galaxy phone to go with it soon.
Pros:  Bigger; nuff said.  Really like the homescreens and especially the "widgets" that have active content on them,  unlike just the icons only like Apple does.  Plus the Google Play store (read: Apple App store) gives away free stuff!

Cons: Well, it could be bigger.  The screen seems to attract lint and junk. Wish I could change the volume on the screen instead of having to do it with the buttons on the side.

I love the galaxy s4 and galaxy tab 10.1.  So I thought the 7.0 tab would work well for my 9 year old daughter.  This tab was a disappointment.  Problems included random crashes, sluggishness,  and the datetime would reset everytime the device was restarted.  Loading web pages was very slow... so were games.

I was planning on returning to amazon, but decided to do a little troubleshooting first, which included: factory reset, clearing the device cache, turning off extra features like the lock screen, power saving (which limited CPU), auto updates, and widgets.

I also discovered a flaw in the plastic around the on/off switch.  It was sticking "on" sometimes, causing the device to randomly reboot.

It's working better now.  As for quality, it's ok now but not in the same league as the other galaxy devices.  I'd say a better price should be $125.  I wouldn't recommend if you pay more than that.  Spend a little extra and get a better tab.  I wish we had gotten a nexus or another galaxy tab 3 10.1, given that I had to spend at least 4 hours troubleshooting the device.

So I got 2 of these (8gb model) for my kids for christmas this year.  By the day after Christmas one of them was already completely out of internal memory after downloading less than 20 apps / games.  That is because over 4gb is used for the OS and other bloatware that cant be removed.  So that leaves less than 4 gb left for apps, photos, videos, etc which goes pretty fast.  My sone had 1 game that was taking up over 1Gb. Now, I thought the external SD card would solve our issue so I went out and got a 16gb card.  That's when I found out Samsung disables the option to install / move apps onto the external SD card. It's only for photos and video which doesn't help the apps problem. So 2 days after turning it on for the first time, we're already into deleting apps to make space mode. Given the price, there are other tablets that offer a better value in my opinion.

Overall a decent tablet otherwise. I would rate higher if Samsung would remove the restriction on putting apps on the SD card.  Other vendors android based tablets allow this.

I have owned and used many Samsung products and have been happy with all of them in the past.  I wanted an affordable and reliable android tablet for around the house to replace an Original Kindle Fire,  so I purchased the Galaxy Tab 3.

After I received the Galaxy Tab 3 and started using it,  I noticed how sluggish the interface was in comparison to other devices that I have used such as the Kindle Fire HD and the iPad Mini.  It also did not feel as "solid" as some other the other devices I was used to.  Under normal use such as web browsing or streaming movies, it got hot to the touch.  I also had to frequently reboot the unit to keep it responsive.

Unfortunately, After about a month after purchase, the unit locked up and shut down to a black screen.  It would not come back on after that.  I have had to send it back for warranty repair and am anxiously awaiting the results of the repair.

Other Samsung tablets may be better and may be worth the money.  However, I can not recommend this unit.

The tablet is awesome! Fast and very nice resolution screen! I used it mainly for movies and games like clash of clans! But after a year the tablet turned off by its self! I search this issue and apparently this model has the battery poorly atached they say it can be easily fix placing an electric black tape over the battery.... But I'm scare of opening it so thats what I dint use it anymore... But for the price I recommend it!!!

Since I couldn't convince him to get himself a new computer or laptop, I gave this to my husband for Christmas and he loves it. We have Samsung phones so that made it easier for him to navigate. Wanted something for him to be able to play his videos and listen to his music and this is perfect. It's also easier for him to read with the bigger screen. This was not intended for work purposes, strictly entertainment, so it does everything he needs it to do. It came in a couple of weeks before Christmas so I was able to play around on it myself and familiarize myself before giving it to him on Christmas day. Great gift. Now I'll have to think about getting one for myself.

Bought it for my son's birthday and he is in love with it. One of the features that he liked the most is the ability to video chat with me whenever he has WIFI access. 'Google Hang out', allows him to talk to anyone who has the 'Google hang out' app on their smart phone. All that is required is a Gmail account. It also had a neat app called Watch-On, this app acts as a remote control and can change channels, change the volume, power the TV and set top box on/off. Very cool app, very cool tablet, would purchase another one.

I have Nook, Kindle, and iPad, too, and find the Samsung to compare favorably except for its small size.  Unfortunately, it does not do what I bought it for which was to mirror to my Samsung TV and to act as a touch remote.  It will send saved video and photos to the tv but it will not mirror live streaming data or web browsing.  If you want to do.that buy the 8" tablet.  Apps download easily and I have not yet found any that are incompatible.  Don't worry about color choices if you are going to use a cover.

well the tablet went dead just over a year , I bought it for my son who was never on it for any length of time just to play games. it looked new when we got it , and worked fine. then after a few month it would freeze up and make a noise. I own a galaxy tab 4 and never had issue with Samsung devices. it was never dropped so I am not sure what happen . I think I should  have had more years from this . I am now left to get a new one and so dissapointed

The reason I gave it 4 stars because it didn't send what it advertised, it says gold/brown, it is black and silver, so if you say it is something it should be that,  but it works and I am happy with it. if you play on it a long time use power saver for the brightness because it will heat up on you.  but it does what I need it to do, music games and video. I watch my mp4's or Netflix and HULU just fine. graphics looks good..

I purchased this tablet as a gift for my sister's boyfriend who lives in New Zealand, so naturally global shipping was the key driver in my purchasing decision.  He says he loves the tablet, but that he wishes it wasn't just for wifi (my mistake).  It seemed like a really good price for what it had to offer, and I liked that it has the ability to add more memory storage later if he needs it.  Overall, the tablet makes it easier for us to Skype and stay in touch, which was the ultimate goal.

Works pretty good.  Wife is not a tablet person but she likes it.  Kids love it.  I have had the Tab 2 for a while and find it faster than the newer Tab 3.  Tab 3 lags behind inputs and is a little glitchy.  Games are a little jerky, lessor quality video card or something I guess.  Tab 2 has upgraded Android 4.2.2 but Tab 3 is stuck at 4.1.2.  Don't know if an update will come any time soon.  I have rooted the Tab 3 to get rid of the bloatware... so far so good I guess.

Pros:
* Great price on sale
* Nice look & feel
* Works well for our simple needs
* Android

Cons:
* A little underpowered, definitely feel some lag.
* Battery life. But that's expected, nothing unusual.
* Front camera is underwhelming, especially since Skype was one of the main reasons for buying this.
* Registration took several tries, was a bit annoying.

Definitely the best value at this price range. But if we were to do it all over again, might have spent a few $ more on a Nexus 7. But this was bought as a gift and the recipient is very happy with it.

I've just had mine for a couple of days, but so far, so good.  I did find a User's manual online, and that's much easier to read than the one that came in the box. I don't think anyone has mentioned that before.  I have a big tablet, and use it mainly for reading and playing games, but it is a little heavy for my purse, so now I am brushing up on things I just never bothered to learn because I was using the first for different things.  I am having a little trouble getting Prime to recognize that I have two, but I probably missed something in the directions..  One comment.  I didn't think I wanted white, but was confused by the color gold-brown.  I still am confused.  To me it looks black.

I ordered 3 of these tablets for my family and so far they've been great.
Games, social apps, streaming services all perform above average. I almost went for an off brand tablet but then I realized that this was not that much more expensive for what I needed them for. My kids love them and stay glued to them for hours(after homework of course).
I know they come out with a new model every year or so but in the mean time this will do then I'll probably upgrade to the new models when the time comes. Samsung and Android have made wonderful technology and I can't wait to see what's next.

I bought this for my 9 year old. This is the second child we have bought one of these for. We have had no problems with it's functionality. They use it for mostly playing games, some internet searching and picture/video taking. We have had a problem using the additional sd storage.We used up all the internal memory and can't get the sd card to store anything. According to an internet search, you need to root the tablet. Not being much of a computer savy person, we haven't figured out how to do that, so we just delete things as we want to use more space. Overall satisfied, except for the storage issue

I bought this as a Christmas gift for my niece and as such I am unable to personally attest to the functionality of this tablet or how it compares to others.  All I can say is that 2 weeks after Christmas my niece is still thrilled with this gift and thanks me profusely for it every time I see her.  I didn't know at the time when I purchased it that she is a fan of Samsung and already has a Galaxy phone, so I got really lucky there.  She is a bit more tech savvy than I am, so based on her pleasure and enjoyment of this product I would recommend it.

So I've had this tablet for a few days noe to play around with it and I must say I  pretty im pressed with  it so far. I did get it for a few different reasons like school and entertainment. Haven't done the school thing yet but  I have checked out some movies and I almost freaked out because the first movie I chose was from '92 and it was very poor quality but I chose a different movie from that same era and it was digitally remastered and it was much better. I tried a few more and Im satisfied with this tablet. It can be a bit sluggish at times but Im diggin it.

Este dispositivo llego a tiempo y en las condiciones que ofreci Amazon, el color y la nitidez de la pantalla son increibles, muchas aplicaciones para todos los gustos y sobre todo la aplicacion de hablar directamente al equipo lo hace genial. Lo unico que extra es que no tiene SIM card, con eso seria completo, por eso no le doy un 5.

This device arrived on time and under the conditions offered Amazon, color and sharpness of the display are incredible, many applications for every taste and especially the application to talk directly to the equipment makes it great. The only thing I missed is that no has SIM card, with that would be complete, for this I not give it a 5.

It's a great tablet. The perfect size; you can easily hold it in one had which is ideal for reading. The screen has great resolution and the battery seems to last forever. The reason it has a four star rating is because, like everything else, it has its faults. I doesn't have S Beam, so I couldn't transfer files from my S3, but that was an easy fix, I just sent them using Bluetooth. It still doesn't make sense that it doesn't have it though. Another thing I didn't like is that even though all my apps are set to be updated manually it updates them automatically, which can be kind of annoying. Other than that it's an awesome tablet that I highly recommend. :)

Bought two of these refurbished, huge mistake. Lasted only a few months, like 3 or 4, before the charging ports failed within days of each other. It wouldn't charge or power on at all. After taking it too shop to get fixed, I discovered that certain versions of these tablets have a charging port that cannot be replaced. Waste of money and I had to buy new tablets, but I did purchase a 2 yr warranty this time! The tablets are great so the tablet itself is a 4 star product, but I wouldn't buy any refurbished from Amazon sellers!!!! I bought two different models from two different sellers and they both suffered the same problem about a week or two apart.

Ok. I'm a first time tablet owner. I must say that so far my experience has been great with this tablet! Understanding that because of the low price you'll not get the "best" features but beside that everything is workable. The back camera is not good but I didn't buy the tablet for the camera (i own a digital camera). Front facing camera gets the job done well. Battery life is excellent (can go 24 hrs + without charging.... depending on usage). I will have to expand the memory however. I'm able to stream my movies and use other flash content after downloading the adobe flash player. No glitches experienced as yet. I've purchased one for myself and 2 for my sister and father. Will update after another month or so of usage.

I bought this a year ago and tried to like it.  The tablet itself works like it is suppose to.  I just am not used to android so it was not for me.  I gave it to my daughter who has an android phone and she loves it.  I think it is probably one of the better quality low cost tablets and if you are not already used to the I-pads and phones then I am sure it would be fine.  A couple things worth mentioning are I thought the battery run time was kind of short, and it is finicky about wanting its oem charger.  The screen quality is great and it is nice that it has the micro sd card slot.

Arrived in a timely manner and was packaged well, the only comment is that the tape on the box that states if this is unsealed return the product. I didn't and everything is fine but makes me wonder why it was. This was a gift for my son who is 10 so I didn't want to spend top dollar in case of accidents and such. He uses it everyday and is loving the fact that he can watch Netflixs on it. I am not a techie so I can't get into all that, but I have noticed that while playing games on it it's a little slow to respond to play. He doesn't utilize all the tablet is able to do but it does everything he wanted one for. Good item for the money and a good starter tablet for a young user.

Ok so 8gb isn't enough for me, after awhile the lack of space slows the hardware down (as with most things)

I brought this for myself as a belated birthday present
The operating system is great runs smooth and vividly.
My favorite feature is the S Voice (It's samsung's version of Siri), just wish there was an option to make it masculine.

It charges fast which I really like and it lasts long. Normally I would unplug it around 11am and won't plug it back in until 4-6am , with extensive use.

Skype does run the battery down a bit.
So far the power saver feature causes freezing with facebook messenger and skype.

It's great for spanish lessons and bookclub reading

Just brought my mum one for my birthday yesterday this way she could watch her favorite shows on the go.
No real problems, other than memory but that is a simple fix. Microsd cards go on sale around back to school deals.

Try it out and see for yourself, it's a great tab for a great price.

p.s. you can control the font size so there's no true "size" problem.

UPDATE:  I've now used the tablet and it's pretty good - rating upgraded.  It seems to work fine for everything I've used it for.  The problem noted below (Linux/USB Mass storage) turns out to be Android 4.x related, not just Samsung.  Newer Linuxes have MTP drivers that make it useable, at least in Nautilus.  Based on all this, rating upgraded.

OLDER:
I have not used the tablet yet.  But I found this out when I went to copy files:  LINUX Users beware - you cannot connect this to your Linux machine and transfer files!  The phone has Windows-only drivers on it, so you can (usually) connect it to Windows and transfer files.  Extra software is required on a Mac.  Stock Android does USB mass storage by default in my experience.  I am seriously disappointed, though I will probably end up keeping it, as I have promised it to someone for Christmas and I don't have time to do a swap.

I had ordered this because I had thought my Galaxy Tab 2 had died. It has since come back to life but that is cool cus now I have 2 tablets. I would give the Tab 3 a 5 star rating except for one annoying thing. Quite often when I am online on this tablet all of a sudden I won't be able to bring a site up, it says unavailable check your network connection and I look and it says I am connected. I have to shut the wifi off and then put it back on again so it will recognize that it is connected and then I can continue what I was doing. I can't understand why it does this but it is not that big of a deal overall it is a great tablet the same as the Tab 2 was. Actually the Tab 2 would do that internet connection thing once in a while too but not as often as the Tab 3. Overall I am very happy with this tablet.

I ordered this tablet the 5th of July and got it the 7th as promised (it was a Prime product). I however ordered the tablet in the gold-brown colour, but received it in the midnight black colour; I couldn't be bothered to return it. The features have been cool and have been as described thus far, however, I did note that when this tablet was compared amongst its larger versions (the 8.0 and the 10.1), the box that lists that it has the multi-window feature, was left blank. I'm not sure if that's true for every 7.0 model, but the one I received does indeed have the multi-window feature. Both cameras take pretty decent pictures. Only one little weird design with the tablet: the volume buttons do not operate in the manner you'd expect them to; to turn the volume up, you'll have to press the conventional 'down' side of the button and vice versa.
Overall, I'm pleased with the tablet and will be posting pictures if I can.

This tablet, I have used and tested thoroughly and found that it does have overall advantages. So as a techie, I tested this tablet out and below I will list what I have found to be the Pros and Cons of this tablet. *Also, I own the Tab 3 7.0 3G (T211)UNLOCKED PHONE/TABLET COMBO (in white and I purchased it recently on Amazon and it is just 96 dollars more than this WiFi only one). The 3G model is a real phone and has a Micro Sim card slot in it. For just about 90 dollars more, I got the phone part and the 3g data abilities in the Tab 3 with 3g (which is very much worth the added cost). The P211 I also purchased on Amazon and now I carry it everyday as a phone and mini tablet combo. So if you need a phone and tablet in one unit consider the Tab 3 7.0 3g as it is just one unit to carry for phone and tablet! Both my Tab 3 versions are peppy and run great!

Tablet tethers to my cell, and it is rocket fast on the web.  Overall?  For under 200 bucks delivered  to my door not bad!!  2 weeks into use...HUGE  problem...the headphone jack went silent...started making a clicking sound only...now no sound!!  A common problem with the product based on my research.  You can go to wireless headphones...but me personally...I like hard wire so...I guess more EMF for my brain.?

Positives:  No lag in key strokes, price is good... I like Samsung personally, graphics are clean, have'nt experienced pixilated screen with streaming video, size is perfect, SD card slot, more freedom than Apple products.  Again, you get your money's worth with Samsung.

Negatives:  I believe a common manufacturing error has occurred with the headphone jack, as it started right out of the box and progressed to clicking alternating with working fine to now no audio at all from headphone jack.  Camera is not up to par with most Samsung cell phones from the same generation.

I  will stay with the Samsung tablet due to freedom of controlling data etc...hopefully the next gen tab has a better camera megapixel like the S4...AND the headphone jack manufacture improves.

This tablet is good. Almost perfect size. Good size screen but still can fit in some large pockets. The stock memory of 8gb can be filled quick because some games can be 1gb in size. But the memory can be expanded easily and not for too much. Performance is good. I am still surprised by the graphics of some games. I just wish I could get or find a gimp or photoshop like app to do graphic designs on the go without having to root or basically hack the tablet. The wifi range is good if you are within your home or the same building as the router but it can get weak when  you are outside. I am looking for a way to boost its signal by maybe using an usb wifi adapter for rasberrry pi like boards and use a usb to micro usb adapter to connect it to the tablet. Should work since rasberry pi uses android and linux like this can but this tablet has to be hacked to root it so you can install linux while it comes with android out of box. I would recommend and buy this tablet again. Battery is about 12 hours with wifi off but with wifi on it can be drained in about 6 hours if you surf the net alot and can be drained even quicker if playing a game with 3d graphics while wifi is on. But with all the usb power adapters on the market I doubt that will be much of a problem for most people. I have two wall power adapters and one car adapter while only spending about 40 us dollars so i can not complain too much about having enough power for my needs.

Received the tablet just the other day and being my first tablet, it took a slight amount of  break in time.
The size is just right for me and I am glad I did not buy anything larger as easy and light portability was part of my buying decision.  The color quality far exceeded my expectations.  Played a newscast from NBC and it was almost as good as watching my HD TV. It is a fast device with a logical interface that provides smooth connections to the internet.

I am impressed by how fast the start up and power off works..........literally a few seconds to connect or disconnect.  The keyboard is user friendly and if you purchase the optional 64gb micro sd card, you should plenty of storage space for smaller sized photos.  Apps are also downloaded with above average speed and work very well.

On the downside:

Strength of Wi-Fi signal is reduced sometimes but not really a big issue as it usually shows full waves but when it falters I lose only one of them........still a reliable connection, although my laptop and notebook are 100% in the same area which is about three rooms away from the router.  When the tab is in the same room (or next room) as router it performs 100%.

I know I can buy the screen protector (and I will), but fingerprints get piled up on the glossy screen quite fast.  So for now I wipe the screen with a good cleaning cloth designed for computer screens.

Lastly, I would rate the battery life as underperforming..........2-3 hours if high power is used.  Of course, you can adjust power in settings to save battery power.

Other than these minor shortcomings, I feel that you are getting an excellent valued product for $199.  Don't think you will be disappointed at all.

First of all, this is a decent tab.  I like it for what I use it for.  Value wise, it is a 'great success.'  I use it as my car navigation/radio device.  First thing I did was root it (XDA developers is AWESOME).  I left the stock rom on there, but needed root access for the Tasker app to be able to do all the things I wanted it to do.  I use an Akron dash holder to keep it mounted in my car.  When I power on the car, it boots Pandora, Waze, and other apps I want open while driving.  This thing spends 98% of it's time on my dash.  It does all these tasks admirably.  I have no idea how well it will do in the Utah summer heat though.  This is the WiFi model, I use WiFi hotspot from my phone for data while driving.

Pros:
- Bright screen with decent resolution
- Battery life is quite long (even though it is always plugged in while driving)
- It's Android rooted, so you can do whatever you want if you know what you are doing
- Audio is sufficiently loud (I normally have the headphones plugged in to my aux while driving but sound is good)

Cons:
- Doesn't do great in the cold, even though I can't expect that; if it's cold, prepare for cold warnings and no charging, sluggish LCD refresh.
- Menu/Back buttons don't light up on this 7" model, sucks when night driving while trying to use it
- Camera might as well not even be there, it has terrible resolution and horrible color.  Don't plan on using it for any reason.

Overall, for a dash rider, it rocks.  Using Waze, Torque app for car data, Pandora or whatever music app you like, and Tasker seals the whole deal.  This app has a medium learning curve, but once you master it, you can make you phone do just about whatever you can imagine automatically.  8/10 would buy again.  Good for kids too at home with the WiFi.  If it breaks, oh well.  Not $500 bucks down the drain like an Ipad if it gets broken.  This thing has 200% more VALUE dollar for dollar over the Ipad.

Cant beat the price at $150. I bought this for my 8 year old son, instead of getting him a pricier and smaller iPod for xmas. I also bought a 64 gig card with it, so I can load it up with movies and games for him. (I have a program that downscales DVD's for mobile devices on my PC, so all the movies are free for us). I'll put some music on there for him also, all from my own collection. All sorts of free games he loves off of the Android Google Play marketplace. Plus, I can get him all sorts of childrens books that he'll have more fun reading on here than an actual real book. And lots of interactive books, which he loves. I totally recommend this tablet for kids. Just buy a decent case for it, and a screen protector, or take it to one of those cell phone accessory stores and have them put a screen protector on it.

I did a lot of research before choosing to buy a tablet to use as an e-reader, and chose this one because of its size, price, and the fact I've always been very happy with Samsung products. The expandable memory allows a MicroSD card to expand the memory from the default 8GB for significantly less than it would cost to buy an e-reader or tablet with those same internal specs. The height and width dimensions are roughly the same as a mass-market paperback and are perfect for carrying it around on a daily basis and fitting in my purse.

The Android OS lets me install all the apps I need for what I read. Along with several news and magazine apps, I use reading apps for Kindle, Nook, Aldiko, and Kobo, and I'm confident I'll be able to find whatever else I'll need in the future to consolidate all my e-books in one place. Each app operates independently, so I can download reading material directly from the internet to the app or device or update my libraries with what I purchase using a computer or other device. The Dropbox app makes a good middleman for getting free books from Project Gutenberg or documents from other sources to Aldiko.

The way the tablet is set up physically makes it perfect for e-reading. There is a button on the lower left which gives different options based on the app being used, and the back button on the lower right toggles you back from the book to the library. To use the Kindle and Nook apps as examples, once the apps are up and running, you would not know you were on an Android tablet and not on a dedicated Kindle or Nook device.

Of course, there are other perks to having a tablet, including being able to hook up to free wifi for internet browsing and email, games, Google maps, music, weather, other cool Android apps (which are very similar, if not identical, to iOS apps), widgets, and the front/back camera. The screen has the option for automatic brightness adjustment, so you're not always fiddling in the settings to make it comfortable to see.

I bought this for my daughter. It stopped working 6 weeks after delivery. Too late to return it. I will seek support from Samsung on how to fix the problems.

Update 3/2/14 I followed the directions on the Samsung site of things to try and get it working again. One was to plug it in for one hour and then hold the on button down for 5 seconds. It booted up and works great. My daughter had already tried this a couple of times and it did not work for her. For now, the problem is resolved and I am sending it back to her. I am changing from one star to three (not 5 as it did stop working).

I've had this tablet for about 2 weeks now... and its like my sidekick.you know how we didnt have cell phones years ago now you have to turn around and go back home to get it cause you just have to have it.this tablet is with me like the pacifier is with a baby. whenever im ready to go I slip it in my purse grab the power cord and im off.love the wifi. so many businesses have free wifi from the eateries I frequent to my grocery store or the car repair spot. I go to town on this thing.i can read pdf excel powerpoint presentations you have a world of apps.i dont know where this thing can go wrong. Im very careful about what I download if I dont use it its deleted.i havent saved much just still seeing how much it can manage.i did say before I started saving pictures & books I would get a micro sd card. the storage is expandable to I believe 64 gb.i can say so far the camera quality is a little ify.it may be one of those where you need bright light and a close up. Will test that more. Using the internet is just as good as the portability. and just when you think it may stall (not that its slow at all just low expectations) you see the blue processing line going across the top of the screen like lightning. So far im very much enjoying the tablet.along with this purchase I bought the tech armor anti glare & anti fingerprint screen protector (love it). I recall the reviews being ify but it was a snap for me its a 3 pk comes with a smoother & wiping cloth. I also purchased a silicone skin cover to protect from scratches. I think i will get a case. Its another level of protection it was a life saver for my last tablet. I liked to open in close like a book. One thing I wanted to mention if your looking at your screen and it looks too dark dont worry it auto adjust to your lighting. If the room has low lighting the screen will automatically dim. turn the lighting brighter then the screen gets brighter.  Oh another thing that drove me nuts was wanting to organize or remove apps or delete one of the 3 home screens. To move the apps around hold drag and drop. if you want on another screen hold and drag to either side you'll see a blue line as if turning the page. It'll go to the next screen. To delete apps hold drag and drop to the trash bin. To adjust the home screens while viewing the home screen drag your fingers across screen as if pinching the screen. the screens will minimize and you can drag and drop to the trash bin

First the good, people put down the screen resolution being low, but samsung screens are one of the best , there 1024 by 600 resoution is so much better than other screen with same resolution . Side by side with my kindle fire hd i can barely notice much difference. The tab is not extreme fast but it is not slow either, if you install  a task killer or ram manger , you can keep the ram clear and it will improve your browsing experience. People say it take 3 secs more to open apps, really 3 secs if you cant wait an extra 3 secs, its time to slow down your life.
  I test the wifi and it works great the bars are not correct , when iam outside i get one bar but the tab work perfectly still loading pages and loading u-tube, test it yourself u will find even with 1 bar showing the connection is great.This is a perfect tab for movies and emails, the size is quite small and light fits almost perfectly in my pants pocket.
  Since the price drop you can find these as low as 149.00 , which is a great price for the tab. The tv remote is great for using the tab to control tv.
  Most people make fun or hate samsung touch wiz, but i love it , it has lots of useful features and mekes it easy to use the tablet, i have own the nexus 7 2013 and yes it is faster and smoother, but i like the samsung so much better, with the nexus you have to be very gental as it is very thin I was always afraid the screen would crack.
  Like i said if you install a ram manager or task killer and keep the memory clear , you will find the tab work fine, as long as your not expecting it to be blazing fast....
  Really the only real bad is the 8 gigs of strorage which is about 4.5 gigs useable .....

My husband complaint that he did not have a tablet... My kids have one each and I Have 2 (well, for anyone in the house to use).  But my husband wanted his own!  So, what a perfect gift for his birthday!  I have always liked Samsung products, and this one was just as I expected.  I added a memory card and loaded some movies and music; downloaded some games apps and others he may be interested and he is loving it.
The tablet is fast (in my opinion) and the screen is nice and clear.  The camera works well (even though he does not use it much). Mainly at this point he uses it for movies and music, browse web, play a few games and skype.  A very good buy and simple enough for the beginner user.

I'm not one to go to the top when rating anything, especially when I haven't had it long. But I like it better than a mere 4 stars. I'm still figuring out all the quirks. I wanted a tablet that I could carry when commuting by bike. WiFi only is fine; I have access to networks in most of the places I would want to use it. It saves paying for a data plan.

This little gadget is fast. The 7-inch screen seems quite generous, considering I would have settled for something even smaller. Now that I have it I'm glad I didn't. This one is the ideal size to fit the rack bags on either of the bikes I regularly use to commute. No complaints so far. I'll probably get a Bluetooth keyboard because it it hard to type on the virtual keyboard that comes up on screen. It's still surprisingly effective even with my fat fingers. I wouldn't want to blog a novel on it, but it will do for quick posts, email check-ins and spur of the moment searches.

I was looking at quite a few 10.1" Android Tablets under the $250 mark but left a 7-8" option open if I found a decent one . I couldn't pass up $149.00 shipped , using Prime . I have a Samsung Centura phone so I was easily familiar with the operating system and functions . Out of the box this tablet is awesome and does the things I want it to do . It's lightweight , battery life is pretty damn good around the 8/hr. mark depending on applications running and usage . It charges quickly like most Samsung products and comes with a nice Samsung-branded charger .

The only thing I wish it had , is the Multi-Window feature found in the Samsung Tab3 8" and possibly the 5MP rear Camera of the 8" , since this one is only 3MP . I think a fair competitor would be the ASUS Google Nexus 7" which has a NVIDIA Tegra 3 quad-core processor and is priced in the same range . I am very happy and would definitely recommend this Tablet to first-time users and those wanting something smaller but very capable .

It's also not that fast.
I couldn't even fully charge without the adapter getting dangerously over heated. The good parts about this computer aren't enough to overcome these flaws and are pretty much standard.
Worked great for fist two weeks, then it wouldn't boot up.

Randomly locks up -- unresponsive, screen goes blank. Happens infrequently, but when it does my work since the last Save is lost and unrecoverable. Others report similar experience with Windows 11. I've downloaded and installed the latest Windows 11 update. Thought that would fix the problem but it bit me again. This is not something that can be very well demonstrated because it can go days without locking up. I don't have the time or the inclination to try all of the various remedies suggested online. (I did a memory scan, which did not cure the problem.) So I'm going to put it on the shelf and use an old machine. Maybe after a few months I'll download the latest updates and try it again. This is really insidious because it can go a long time before locking up and then the likelihood of losing a lot of work is greater. Probably it would be best to throw it in the trash and buy a Windows 10 machine while they're still available.

I picked this up to replace an older XPS-13 and even though this Inspiron 13 is a lower tier model it is noticeably more compact and higher performing in nearly every metric.Wifi, Startup, and Browser speeds are atleast twice as fast as my old XPS.Some small gripes are that it is not made of aluminum, has only 1 USB-A port, has no touch screen, and the hinge design does not allow much tilt angle.Overall at under $600 I am pretty happy with it and dont think I could bring myself to pay over $1000 for the XPS if I could do it again when this model packs so much more value per dollar.
I like the 16:10 screen for everyday use and for CAD program that I use with woodworking hobby.
Great computer for the price. Well built and great specs

I was hoping to capitalize on the CPU power for simple ethernet work.  Problem is that I have not been able to get this computer to work for longer than 40 minutes before getting a BSOD.  Have tried updating the OS and resetting the OS..  still the same problems.  And never the same error codes either.
In addition, when I try to update the computer to the latest OS feature, it crashes during install every single time.  Needless to say I haven't been able to use this computers potential at all.

Split it into 3, with the main drive C being just 150 gb. I didn't even realize that until I quickly ran out of room from uploading videos, forcing me to move videos to the partitioned drive to clear space. By then I would have had to reformat the hd to get the full benefit. Had one other issue. It died after a few weeks. Fortunately the tech support helped me and told me how to fix it. I had to tear it apart and remove the tiny battery type object and it worked again, and is still working 2 years later. Good little computer, but make sure they don't partition.
We need another one, it is good for our job

The computer never worked, SJ COMPUTERS LLC made me pay for the return to their shop to fix it, and they returned it not working again, it doesn't even turn on. Very bad customer service and bad product. Don't buy!

My first review was block for "not following guidelines".  To detailed I guess, So let me just say, it is not as advertised, wrong hard drive, wrong placement of OS, no hdmi, no wifi and bad packaging.

This has been an absolute nightmare to own.

It constantly freezes. I've reinstalled windows so many damn times.

You get what you pay for! I'm never buying HP anything ever again!!!!
Absolutely quiet. Super fast.

very sound computer :))))
way faster than my 2013 iMac :0
most people don't recomend buying a used P C but I thought I would try, 4 months  and won't reboot,  only guaranteed 90 days
Excellent product. Quiet and fast.

The PC case is scratched up, did not include a  WiFi Adapter or HDMI Adapter as promised, there is no COA sticker anywhere on the PC, and the included 2TB drive makes a loud grinding noise and has a manufacture date from 2010! I will be returning this PC.
Great performance, exactly as described
En perfecto estado, con los accesorios descritos en la compra, y funcionando perfectamente
Couldn't ask for a more capable machine for this price, and compactnesss.
after a month of using this no problems works great
I use mine for running vms on my homelab
Very clean and ready to go.  No trouble setting it up. Quick Delivery and good pricing!
This is a solid computer, a great bargain. Seller replies to my question very quickly with satisfactory answer. Highly recommended.
Just so so.
didn't use tech support. Thickness is fine. Works as designed.
Great PC. No issues whatsoever.  Thanks to the ssd and 16gb of ram it is very fast and quiet. An outstanding value imho.
came well packed and looks new. Features were as stated - working well currently - would buy again from seller
exactly as advertised and the one I got showed almost no wear on the case
Received my shipment and they did not include the hdmi adapter.
Its one of the better desktop unit so I have purchased seems to be pretty fast and Ive had no issues
The product received met the stated description. The shipping seemed to take a long time but we received the item without damage.
Computer was great until hard drive failed on day 4.
Using this as a host for different VM environments. Installed virtual Machined for training on Microsoft & Cisco.
Dont forget to insert the wifi key and run the drive before trying to connect web as I did. Most satisfied with the tower and the deal. Best buy!
Clean inside and out. Fresh OS install on SSD. Wifi dongle and displayport -> HDMI adapter.  I connected my 4K TV with no problems.
CS adjusted the order and made it correct and followed up with communication. The unit works excellent and I would recommend  it to all.
Very happy with this new computer which enabled me to have Windows 10.  Great - and speedy!
From my son's point of view,100% value.  I wish it was fully programed with Microsoft word, office and publishsure.

Item shipped with an 8 year old hard drive (older than the manufacture date of the computer (2014 computer with 2010 hard drive). Hard drive makes grinding noise when idle.  No DVD drive installed - not as described.

No DP/HDMI cable included as others have indicated. Depends on the seller.
Computer is exactly as described.  The SSD is blazing fast and keeps up with whatever I throw at it.  Customer service was fantastic to deal with.  Highly recommended.

We have purchased several of this PCs from other vendors but MicroBee does not know what they are doing.  It says warranty for 1 year and number they provided (888) 305-3402 has been disconnected.  The operation system was installed, installed on the secondary drive (2TB drive) and the SSD drive was not even configured and the video ports were misaligned (mother board needed adjusting) terrible QAqc.  Buyers beware!!!!

I have to order twice this item as the first one has arrived with broken parts and uncleaned. The second one arrived with misalignment of display ports at the back of the system. PC door quality is very cheap quality and also the power plug is very loose and it comes off frequently and shuts off the computer.

Bought it may 3rd, Set it up may 15th, drive died last night (June 10th).  Otherwise system has been doing well, fast for the things I use it for (web content, documents, audio editing).
Is quiet and according to coretemp it stays pretty cool even under load.

I have contacted the seller, will update the review when they respond.

No hdmi adapter as specified in the description.
This is a preliminary rate as I just opened and unpacked the product.  Will update in a few weeks.

Early update. It works fine. I removed all the junk programing it comes with and installed a few usable ones after it did all its updates. So I added a second star.
I needed a little more umph in my studio. This computer is great. Small size, big performance. Tech was excellent taking care of a small glitch.
This was very easy to set up, have had no problems that I've needed tech support on the computer.  Love that it doesn't have all those annoying apps that comes with new computers.
So far this PC has worked great for my home studio.  16GB ram easily handles multitrack recording with lots of VST's on each channel without lag or latency, which is exactly what I wanted!

Arrived quickly, not dirty inside, runs well. Thank you.The disk drive and wifi are external (usb) which turned out well because space is left inside for an additional SSD and video card. I like it (after two weeks.)

Seemed like a deal and I needed an i7 to run production in a small machine shop. This computer was also going to run some fiber laser programs but after opening and running the machine its be relegated to shipping. Claims to be i7, claims to have wifi built in, niether are true. Initial boot brought me right into windows with a preset user and programs already loaded... sketchy... After a thorough reformatting it seems to be okay speed-wise. Aesthetically there was some greasy looking spots on top (maybe paint) and some gross looking cat hair or fuzz stuck to the stickers residue that were removed. Buy from someone else...
Just the way discryb the inside everything is new the ouside no scratch tech support fix all your needs will always buy from SUNSET MICRO
Great performing system, like new really like it. Great value.
This is a great computer for the price. I had a couple minor issues when I received it, but Moe in tech support helped me right away.
Purchased this computer for our Church. Added a low profe video card, abd runs our Easy Worship perfectly.
I don' dislike anything. It takes up less space and has more up to date features than my old tower. I am still learning more about it as I use it and I suppose I will eventually have to update it.

This is a great buy, it's fast and quiet, my unit had some sticker residue on it and my display port to HDMI adapter was a little faulty, the seller replaced it without question and the residue cleaned off with a little alcohol

Everybody else seems to have great things to say. I wish my experience was the same. I received a computer that doesn't boot up with some damage to the back. Since then I have received NO help. NO conversation. Nothing. You would think with such an expensive item them would be ready to make the situation right. This will be the last time I purchase something expensive over the internet. If I had bought this from WalMart or Best Buy they would have made it right by now.

UPDATE:
Still no response from the seller so I had to return the computer. Now let's wait a week for them to get it and return my money. What a waste. Amazon was of no help either. Seriously consider purchasing your PC from a physical store.

Machine arrived without wifi and hdmi adapters. Microbee sent adapters within 2 weeks . I am delighted with the machine now. It looks new and is now complete. Excellent machine for the money. Recommended.

Jerry

This desktop is a great buy, it's fast and quiet.  The Microbee Customer Service was very helpful with replacing the DVD player with a DVD-RW for me.  Will use order their products and services again in the future.
Computer is kind of slow but seems to be working as described.

We purchased 2 units for one of our clients and they love the computer.  Fast, reliable and just fun to use.  Internet run like a race car and never seems to want to stall.  With plenty of memory installed it makes multitasking a snap.

This is not a computer that youre going to have for more that 5 months, I brought it less Than a year and it is not working, I contacted the manufacturer and they said that it is to old to fix it (10 years). Dont waist your money

Had an issue with promised accessories mentioned in product description not being included with the PC. The description said PC came with wifi adaptor, Keyboard. Mouse, and HDMI adaptor. Only power cord was in bow with PC. Seller called me and made it right within minutes of posting my complaint.
I bought a new video card , and a SATA board to upgrade this.  I also put Windows 10 and Windows 98 on it.  It is very fast and a good value for the money.

Everything about ordering this was scary for me but I can assure you it was the easiest thing Ive ever done in the computer works fast and flawlessly! Thank you so much- you guys have done a great job refurbishing this tower!

Great desktop, fast with plenty of memory and storage, 256GB SSD with 2TB hard drive is a nice combination. Refurbish was well done, very clean, well packaged  No problems with setup of Win10 license and loading of software, no need for tech support.

The computer is as described. It works great. It did have a few scuff marks on the plastic ad the case was repainted, but it is refurbished. I wanted an i7 to be able to use zoom virtual backgrounds.  and this worked wonderfully.

I've had computers for 20 years now (have a small on line business).  This computer really had everything I wanted except the most important thing - it needed to work.  It came on for 2 seconds, off for 2, on for two, etc. etc. etc.  I checked everything thoroughly and it just wouldn't even come on.  It was boxed up and back at the UPS store within the hour.  My refund just came through after having been a week since I returned it, so that was good.  I wish I dared take a chance again, but I don't.

Everything is good and functions perfectly. Only issue I faced is the HDMI port is not working as in I can't plug my cord into it. So I'm using VGA instead. I tried multiple times to try to fix it but it's not working probably from shipping.

I am happy that I purchased this HP Elite Desk computer.  At the beginning, there was a little difficulty setting up the disk drives, but Stallion Tek's tech support was friendly and helpful and walked me through the set-up in a seamless manner.  I would purchase this product again and recommend Stallion Tek for their friendly efficient service.

Not as described. No HDMI as listed in the description. After two attempts the seller made it right and besides the inconvenience I am satisfied.
I would give 5 stars but in reading other comments this isn't the first time the HDMI adapter issue has come up and they really should verify contents before shipping.

My PC arrived in pristine condition looking as new with all advertised compliments in place.  Windows 10 was installed and I was able to quickly customize features to my liking.  The SSD drive is fast and the HDD easily addressed as additional storage.  Overall, I am quite pleased with this purchase.

Must have come straight off the storage shelf to me. Needed 16 critical updates immediately. The wireless mini that come with it is virtually useless, slow and not much range -- looked it up and its value is 14 bucks so guess you get what you get. Also, the keyboard and mouse quality is less than a dollar store toy. Flimsy lightweight /thin plastic. Going direct to recycle bin. Once I connected my cisco wireless into it I was able to download the updates and begin accessing the internet. So far its doing fine. On a more positive note - The shipping box was very good and components very well protected with inflated casing.

I'll start by saying that I don't use this for gaming. I do use it for processing pictures on photoshop, surfing the internet, word processing, etc. For that it works terrifically. The i7 processor with the 16gb of ram works very fast. The fan is so silent that I had to open it up to verify that it was working.

Comes as advertised, had me spooked for a minute with the i5 processor sticker but had the i7 in it. 16gb of ram was ddr3 with 1333Mhz which isn't great but not bad for the price. Came as advertised booted right up and was easy to use. No issues with the fan. The proprietary power supply and motherboard will likely be an issue later on but at the moment this is great.
I bought this so i could run Photoshop for a college class. I put a GT-730 graphics card in it and it is working perfect so far

Things seemed to be going well for a week.  I then put my trust in storing data on the 2TB hard drive to free the solid state drive up for the operating system.  The drive crashed and would suddenly no longer boot.  I had to remove it from the PC and make the necessary changes in the bios.  So now I'm out of a storage device and more importantly the art/music data I had created.
I really appreciate the Bargain_r_us2 customer service. Even though I didn't keep this computer because it was noisy, they were swift at enabling that I do a quick return. Thank you!

Not sure I can say anything more then my Title. This is a great little Computer for the money. The Processor is a couple of years old but between the 2 hard drives and memory you cannot go wrong for the price. I would definitely recommend to friends and family!

This computer is great so far for my business. Two things to note, it came with a different but better CPU (i7-4790) instead of the i7-4770 and I would have loved to have had an HDMI adapter in the box. I only use display port on high end gaming computers.
Decent quality good cable management the only problem I have is the mouse and keyboard that came with the PC was broken but thank God I ordered a new set at the same time.

I initially received the wrong computer.  While it was frustrating, hear me out. I got the wrong computer at 3pm on a Thursday. I called Stalliontek. I had the right computer by 9am the next day. I am in Alabama, they are in Maryland. Let that sink in. The computer itself is fantastic with the usb 3.0 on the front and is super fast and extremely quiet. Looks brand new. Quality product. Quality product. Mine came with the wifi dongle and the hdmi adapter.

It handles heavy usage very well. I can run some pretty CPU, RAM and surprisingly GPU intensive games. It can run basically any application, I wouldnt count on it for gaming use but I can run many games. All specifications are true. Its very very quiet, I can keep it running all night without any issues even on high usage (which I wouldnt recommend but it still works). The SSD is very nice, but the 2TB additional drive makes the PC amazing. For the price, its a truly amazing PC.

I bought many of theses HP refurbished units in the past years, it's really awesome for the price, super fast. Just be aware that given that it's refurbished there is a higher risk of the motherboard to suddenly die, when that happens you're out of luck, it has no warranty and you have to dump the computer, you could salvage the data from the hard-drive. It happened to me on 2 computers after using it about a year, while many are still going strong after many years.

Its been a week and this machine has work perfectly for what I needed it for. I use this computer as a media server for Plex. This computer has improved my experience with transcoding outside my network. The only thing that was a negative was the the internal harddrive was not recognized so I had to get the hard drive recognized and everything was smooth.

I like the unit as a whole and the size is great. Speed is fast enough for my needs this far.
What I do not like......No HDMI adapter in the box at all. As other reviews have stated they left that out and it was crucial for my use with an HD TV as a monitor. Stalliontek told me they've fixed the issue but I am sure they told the last customer the same tale. So a Best buy trip and $20 additional dollars later I got her running the way I intended. Buyer beware if you need the HDMI adapter prepare for it to not be included.......

This thing is great.  The internals were so clean you would have thought it was brand new.  I'm well-pleased with my purchase BUT...  a few surprises were no SD card reader.  That's a pretty odd thing for a modern computer to be missing.  The other thing is this computer is never going to win a beauty contest.  She has the heart of a champion but a face you'd rather forget.  The boxy and plain appearance isn't a big deal if you put it beneath your desk.  Tremendous bang for the buck!

I purchased this PC mainly as a Blue Iris security camera software server.  Works great, running five 4K and two 4MP cams 24/7 only using and average of 44% CPU and about 20% of the memory.  The i7-4770 processor has "quick sync" with its Intel integrated  HD4600 graphics.  Add the 16GB RAM, 2TB HDD, 240GB SSD, and Win 10 Pro makes this a great deal for around $300.  A new i7-4770 processor alone is about $200! (best price I could find at this time).

Works great so far.  The keyboard and mouse were wired, and not very high quality, but I didn't buy it for the keyboard and mouse.  Everything works well, and it's plenty fast enough for my wife and her small business.  If I had to pick a reason I didn't give it five stars, it's only because it was a little dinged up on the outside.  Other than that, great for the price!

I purchased this unit in mid Feb 2019. After setup all was good and unit was fine. In late June the solid state drive failed. On the description of the unit on the AMAZON site it clearly states there is a FULL year warranty on this unit. Now TekRefurbs AND Amazon are claiming there is only 90 days!! Amazon "CLAIMS" the full year warranty is a manufacturers warranty, of course we ALL know the manufacturer has absolutely NOTHING to do with a refurbed unit. I still contacted them as I was asked to do and they confirmed to me that their warranty had expired in 2017, (and had been 3 years long). Still nothing from TekRefurbs NOR Amazon and now to make a bad issue worse, I had purchased an extended warranty when I bought the computer but when I contacted them they also told me the site says it has a year warranty so they will not honor their warranty because it doesn't go effect until the origional one expires! For whatever reason Amazon has now cancelled and refunded the extended warranty I had purchased when I purchased the machine!! I had NEVER mentioned nor asked them to cancel that!! So now I have NO hope of ever getting this covered. Still all I get from TekRefurbs AND Amazon is that the full year warranty is "manufacturer" warranty! This is a PRIME example of the beginning of the decline of Amazon. I know as much of my few thousand dollars have already started being spent elsewhere.!!

I sent an email to the company about a software issue I resolved on my own, no problem.  I did not hear back from them, however.  I am wondering about that if I ever need tech support.

The key board is the cheapest of cheap, which I read about in the reviews and was prepared for.

The computer set up was easy and it is working great.  I am very satisfied with my purchase.

First PC was defective, but Stalliontek customer support responded and sent out a second PC that worked perfectly.  This unit is fast, quiet and with an updated Win10 OS is quite easy to use compared to older Windows operating systems. Upon receiving any reconditioned computer, make sure you check all the hardware ports for functionality and do the system updates before setting it up. Should give you years of safe and efficient usage.

This is actually a 600 G1, not an 800 G1. However, I still rank it top notch. It came already with a username and no password, hence I'm knocking a star off. If it had come ready to set up, it'd be 5 stars easy. When a PC is already setup, it takes so much longer to go back and figure out what they did and fix things the way you need them.

I've ordered numerous of these for clients. With the SSD, WiFi and 2nd HDD they are a great price for the value. Even the the I7 processors are 4th gen the performance is great when paired with the SSD drive. Don't expect them to be in perfect condition but I haven't had any of my clients complain.
These machines have room for additional drives if needed.

Bought this PC for a video surveillance application (Blue Iris), and it doesn't have any trouble keeping up with a dozen 5M pixel cameras. However, the holes that give access to the connectors on the back sheet metal, were misaligned in such a way that it was impossible to plug in the Ethernet or video cables. I had to remove the mother board and insert spacers to make them match up well enough to plug in. These makes me wonder about the thoroughness of the testing after it was refurbished.

This product arrived yesterday and has worked fine so far. The shipping box was undamaged and contained the computer, a keyboard, power cord and a wifi USB adapter. I checked the specs and it was as advertised. It did not come with the vga to hdmi connector (-1 star), which is no a problem because I am adding a low profile video card which has hdmi along with sound. The Windows 10 pro key provided worked just fine. All in all it is a fast, quiet computer and quite the bang for the buck. I would recommend to to a friend.

This is a refurb, so I expected it to be a little "rough around the edges".
The unit was a lot cleaner than I expected.

The motherboard had been seated a little high in the rear, making the ports essentially inaccessible.  A few turns of  a half-dozen torx screws later and it was as it should be.

A few parts were missing from the shipment, an the supplied keyboard was broken.  The vendor. MicroBee (ComSales)  fixed everything without any problem.  They answered the support line within a minute, and resolved all of my issues. The replacements/missing parts were fedexed to me so I had them within a couple of days of my original shipment arriving.

Very happy, and I would certainly do business with them again!  Nothing in this world is perfect, but we can make it better by doing better. MicroBee did better!

My unit arrived in very decent shape. Everything worked. Did not like the fact that the user, Owner, was already set up and the computer name was set up. I really want to reinstall everything from scratch but am concerned that I might have issues with the licensing key.

Two corrections on the stated config:
  #1 CPU in my unit is actually a Core i7-4790 (a slight improvement over the stated i7-4770).
  #2 Although the WiFi yin yang symbol is displayed next to the image of the computer on the web page, there was no wi-fi dongle in the box (a slight disappointment - you lost a star for that).

So I ordered the listed computer.  Read all the reviews and was hoping that I was not going to be one of the customers that did not receive the HDMI adapter.  Of course I did not receive it.  On top of that the computer once turned on and hooked up right made a loud noise over and over.  Given the fact it was late I waited till the next morning to try and install everything.  The next morning the computer was making an additional sound on top of the other clicks.  Once setup the Windows key did not work.  I restarted the computer and after I entered my password the screen would just go black and nothing would happen.  I called Amazon and they said they can only help with power problems.  With that we did a 3 way call to the manufacturer.  After having him look up the product he said that the warranty EXPIRED ON THIS IN 2014!  How is that even possible?  I literally just received the computer the day before, and on top of that I was shipped what I can only imagine is someone else return as the windows key was already taken.  Not sure if this is Amazons fault or the manufacturer.  I'm lead to believe it's Amazons as I would hope the manufacturer would not have computers that have expired warranties on their shelves.  I told them I would like to give them a second try and ship me one that has a NEW warranty and with the HDMI adapter, and the Amazon rep told me she could not guarantee that.  So basically my only option was to ship back for a refund.  BEWARE to all who buy this computer, even if it is working I would still call in and make sure your warranty is not EXPIRED! I have never left a negative review but I feel this was so bad I had to.

The packaging was secured and the PC was in great shape.  It does show wear and tear, but it's a refurbished PC and that's to be expected.  The price was right on for the specs and I didn't want to make a purchase for a new system because it's too much.  We had an older Dell PC that lasted us from 2009 and I gotta say, we got our money's worth.  As for this desktop, it started right up and it was a clean install, meaning I had to setup Windows 10 and it comes with a digital license, so as long as this hard drive doesn't tank, I can reinstall Windows 10 as many times as I want and it will be a legit copy.  Overall, I like this purchase.

I bought this particular PC in part because it had a large SSD, and WIFI capability. It was the WIFI that put it over the other PCs advertised as similar on Amazon.

Even though it came with virtually no instructions on what to do, I was able to eventually get the thing running and the important apps installed and working, such as email, etc.

But, now i have to find and acquire a WIFI access card or something. It's a disappointment. I'd be tempted to return it, but, dang it, I live 3,000 miles away from the US land mass in Belize. Returning items is no easy task.

Other than that, what can I say? It's a PC, it runs Windows 10 Pro. All the updates installed successfully, and it will work for me for a reasonable amount of money paid out for it. It just rankles me that a simple task, such as making sure the WIFI card (or whatever was supposed to have been included) actually got stuck in the box, couldn't be done right.

I purchased this to upgrade an I7 860 so I could have Win 10 PRO without having to build a new tower.
The 3rd gen 3770k and 16g of ram still scream even though it is and 8yr old processor.
Everything works fine except the 2TB storage drive was 10 YEARS OLD!! It was a WD Black drive.
I understand that they run tests on the hardware before they ship these out but a 10yr old hard drive??
These towers were brand new in 2014 so how does a 10yr old HDD get installed as a backup?
I buy WD Black drives for every PC I have because they come with 5yr warranties. I change them out after about 3-4yrs for safety.
Be prepared to replace the WiFi adapter with something better. They sent a little USB one that didn't work very well 2 rooms away from my WiFi 6 router. I just installed a Pci express wireless card also WiFi 6
Same for the keyboard and mouse.
Those 3 items are the cheapest stuff they could find.
I'm keeping the unit but I am tossing the old HDD because you're just asking for failure.
The SSD is also a brand I've never heard of but it appeared new. It was a "Super Talent"??
This was for the wife to surf the internet, so no biggy if it's an off brand cause I'll just clone it to another SSD for backup.

I received the PC after a couple days of ordering it. Very quickly. When I opened the box I was amazed how well it was packaged. Could have dropped it off a two-story building that would not have hurt it.  The outside of the PC is in very good shape.
Open the cover inside was clean.  Powered on the PC. Windows 10 Pro was per installed waiting for me to do final setup and login.
 With windows installed on a SSD drive the system is very fast when logging in and out.

When I got the PC it should have included a Wi-Fi adapter and an HDMI adapter which were not included. Within a couple of hours after contacting the seller I was notified that they would be sent out.  Received both the next day.  I feel if you have a problem with your order the seller will take care of you. That means a lot to me.

 All in all, very happy with the order and the PC.

I've read several negative reviews. These mostly had to do with not working out of the box or no HDMI etc. Everyone must be aware that these machines are sold by different computer refurbishers... you need to check them out. I bought from StallionTek back in Jan `19  and have had no problems. Worked well out of the box and had HDMI, SSD, i7 CPU etc.  I see a number are sold by other hardware refurbishes. Do your homework and read the fine print and check out the reviews of the companies themselves. StallionTek had 96% positive reviews. I have not seen any recent reviews so perhaps they are no longer selling on Amazon... not sure. I see some, like the current seller, has a rating of 65% positive. That should tell you a lot.

This computer came very well packaged in one of those dedicated computer air cell packs that looks like a heavy duty pool flotation device folded over and heat sealed. The computer case had some minimal signs of prior use but nothing that would constitute what I would call "wear". Similarly inside the case was pretty clean although I could still see some dust and dirt buildup if I looked closely and shined a flashlight into the dark corners. It came with everything described in the listing, had open slots in the bus for a half height graphics card. No open memory slots so if you want to go up there you need to buy bigger sticks to replace the ones in there already.  The i7 processor is an older model that is capable but not very fast, not really anywhere near gaming capable as it sits.  I had to put in a graphics card in order to get a DVI output for our 27" touch screen my son needs for his home schooling programs.  It is fast enough to stream the lectures he has to watch as well as handle the two-way meetings he uses for some of the classes, when I added a HD camera to the mix.  Plenty of USB plugs, some 2.0 and others 3.0 (I have not bothered to try to define which is which as we are not doing anything heavy enough to stress those systems.  It booted up fine and needed minimal oversight for setting stuff up.  We have had no problems in the first 3 months since we got it.
Although it was not purchased for my boy to do gaming, he did try and discovered a significantly faster frame rate but still not good enough transfer rate to run modern graphics intensive games at a speed that satisfies him, so he is back over on his other gaming consoles for that.
The operating system is set up on the solid state drive so it boots up in about half the time of one booting from a hard drive.  And having the big HDD for long term storage is a perfect match.
I am not sure if I would buy it again or not -- I would probably keep my eye out for a similar package but with a more recent and capable generation i7 processor and matching motherboard.  The small form-size is also a bit of a challenge if you plan on dropping a few cards into the bottom end of the bus as you have to make sure they are low profile and half height as there is some room but not a lot of room on the bus.

After reading the reviews and determining that I would either be fine, or not at all... I decided to take the 50/50 chance of receiving a decent tower.

Ordered from Stalliontek along with a 1030 low profile GPU from NewEgg with hopes of using this as my 4K capable living room media PC.
I first decided to plug it to a known, working monitor I pulled from my gaming PC set-up.  There was NO HDMI port as advertised, nor any HDMI adapter included.  Ok.. I read reviews of this happening but no worries as my monitor ALSO takes display port (which the tower had two of) and I was going to use the 1030 GPU's HDMI port when I eventually connected this to my living room TV anyway.

While hooking everything up, I smelled the familiar smell of fresh spray paint.  Upon further investigation, I saw fresh black spots on the case where someone spray painted it black.  Ok, no biggy.... as long as the tower works I'm ok with the touched up blemishes.

Whelp, after plugging everything in and using the display port from the MOBO to my known working monitor, there was no signal.  The PC turned on, but no boot, no bios splash screen nothing.  I started, restarted... plugged, unplugged... I tried it all.
Figured, well... maybe it's the display ports that are bad on the MOBO (I tried both of them).  Plugged in my brand spanking new 1030 GPU and used its HDMI port.
No luck with that as well. Still no boot, BIOS splash screen.. nadda

On top of the MAJOR problem of not booting, there was no HDMI adapter, the case was spray painted AND I was unable to find/locate the windows serial number that a few reviews said was attached to the tower.  Upon inspecting the entirety of the case, I also found a poorly removed/scraped previous OS and windows key label.

I build gaming PC's, but I took a chance on this one because I received $200 in Amazon gift cards recently which made this a decent buy for me for $199 out of pocket.
I will also add that I checked for any loose connections, memory etc that may have come loose in shipping, but came up empty handed.
This PC was just DOA.  Also worth noting to those interested, there is no additional room on the MOBO for another SATA connection.  There are 3 total... one for Disc reader, one for SSD boot drive and one for HDD storage drive.

Kudos to the seller for making the return easy at least. So thanks!

I received computer carefully packaged in bubble wrap. Unwrapped to find computer in great physical condition, few minor dents.
I opened case to add nvidia video card and found interior clean no dust bunnies, looked new.
I connected it up and checked BIOS version, it was 8 years old. No problem, went to HP website found the most current and downloaded and updated.
I found the OS was Win 10 educator pro, OK..? No problem, I blow away pre-installed OS's anyway. I reloaded Win 10 pro w/current ver 21H2.
I also noticed no COA attached to the computer but computer has digital license so no big deal.

The supplied USB key bluetooth/wi-fi adapter works great. Windows found and installed it immediately. I paired my headphones to it for a quick test, works fine.
I am using the keyboard & mouse supplied w/computer. I love the actuation force for the keys a little stiffer than other keyboards. I'm not impressed w/the mouse.

Computer used for replacement in den. Old Dell is acting up so I just replaced it, hardware problem maybe.

Computer arrived in doublelayer cardboard box, no shipping damage.
In the box:
- computer
- power cord
- keyboard/mouse set
- usb WiFi/bluetooth
- adapter, male display port to female HDMI

Overall impression good. Love the quicker processor! I would buy another.

This is easily the best technology purchase I have made in years.

I bought it to replace my ACER laptop which I bought six years ago. This laptop still works fine but I could see that it was struggling to handle multiple open browser windows.  I often have 12+ windows open across three browsers each.  My Acer is a core i5 4300m, 6GB RAM machine - which was admittedly fast in 2012.

Fast forward to this HP desktop. It's super-fast with its 240GB SSD which I think makes all the difference.  The set up with Win 10 Pro was so easy.  The machine is not pre-configured to your product key but instead to some generic key. When you unpack the box, the product key is clearly visible stuck on the back of the machine.  Just write it down and save it somewhere safe. When Win 10 comes up, try and customize it - like the screen or mouse.  It then prompts you for the product key.  And you're done.

When you set up your browsers, choose the option where they remember all your open windows.  The magic is when you restart the machine and click on your favorite browser.  All those browser windows display instantly, yes, instantly.  Opening a document or saving it is also instant.  The SSD is one of the best technology inventions ever.
