Good delivery speed. But the quality is no good.
Theres no display after setup. Only HDMI workable.

I ordered this item on Oct 30, 2018, when it was advertised as "2018 Dell Inspiron 13 5000 2-in-1 13.3 inch Full HD Touchscreen Backlit Keyboard Laptop PC, Intel Core i7-8550U Quad-Core, 8GB DDR4, 256GB SSD, 2 USB"

On registering this device on Dell's website, it became obvious that an older 2017 laptop with 'almost' expired warranty was fraudulently passed off as  a newer 2018 model!!
I love this laptop! I imported it all the way to south africa, and I couldn't be happier. The seller even included the dell active pen :D

This product was a waste of my money. The charger is so bad. It hasn't been working well and i had to borrow my brother's. The screen also freezes time to time. Now i have to buy a new charger and at some point a new laptop. I had this for less than two years. I'm really disappointed with this.
Got this for my wife and she loves it.  The computer talks to you and does what you want it to do.  Need to train it to walk the dogs!
So far so good!  Almost returned though because of the "adaptive" charging not allowing it to charge past 55%.  Had no idea that this was something that machines do nowadays!
The only thing I dislike about this product is the computer bottom gets very hot in the middle when used.
So far I love it!! Can hook my wireless mouse up or use the pad or touch screen! Dont really care for the bulky charging cord but other than that havent found anything... adjusting using windows 10

Looks pretty, works awfully. Most problems are with keyboard and touchscreen. If I lived in the US, I would undoubtedly send it back to the seller. Bad choice, I`m really disappointed with this purchase. Atfer all the updates had been installed, virtual keyboad stopped functioning too.  Now it is impossible to enable it absolutely. It`s my first and the last dell product. Many "thanks" to both dell and this seller for the troubles I haven`t expected. In comparison with Lenovo Yoga 910 I bought a month earlier, this item is rather f piece of shit than a nootebook.

Brought this laptop month back.
Fully satisfied
Excelent product.

Received this ~4 weeks ago. I added a new partition to the SSD and installed Arch Linux on that partition. I'm able to boot into either OS without trouble.

The touchscreen is responsive but not impressive. The construction seems good.
I like it, but I have to return it because it is getting too hot in the bottom. I did not see other users talk about this problem in their reviews.

I bought this in fall 2018. By January 2019 the fan was extremely loud. Contacted Dell and sent the computer in to have the fan replaced. After my origial laptop was lost in shipping, I was sent a replacement. One year later the fan is back to making the same exact noise as before (and now past the warranty). I would recommend a different laptop.
General recordkeeping and videos

Everything was great....until a dell update crashed my Inspiron 13 less than 4 months in. The touchpad wasnt perfect, and the battery didnt last very long, but I had absolutely no problems and would have given it 4-5 stars, until the damn automatic dell update. Now I log in and the restart screen pops up freezing everything until it restarts and repeats the process, over and over... After reading the reviews, most seem to be within a few months of purchasing. Are these things just built to not last? Not sure if its an isolated problem or Dell, but its unacceptable regardless. Be cautious before purchasing as its going to be a pain trying to get repaired/replaced

Purchased in August 2018.  In the last two months, the keyboard malfunctioned (various keys simply do not work), the laptop simply shut down and would not restart, and now again various keys are not working.  Dell has "fixed" each problem without cost to me, but it takes about 10 days to two weeks between malfunction, call customer service, receiving a shipping box from Dell, and then waiting for its return from the regional service center.  When it is not broken, it is fast, screen is bright and does what I need.  But 30 plus days out for repairs in 9 months is unacceptable.  Will not purchase a Dell again
Use as both laptop and tablet. Very versatile.
So far absolutely no issues, works great, fast, and I like the keyboard backlight.  I am a realtor so on it continuously,  battery life holds well.  Set up was a breeze, very happy with this purchase
Good running product however had dead pixles on the screen when using the stylus would not pick it up sent back to try another one hope it's just a one time incident. Other than that loved it.
Nice laptop but it says in several places that it has 12 GB RAM while it only comes with 8.

best computer i have ever bought personally.  fast, been using on and off for two days on same battery.  came with pen, idk who i bought from but if it says windows ten home you wont have office on it.  still a good buy.  i recommend thus far.
So far I have only used it as a laptop.  Hope it is as good as a tablet.

In terms of performance, pretty good. Quick and great touchscreen.

But it is LOUD. The fan runs near constant and after just a couple days I now have a loud, high pitched squealing.

Great performance. Poor construction.

Love this laptop. It is fast, easy to use, has touchscreen capability, and can fold into a tent or tablet. It's reasonably priced new and is certainly quite durable. The screen reaches fairly close to the edges and is a great viewing size. It feels well made and durable.
I bought it for my office work. I am satisfied with the performance but feels it should be better if it had more memory space.

Laptop is very good but the noisy fan is soooooooooooo irritating.  I am going t take it in to have it checked out. And now 4 months later this laptop has crashed!!!! Seriously! Now I am looking for dell support because I cannot return it!!! Smh...

Since my purchase my laptop has seen and been through a lot, can handle daily use, travel, hours of work and/or play. I love my laptop. The only thumbs down is it's battery life. Depends on how often you utilize it, you'd be looking at buying a new battery replacement within a years time.

Had planned to go back to HP since my first Dell Inspiron didn't last 2 weeks before the screen cracked from a very minor drop and continued to get worse so no touch screen. However, I just could not find an HP that had all the features I wanted and could afford: Touch Screen, Backlit keyboard, 360 2-in-1, CoreI7, black keyboard with gray trim - I love it!
Everything run normally except the fan noise a little bigger than my expectation. Can I adjust the CPU Frequency from 1.8G to a higher frequency?
This dell 2 in one is different then the old designs. Material is Plastic. Old design material was metal made.

love it, just what i needed. I've had it for a month now and had no issues with it, the size is perfect not too big not too small and is very light easy to carry around, the screen flips which is awesome for watching movies on bed, it came with a pen but i don't use it

I have been using Dell for 9+ Years and i have changed almost 4 models till now but this model Inspiron 5379 is really giving my nightmare. I have contacted customer care 4 times(every time there's new operator and you have explained everything from beginning) for support and even sent to texas for repair still same problem is repeating. I asked Dell for a refund so that I could upgrade my model but no commitment on that. Laptop have an amazing configuration in cheap price but it's not worth risk buying it with such annoying noise. I thought it's only me but there are lot's of people facing fan issues with this model. Anybody who's considering buying this please think over before you purchase it, better spend a few bucks and get a good one instead of buying this one. I am really unhappy with dell support on this matter and dealing with the issue.

The computer I purchased is supposed to come with windows 10.  Once you start the computer up, it requires the windows product key to activate it.  I was not provided a product key to enter.  I called Beach Camera customer support and told the rep my problem, and she recommended I call Amazon.  Then she told me nevermind, call the manufacturer.  This is not the customer support I felt I should get.  There is no reason purchasing from a third party if they cannot facilitate successful installation and startup of the product they sell.  I won't buy from Beach Camera again.

Don't listen to the one star reviews. This is a great laptop for serious workloads. If you are getting this as a gaming laptop, just buy a gaming laptop or a gaming PC. It drives me crazy how many people just don't know how to take care of a computer and then give it a 1 star rating when they break it. A computer is only as useless as its user.

The computer gets very hot. power just go  off sometimes, while fully charged. The eye scanner identification tried many times before it works. Maybe my computer is defective. Just purchased 1-2 weeks brand new.  Like the touch screen. Size is good, I like the computer, if it will just work well??. Am first time am writing a review lol.
Got this Dell laptop 4 months ago, to date, performed nicely and speedy. The only drawback is the casing feels a bit flimsy. Great great product for the price.

Excellent dimensions, quick response, great touchscreen, my opinion is generally positive.
Very happy with that purchase.

The only issue is that the laptop is overheating, but only sometimes. Sure, that is not a reason to avoid buying this laptop. Having a cool temperature in the room should fix that problem, or even buy a stand or a cooler. When you take care of your things they last more.

Recommended!

Battery life deteriorated quickly and wifi stopped working completely which turned out to be internal hardware issue. Factory warranty ended within a few months of purchase as the laptop shipped to me was at the tale end of this warranty. A friend if mine works for Dell's supply chain supervision and he said Dell's parts are becoming worse and worse as the company looks for cheaper parts to have their products compete with it's Chinese competitors. Essentially a race to the bottom in quality and the people working for Dell know this. It was a great laptop when it worked. However the quality of it working lasted just months not even a year.
The most speedy delivery ever. I was not expecting pen, thanks to the vender. I appreciate. I was using Dell xps before. I almost fell in live with this one in 2 days. Really worth in this budget.

I have not had this computer very long and have not had time to really take it through it's paces thoroughly. But that being said, it definitely does the things I need from a small laptop, and I would recommend it.

Like another user mentioned, my laptop had bad issues with overheating - like it burned my legs if I had it on my lap. I returned it and ordered another, assuming I had received a bad egg, and while it still gets hot (especially when using in tablet mode due to where the air vents are located) it's tolerable. It's key to just be aware of where the vents are while using it and not sitting with it in tablet mode for too long.

This is one of the best laptops I've owned in every regard except for the battery life. My old laptop (an Acer) lasted days while this laptop lasts for hours. Also I'm still getting used to not having the number pad on the side, but that's a non-issue

This laptop is just fine till you figure out that it Doesnt charge !!! There is obviously something wrong with the charger that came with the computer. Now every-time I plug in the computer it says: AC adaptor is unrecognized. It might not charge the computer and it will run slower. I plugged it in over night just to wake up and find battery didnt charge. Now, I cant use this laptop unless its plugged in and it runs slow !!! It makes me wonder whether the charger that came with the computer was ever an orginial one in the first place!!! For the first month it worked just fine although I had the same message popping every time I charge it. Now, after several months it wont charge any more !! I need a solution for this, I shouldnt be paying to get another charger because there was some problem with the original one.

I am going to be frank. I read the reviews and decided to take my chances as there seemed to be more positive than negative reviews. That was my mistake.

Over the last few days I had been having some issues with my laptop because it did not seem to be charging. At first I attributed this to the charger and ordered another one. Well, when it got here and there was no sign of the laptop charging I knew that this was something else. I tried the old charger in a last ditch effort and the light from the charger would be green right up until I plugged it into the laptop then it would turn off.

I called Amazon and they directed me to Dell support where I was told that it was something in the hardware and that these things happen and not to worry.

Well I am very f-n worried because I had a ton of assignments for school on there that I can't access because the laptop that I paid good money for turned out to have shoddy craftsmanship. I now have to wait 10-12 days for repairs. I have had this laptop for less than 3 months. In what world do things require repair when you've just bought them?!

Do yourself a favor and look somewhere else if you want a laptop that will last. If you'll excuse me I'll be trying to redo my assignments from scratch for the next several days ??

The machine arrived as scheduled and was correct in the box, but the laptop was not without it's problems.  Upon setup the fans were loud and the machine became very hot.  The active pen that came with it worked the night of setup but not the next day.  After 1.5 hours on chat with Dell support they were able to install different drivers and troubleshoot the fan and the heat.  Now it runs quite and cool.  They could not fix the pen and promptly shipped a new one for exchange.  I'm very happy with it so far and would recommend it.  Just be prepared to contact support.

I'm a mac user ,well was until I got asked by my teacher to change because of certain differences that office has in mac. I honestly thought I wasn't gonna like dell that much. But it did surprise me. I have only used it for some days, buts it's been great. the size, the efficiency, the software is awesome. I love the simple that is to do some things compared to mac. It does get a little hot, but just if your using at the most, it doesnt affect me atleast, in my day to day internet searching and netflix. Something im adjusting to is the touchscreen, maybe is my first impression, but i find difficult to use the computer using my fingers, it only works well with the pen that includes the computer, but in general good.

My first Windows 10 computer, and my first flipbook after using a MacBook and then a Chromebook. Overall, a solid computer. But the touchpad is not sensitive enough. Clicks don't get registered the first time. Moving the mouse just a little with touchpad doesn't work, usually. I had to turn off pinch to zoom because it was always activating when I didn't mean for it to. Same with right-click in the lower right corner. And still I have problems, even after those changes to settings.

Use of some websites is frustrating because of this. And this after turning touchpad sensitivity up to high. On one job app website, I had to click everything two or three times to get it to work. Even typing this review was frustrating because the cursor would jump around.

Otherwise, a fine computer for the price. Far less frustrations in tablet mode. Maybe a firmware or OS update will resolve this issue. Or maybe someone in comments can fill me in on the right tweak to settings.

I have had this laptop for about 2 years now and I use it almost daily. This thing is fantastic. I have not had any issues with it besides that fact that it gets a bit hot. The vents in the back are not large enough to support the laptop cooling well on its own, but I just purchase a cooling pad and keep it on there and the temps run just fine. The newer version of this laptop accommodates for this issue and I know because I just purchased it for my partner and he's loving it. This is a really great series of laptop and I highly recommend it. It functions great and has features that we needed: backlit keyboard, touchscreen, 2-in-1 (can flip it flat), and then the hardware specs combine to make this one great purchase.

Face recognition isn't the best, and have had weird issues with internet connectivity. Anytime I turn this laptop on, the wifi completely cuts out, and this has never happened with any other device, with there being a total of 4 laptops and 1 PC in the house with other devices. Thought it was our router or provider, but beginning to think that this is an issue with the laptop drivers with the way it came. Good laptop, but the internet issue is a massive pain

Nice computer. easy to start up and load my programs.  Love the touch screen feature.  I add more memory so the computer runs super fast.  Ordered on Sunday and had it delivered to my house by Wednesday.  Easy to get up running especially for someone who is technically challenged.

I was a little apprehensive ordering this laptop due to the lack of enough reviews, and also from reviews from other tech sites. Some about the brightness of the screen, some about the quality of the RGB color gamut range, some about the "junk" included with the laptop.
I received the laptop fast with Amazon Prime, in very good packaging and good condition. Initial setting was a breeze, and immediately had a good feeling about the speed of the hardware/system. Once all windows updates were applied, I always go to control panel to remove all unwanted "junk". Surprised that there was not any at all. Pretty clean, and I did not have to remove anything. There was not MacAfee,  nor other annoying trial versions of any programs. Only some Windows apps, mostly games, that it was easy to remove from the store. That was very good, and went on installing my own programs such as Office 2016, ACDsee photo suit, etc. No problems. The screen quality is pretty good, I did not get this laptop for photo editing, I do that on my desktop. As far as the screen brightness is concerned, people seem to not take under consideration that a good part of it is tide to the power plan used by the user. That is very easily changed under the notification panel on the right of the taskbar, where the brightness of the screen can be control to taste. Then you can have a much brighter screen. I am not sure that it will be bright enough for "interrogations", however is bright enough for me.
Bottom line, I am very pleased with the laptop. It's portability is a fun aspect of its use. It is a good looking laptop, and yes, so far I love it.
I would recommend this laptop for general and comfortable use. Please remember, it is not an $1,800.00 machine, but it is perfect for what was meant to be used on this price range, and a joy to use.
Additionally, it is upgradeable, so one will not have to pay that $1,800.00 price for more memory and larger storage capacity.

This laptop is perfect in every way.

It's pretty compact and light - so it's perfect for bringing to work or classes. The laptop is well-made and can probably sustain some abuse.
The battery is outstanding. It easily gets 8 to 12 hours on a single charge. This is with normal usage (normal screen brightness, browsing/using Word with no volume).
The touch screen and touch pad both work great. I haven't had any issues with either of these.
Sound quality is very good. The display is beautiful.

This laptop also has quite a bit of horsepower. It can process quite a few programs at once, and it boots up quickly. I'm always too lazy to close unused programs, and this laptop has been pretty forgiving in that regard. Oddly, this laptop is also good at connecting to the internet. It's great at great strong signals.
The keyboard is great. Keys are well-placed and easy to press.

This laptop isn't the best for gaming. It can run games, but not nearly as well as something you'd get from a gaming laptop. I don't use it for gaming, so that's fine. If this laptop were $1500, I wouldn't question it. You're really getting a lot of bang for your buck here in terms of specs. And I haven't had any glitches or problems to speak of. Just get rid of the anti-virus program, it's annoying.

I bought this laptop after my previous unit crapped out on me. Considering the price tag, I expected it be pretty decent, however, I have had problems with this Dell literally from the beginning.

From the first time I booted up, I was presented with a screen stating "AC POWER ADAPTER WATTAGE AND TYPE CANNOT BE DETERMINED." Despite this, the laptop charged just fine, however, just two days later, the laptop will no longer charge, and when I hover over the battery icon, it says, "(plugged in, not charging)." When I check the BIOS at startup, it says AC Adapter type is "UNKNOWN." I am using the same 45W Dell AC adapter that came with the computer. The adapter appears to be in perfect condition, and the green LED light is on. I have tried plugging it in to different outlets in my home, and I receive the same result. I tried updating the BIOS. I used Dell's online diagnostic tool for hardware problems, as well as the diagnostic tool specifically for this AC charging problem, but no problems were detected.

I emailed Dell's Tech support, detailing all of the information above, and they clearly did not read my email, because they asked me to do all of the things I already mentioned. They then told me I could send it back for repairs that will take 10-12 days to complete.

What bothers me most about this, is that if you do a quick Google search regarding this AC adapter problem, you will immediately get results regarding Dell computers, so this is clearly a problem they are aware of. I did not spend $800 in order to receive a faulty product that the manufacturer is aware is faulty. I use this unit for schoolwork, and being without it for 12 days is an unreasonable expectation. At this point, I am debating whether I want to get it fixed or just send it back for a refund. I did not want a Dell to begin with, but this seemed like a good deal. I am now regretting that decision.

I was very excited to receive this 2 in 1 earlier this week! The quality and design or the machine seems sturdy and functional. Unfortunately the machine freezes regularly and i must constantly restart. Now the track pad doesn't work at all. I had worries when the computer arrived unprotected bouncing around a big box without any documentation and without a stylus. I suspect the seller sent a refurbished model.
   update 
I returned the first computer and bought the same model again from another seller. So glad I did!! Thankfully Amazon makes it so easy to return! The new one arrived with proper packaging, documentation and a stylus. The previous one was clearly used before. Th is one arrived with a clean install of Windows 10 and is working great. As mentioned in other reviews the bottom gets hot. I put something between the laptop and my lap so that's not too much of a concern. This is the perfect size to carry around is very sturdy. I am enjoying being able to easily switch to tablet mode.

Setup was easy and have been really enjoying the significant upgrade in speed compared to my old ASUS. Touchscreen has worked well and just used the pen to ink my signature on some online forms and it worked great. Don't know about long term durability but initial quality has been awesome.

I've only had this for a day so far, but it's amazing! Nice display, great speakers, supported by Waves Maxx audio. Also great performance, thanks to the 8gb ram and i7 processor. It will get hot, but it won't affect the computer's performance, just might cause you some discomfort. Everything is quite fast, especially the SSD. Moving over from a traditional hard drive, and it makes a HUGE difference in speed.
Very sluggish. It might be defective so I decided to return it without replacement. If I buy another tablet, I need to get a more expensive one.

Impossibly slow. Cant run a single default app like GMail without hanging for 10+ seconds at a time. Heaven forbid you reboot, because its unusable for 2+ minutes afterwards.

You get what you pay for.
It started off working ok and as the day went on it got slower and slower then it stayed freezing. NOT a good look I retired it 2 days later
I'm planing return right now tablet is terrible all around except battery duration

Bought it for my autistic daughter. Worked fine for a couple of days; and Ive tried everyday for the past few days, and it will Not take us to the apps weve stored, and now I cant even take them off for this return. Always live Amazon, but this was very disappointing ??
This thing isn't worth $5 I got it so I could connect a wifi app and have it run. That was the only thing I downloaded. It crashed more times then I could count. Not worth it
Very slow in operations.  Am returning it.

The tablet is not worth buying it freezes or the URL doesn't work or some system things don't work and nothing will download and nothing works on it it's the worst tablet I've ever owned that's why I'm returning it it been sent back by ups on July 18.
I got my item LIKE
Super super slow. Touch screen is not very sensitive. Have to keep pounding. Save your money.
I got this tablet for my son's birthday, and he wasn't playing with it, I got on it and when it does work it's very very slow, don't waste your money. If I could give zero Stars I would.

Its just garbage nothing else. Doesnt work at all, it takes 3-5 mins to loading app. After use while it get stopped by self ????
Do not recommend this product at all 24/7

This mini PC is just that "MINI" this PC is just over 5 inches square and 1.75 inches tall but don't let that bother you it preforms well as a desktop computer.  I have been using this PC during the past couple weeks for internet access, word processing, minor photo editing and low level game play.  The response time for these general tasks has been very good.  There have been no problems or errors, everything is running smoothly, and the noise level is almost non-existent limited to an occasional whirl of a small fan. I believe this computer will work well as a desktop computer but lacks sufficient graphics power to play any but the most basic 3d games,  and has insufficient CPU capacity to be used as a workstation for number crunching computer programs, but for an extremely small profile computer it works well.

VNOPN K5-F14H mini pc is quiet and very capable of performing day to day tasks nicely. It appears to be well constructed, tight seams and smooth surfaces with even paint job.

Theres a total of 8 USB-A ports, unfortunately not all are USB-3, only front 4 with single USB-C port along with 4 video outs which is a combination of 2 DP and 2 HDMI on back.

Case cover is constructed of plastic with honeycomb pattern, not a fan as it makes cleaning harder, along with fan intake on top and side vents. Intake opening are fairly large and no removable mesh filter helping to keep particles out.

Windows 11 setup did not go through normal out-of-box experience process, like selecting preferences or connecting to Wi-Fi network, it automatically sign in as administrator. Appreciate it did not come preinstalled with bloatware which is nice, unlike some other manufactures, just standard Microsoft junk.

Im able to run all my applications without issue and even able to play older game like Mass Effect Legendary Edition at higher resolution. Noticed fan continuously spins up and down even when not working on anything intensive, like web browsing.

Minor annoyance, not all USB-A ports being USB-3, theres no justification for having older USB-A ports.

Be mindful, device is stuck with loaded BIOS as vendor doesnt appear to have website for support.

Lightning speed fast! With the i7 quadcore and a minimum of 8g of ram, this laptop can do day to day tasks without breaking a sweat!  So far were loving it! And for the price - get it now before theyre gone!
Very user friendly.Easy to set up for you use.
Im using this for schooling, and it a great computer.
This laptop is used by one of my salesmen who was just not getting enough performance speed out of is 8GB laptop. He loves it.
mouse pad lags NOT VERY SENSITIVE, Battery Life is weak 40%
Overall a good product. No issues so far!
I only gave a 4 star because I thought I read that the key board was lite and its not.  Otherwise very happy with purchase!

I was so excited to see the box arrive!! Opened everything up, read the instructions, plugged it in and whole it was charging, I started to put all the boxes in the recycling bin. Get back to the laptop and start going thru the start up process and find out that the touchpad, touch screen and stylus don't work. SO DISAPPOINTED! Had to get the boxes out of the trash and box the unit up in order to return it.

This computer has suited all of my needs so far. I bought it because I am half way through my bachelor's degree and plan to go on to get my masters. I needed a computer that would hold up over the years with vigorous use! This laptop has an abundance of storage and holds its charge very well.
This laptop is great for our college student.  She is required to make videos for homework and it works perfect.

This doesn't come with much documentation, other than "turn it on and set up Windows 10", and it took me two days to get the touchscreen and the touch pad to work (become familiar with downloading and installing Synaptics drivers from the HP website).  Once I was able to get Windows to recognize the touch screen and pad, it runs pretty well and is a nice machine.  I was surprised to find that it came with a years subscription to Microsoft 365, so you get all the Office stuff right off the bat.
its definitely light weight & my games work on it great. definitely worth the money.

First computer was defective, touch pad and screen did not work. There was no cursor. I sent it back. The replacement laptop works perfectly. Great screen, keyboard and fast. I upped the ram to 32 gigs. This a great bang for the buck. Any comparable computer was several hundred dollars more expensive than this one. I hope it gives me several years of untroubled use.  I have only had laptop for a few days, time will tell.
It made a good gift for my teenage daughter. She draws all her artwork on the device. No more expensive portfolios.
Firstly, I don't want to spend a lot of money on it. This is exactly within my price range. It is good quality, hasmanyfunctions, great buy.
Item was delivered faster than normal.
Quick Delivery. Product works great
This was precisely what I was looking for, and it hasn't let me down so far. Rapid start-up is super simple to set up.
Great, I arrived earlier than the specified time, protected well, the packaging was not damaged, and the product quality is excellent. Recommended.
Excellent mid-range devices for entertainment and academic research.
Love this new look. Take it everywhere!!
I bought it for my son and he really likes it. It is very suitable for his school needs, and we have not encountered any problems. I will buy it again!
This is really well made and great quality.I rely on it daily for my college assignments, It works smoothly and reliably. I'm would definitely buy it again if i need other one.

I bought this for my office PC, very simple to set up( Installing drivers was smooth for me) and has quick, smooth 4k desktop performance as well. Its capacity definitely exceeds my expectations but the greatest part is its size, with all the cables you need (HDMI 2.0, USBs, type C ports) it offers me not only a good performance but also portable convenience that I could easily carry around with me while I was traveling or had to work overtime at home.
Flawless, runs fast and reliable. What a great little mini pc!
I couldn't make any of these NUCs boot.
This PC is capable of streaming from one HDMI port and video o the other. What I really like is streaming on one side and surfing and downloading on the other.
Fast Delivery, excellent packing. The NUC12 is an awesome machine and the seller did not load any bloatware. I highly recommend both the product and the seller.

I bought this NUC12 i7 (running Windows 11 Pro) to replace my aging NUC5 i7 (running Windows 10 Pro). The upgrades (2x HDMI, 2x TB/USB4, USB3.2 Gen2, WIFI6, Intel 12th Gen i7) are a big plus compared to the NUC5. A 3 year warranty comes with the computer. So far, no issues. The (standard) shipping time was amazingly (2 days) fast! The NUC12 will be my new main computer moving forward.

This is a very nice computer in a very small form factor. The i7 is very capable.  I am able to use two Monitors and I added some expansion ports for additional USB and other connections.  The 520 Gb drive may be adequate for some purposes, but larger drives are expensive when purchased from Intel with the Computer.

I added a 2 Tb Crucial SSD for additional storage.  Very compact and capable. The drives are encrypted which means that you must use a backup program that can backup an encrypted drive.

Ordered and had NUC within 2 days.  Exactly what I ordered fully loaded 16GB RD + 512GB SSD WIN11.
Had an issue with Windows 11 boot record and thought it was maybe the SSD failure - contacted support via email on the sticker on the NUC and within 4 hours got a response with 3 options including replacing the SSD.  Resolved in less than 24 hours and up and running.  I'd order and have ordered more - recommend vendor to source NUCs from.

The computer  arrived on time and was well packaged. I purchased it to replace a 12-year-old i7 tower desktop. I immediately began to test its functionality: I partitioned the internal SSD to create a small disk for onboard files. Next, Updated the OS with version 22h2 and the latest BIOS with ease. Then,  I installed basic applications from my old i7. I added a 500 gb hdd and backed up the system. Next, I created a recovery DVD on my Blu-ray and made sure the computer would start from the recovery disk. Using a docking station, I was able to access both 1080p monitors through each usb-c  port. Naturally the 2 HDMI worked well also. I was even able to boot the computer using a 16gb usb 3.0 attached to the docking station. The computer had no issues recognizing the 8 TB external hard drive, DVD drive or usb jump-drive. The internal fan is quiet and  keeps the computer mildly warm.
I have purchased 2 Gen-10 NUC's previously and they have been very reliable. I am looking forward to experiencing the advances this NUC 12 Pro provides.
See Photos, attached.

Built an Ethereum validator with this unit. Initial concern, worried the item Nuc,12 I7 barebones unit wouldnt come with power supply. Some sites sell without. I contacted the seller and got back to me asap! Assured me they only sell top notch no worries items, it came with the power supply.  Item was as described sealed new in package. Added  64g ram ,4tb sd running Ubuntu. This unit is rock solid no issues. Item came super fast shipping. Im very happy with my purchase and would recommend this unit and seller to anyone.

From the headline, you can see you bought a 12th Intel Core i7-1260P, 32GB of RAM, and a 1TB SSD.This computer has been great  for light gaming and web surfing, arrived quickly and worked straight out of the box!

Cathy in Geek+ tech support was excellent - answered some of my configuration questions immediately and provided some very helpful documentation.

I purchased this NUC12 Pro (32GB + 1TB) to use with a 50 inch Samsung 4K UHD TV.  I use this system to do CAD work (Fusion 360), circuit simulations, video editing and live OBS sessions with multiple cameras.  It works great.  I was previously using a Surface Studio, but it was having trouble keeping up with the video loads and did not play well with the monitor, though that could be the fault of the DisplayPort to HDMI adapter I was using.  The direct HDMI outputs of this NUC produce an excellent picture on the 4K monitor, even when viewing subtle shading changes that I could not easily see previously.

I received the NUC, plugged in a keyboard, mouse, network cable,  and the 4K monitor and fired it up.  After a few minutes of updating Windows 11 to the current release level I was able to load in my software and get going.  I have had no problems whatsoever in loading lots of software and data and running multiple compute-intensive programs simultaneously.

I purchased this little fast Nuc and I absolutely love it! Not only did I receive an amazing computer but I also received the most amazing customer service from Cathy, who made sure I knew exactly when my computer arrived, and was reminded the day it arrived, even though it was a Saturnday :)

A really cool thing about this NUC is that it is so small that I can fit it in my handbag when I travel to Denmark to visit my parents or go on a cabin trip with my kids so they can ski and I can work from "home". It's perfect for me and I  have had no problems whatsoever with this little cute computer (fist time I have considered a computer to be cute Lol).

Thank you Cathy! I will most definitely shop with you again! :)

Doesnt do anything.  Power button does nothing.  There are no instructions, at all.  I am not even sure if there is a power lite or anything to confirm it has power.  Amazon "product support" is useless.  After about 5 minutes on hold, they offered to dial intel for me.  I TRIED ANOTHER POWER ADAPTER, BUT STILL NOTHING.  I HAVE SEND BACK VIA UPS, AND NOW I HAVE ~$700 "IN THE WIND" FOR A MONTH OR TWO; UNTIL AMAZON ACTUALLY REFUNDS ME. Runs fast, I am using this for video conferencing and it is a wonderful machine!!

I initially had some issues with a hardwired LAN connection not working but it magically seemed to resolve itself within the first week and never had an issue since. I'm running Linux on this machine and it's been great. I'm not overloading the machine and it works well without a fan.

The product is actually very good and mini PC is amazingly powerful. The compact size is making it even more attractive

I've been using this as my primary desktop computer for a little over six years.  I probably use is it for 20 hours/week or more.  It won't play modern games but it plays Starcraft like there's no tomorrow.

The purpose of this review is to point out that durability.  It stopped turning on about a week ago.  I replaced the CMOS battery, and I'm back online.  You can't ask for better than that.  (The unit wouldn't boot, no POST, nothing, until the battery was replaced.)  I'm not usually that big a fan of Intel branded products, but this one has just been outstanding.
Excellent machine, good permanence and small size.

This has been an excellent unit and very cost effective.  We are starting to move in this direction any time we need to replace a machine.  We mount it to the back of the monitor to clear up desk space.  This is perfect for help desk, sales, and accounting type departments.

This replaced a desktop. What a great choice! Only problem I had was with attached USB hubs. Attached USB hubs will occasionally keep the device from booting. Once disconnected - all is OK. I just reconnect after bootup. Still worth 5 stars.

I am building this a local VFW.  They will not be stressing the CPU, so I went with the i3.  So far the operating system(Win10) has loaded flawlessly.  I had to update the Video, USB and network drivers from the Windows default.  Overall I would purchase this again.

Works Ok. I found that you cannot successfully install Windows Server 2016 without workarounds for the networking, which isn't cool, but I did get around it. In there defence, Then do not state support for Windows 10/Server 2016. That really is a shame.

Intel's AMT was confusing to set up at first due to a lack of clear instructions anywhere.

Bought what I thought was the correct wifi module but turned out not to be compatible.

Performed well, VESA mount was effective. Easy to assemble.

Compact and Speedy.  With 16GB RAM and 240GB SSD, this is a perfect knowledge worker machine.  For a power user the lower core count and clock speed might not be ideal, but for a VSA mountable task PC, it is hard to beat. This model has vPro, so AMT allows full remote manageability and remote KVM!  Had to go this Gen 5 version as the Gen6 does not have a vPro enabled ("M") version yet AFAIK.  Hightly recommended.

This is the 4rd NUC model I have purchased for the university I work at (the other models being the NUC5i3RYH, NUC5i5RYH, and NUC6i5SYH) and it has been a charm to work with. I ordered 14 these to update a teaching lab. I chose this model mainly due to cost but also because of availability. I would have rather purchased a model with a full-sized HDMI port on the back but I wanted at least a NUC5i3 model, and the NUC6i3 models are too expensive and seem to be having some reliability issues.

Each of the 14 I ordered was equipped with 8GB of Crucial DDR3L memory and a Samsung EVO 2.5in ssd (the M.2 version simply cost too much), and then attached to the rear of a 24in monitor. The end result is a very nice package that I am hopeful will last 5-7 years.

One wish: That I could have found a 6-12in length HDMI-to-miniDP cable. The shortest I could find was 3ft and that simply clutters up the back of the monitor/NUC combo.

I'm very happy with the performance of this PC. Granted I don't play games, but it handles all the graphic design multitasking I do like a champ. I run dual monitors at 1920 x 1200 without any issue. It is configured with a Samsung 850 EVO 250GB Sata III SSD and 2 x 8GB Crucial Balistic Sport DDR3 RAM. You will need 2 micro DP to DP to hook up the monitors and also this is something to note, you will need a USB 2.0 extender if you plan on using a bluetooth mouse directly into the PC. I contacted Intel on this one, for some reason the USB 3.0 ports are not shielded and create interference with bluetooth dongle. The extender just places the dongle at a distance far enough away so that the EMF of the port doesn't interfere. Another way around this is to connect the dongle into your monitor and run a USB out from the monitor into the PC.

Nice little device that cleanly replaces a traditional bulky and noisy mini-tower computer. I chose this particular NUC5I5MYHE model specifically because of the dual Mini Display Ports as all my computers have a dual 19" 4:3 monitor configuration.

In addition to the base NUC unit, I purchased the Crucial 8Gb RAM kit (4GBx2 DDR3 1600 MT/s PC3 - 12800 CL11 SODIMM CT2KIT51264BF160B), a Samsung SSD (Samsung 850 EVO 250 GB M.2 MZ-N5E250BW) and Bluetooth/WiFi combo module (Intel 7265). Installation of these components wasn't difficult, especially if you have smaller hands. The one problem I ran into was that the units antenna wires that connect to the BT/WiFI 7265 module kept popping off due to their rigidity and routing within the enclosure.

All said and done, the hardware (NUC+RAM+SSD+BT-WiFi module) cost $584 dollars (plus OS software of your choice) -- that isn't any less costly than a traditional desktop (mini tower) computer, so you should only consider the NUC if you're looking for small form factor and quiet operation.

I chose to install Windows 7 64-bit. On the OS/software side, the only problem I encountered was that the Bluetooth driver and software stack wouldn't work properly with my Apple bluetooth keyboard and/or Microsoft bluetooth mouse -- not until I upgraded the BIOS. On a side note, finding the proper drivers and BIOS file are a bit of a pain with Intel's site -- Intel could really benefit by learning from other tech giants when it comes to implementing a simplified "enter your device's model number or serial number and here are all the drivers and files you need" approach.

On the plus side, the unit runs cool, quiet and the Intel i5 is fast enough for the non-gamer applications I use on a daily basis.

I do have a few criticisms of the hardware design:

The first and biggest concern of the device's design is that there aren't enough USB ports. There are only two on the back and two on the front. I'd like to see at least four on the back for keyboard, mouse, scanner and cable to feed my monitor's integrated USB hub. The two ports on the front would then be sufficient for the occasional use of my external DVD and memory card reader.

Speaking of memory card reader, I've seen others post that it would be real nice to have a SD card slot integrated into the unit. I see this as a really nice to have, but not a need to have. For the $1.50 it would cost in parts, it would be nice to see it built in to future NUC units.

Also, why Intel located the audio output jack on the front of the unit doesn't make a lot of sense to me. Why isn't this on the back like a normal computer so that I can route and hide all my cables?

Lastly, the design of the power supply leaves a bit to be desired. The connector to the NUC is not locking, and for reason's unknown, the barrel connector is a right angle which doesn't make a lot of sense given that all other cables (USB, Enternet, display ports) exit straight out the back. More importantly, the 'brick' plugs directly to your outlet, rather than with a lead cable -- for me this was also a problem as my power strip will no longer fit under my desk with the NUC's power brick attached.

All-in-all, I'd buy one again and would recommend these to peers -- but I'd make sure the limitations outlined above wouldn't be a problem first.

A bunch of functionality of this device doesn't work properly (UEFI firmware compatibility with supposedly compatible Windows OSes, TPM 2.0 support/integration, etc...) doesn't function properly and Intel hasn't addressed it during the time the product has been on the market.  Intel's support continues to be the slow "we'll-get-back-to-you-in-a-few-days" nightmare that has sent my unit out of Amazon's return policy and into the land of being a desk decoration.  I've spent far more time working with various support experts trying to get this thing to work to the point where ten of these wouldn't be worth the time I've spent on it.  Good luck, buyers.

I've had this about two months, and liked it so much I bought a second one. I put 16GB of stock Crucial RAM, a HyperX Savage 240GB SSD, and an Intel 7260N wireless NIC into it.  The only problem I had was finding the antenna wires for the wireless NIC, but they were there.  The unit is nearly silent.  It's quick enough for all day to day desktop functionality but it's clearly not a gaming machine (although it runs older games without a hitch).  The video is faultless under normal load.  I used Rufus to build a Win7 install USB stick, and installation of Win7 took a few minutes and was problem-free.  I downloaded the current drivers from Intel's site and had no problems with any of them.
This has become my day-to-day default machine, and sits on top of the 6700K/32GB machine I had been using daily.

Pricey, but performs *very* well, and can handle 16GB of RAM and an SSD.  Mine's hooked up to a 4K TV and a pair of 24" 1920x1200 monitors (with VGA to USB3 adapters) and I use it to remote into other systems.  Quiet, takes up no room, and doesn't generate any appreciable amount of heat, which helps in a small office that gets hot in the summer.

These little machines are amazing. I've purchased two dozen of various NUC models over the last 6 months because they are small, light, easy to pick up and move to a different desk if needed, and most of all they are incredibly powerful!

This particular model is a 5th generation i3 processor by Intel. I have 16GB of DDR3 RAM and a Samsung EVO 850 250GB M.2 SSD with it. I can't believe how fast this thing performs. I use it with PhotoShop, ConnectWise (line of business application), MS Office 2016, Windows 10, and Chrome browser. I will quite often have all of these apps up and running simultaneously with 15+ tabs open in Chrome. It never misses a beat.

If you want a tiny desktop computer, build yourself a NUC.

Surprisingly when I opened up the bottom cover my NUC had been fitted with 16GB of RAM and a 512GB M.2 SATA hard drive. I purchased the NUC 5 Pro series as a bare bones PC. Normally this means I would need to add Storage and memory (RAM). The options for storage M.2 SATA (B key) socket and a standard SATA socket and space for 2.5" SSD.  I messaged the company because I felt it was the right thing to do and offered to exchange it for what I had payed for. They emailed me back and thanked me for letting them know but told me I could keep it. So I purchased a used barebones NUC 5 Pro for $175 and ended up getting a well built complete system. The new price without the RAM and storage is $499. You add in the price of buying the RAM and memory which that's another $130. So yes I am very happy.  The product it's self  didn't look used it came with the peel off plastic protection on top and the front buttons. There where no scratches or marks of any kind and the it operates well. The only thing I would like to see included is a mini DisplayPort cable or adapter. That is the only outputs. I ended up purchasing  a mini DisplayPort to HDMI adapter from the local Best Buy  for about $9 just so I could get it up and running and test it. Otherwise I have no complaints. Of course I thrilled that I got more than I ordered but the product itself is like new and does what it's supposed to do. It cam with the power cord and metal mounting bracket, as well as all the original paperwork that would come in a new boxed item. Then when I contacted the sellers they were quick to respond and seemed very kind. What more could someone ask for. I would have written the same kind of review if I had gotten just the product as I had ordered it because of it's quality.

I have looked up several YouTube videos on how to turn them on, and wondered if it might have been, just a wiring error and to my disappoint no.. Minor not major overall I am happy with the pc.

I'm a retired computer engineer, but it doesn't take one to see their design is flawed and their science is wrong. Look at the photo I posted of theirs. The back fan is the only one I can tell is correctly setup.
1) your front 3 case find should ALWAYS be setup facing inward. Meaning they are all blowing fresh cool air into your case and over your motherboard and components.

2) if you can, ALWAYS, mount your AIO liquid cooler radiator on the top of your case. (And here is where they messed up, they aren't creating a negative or positive pressure system, air will just find its way out of any tiny openeings) the way this is set up you will need your fans running at 100% just to fight against each other.
After mounting your radiator to the ceiling you then mount your 3 fans for a 360mm so that the fans are blowing air through the radiator and out the top.
3) Doing it this way cool air will.be brought into your case from the front 3 fans,, as the air passed over your motherboard and videocard its going to begin to warm up as it cools down your components. What does warm air do naturally? Warn air rises. Which is why you have your radiator fans set to pull that warm air up and through the radiator cooling the radiator down and then it's really gonna be warm air. Do you want that hot air being sucked into your case and blown over your motherboard? NO, that one exhaust fan in the back will have to work on 100% just like all the others as the fans fight each other against air pressure and gravity.

It's very simple when building a PC. Hot air always rises. Your radiator is going to get warm but not scalding hot. But you don't want any of the hot air from your radiator going back into your case, do you? I'd you do just get rid of the water cooler and put a fan on your cpu and let it blow hot air all over everything.
The warm air coming off the radiator will rise out the tip of your case on its own. That's why you attatch 3 fans to the bottom of it and have the fans blowing air UP not DOWN like these people have it doing.

The 3 fans will pull any air in your case that's warm and push it through your radiator and out the top of your case. The rear case fan is to help blow any left over warm air out of the case as well and to help pull the air blown in from your front fans right towards rhe radiator fans as it warms up when it cools your ram etc. Whatever warm air doesn't get blown out the top of your case will exhaust out the rear of your case.
That's how you set up proper cooling for your gaming pc.

Overall, Im fairly happy with this build. Got it on sale during cyber money for $1500, which is a great deal for the components provided. For the normal price of $1900, I would consider it a little over priced. But, my biggest issue (and why I cant rate it higher), is the fact that you cannot change or customer the RGB! It sounds minor, but when its filling your office with light, being able to dim or edit the color pattern to irritate your eyes a little less would be nice.

Just bought this.  Seems like a nice box.

Two issues:
First, it would have been nice to place stickers over legacy ports (Video) which don't work.  It's fine they don't work (use the graphics cards ports instead) but setup would have been easier without having to go through all the docs.

Second, their web site has no downloads available for this model.  Just a spec sheet.  Had to contact support to get a link for the correct version of Firestorm (Graphics card configuration/monitoring software) and then I had to grab an MSI app from Windows Store for LED control.  Would have been better to have all this info in one place.

Ive had this computer for about 2 months. So far, I havent run into a single issue.

Gets 150+ frames at 1080 on pretty much any game. I mostly game at 1080 & 1440 and have been seriously impressed with the performance.

Excellent. The MEK Hero G1 A5837 met or exceeded my expectations. First it was well packed, with a large foam insert protecting the graphics card so it didn't get banged around during shipping. It started right up. Windows said it wasn't activated and it wasn't obvious how to do that, so a quick email to support resulted in a fast reply giving me the command to find the Windows product key which worked with activation.

The keys to a gaming machine are making sure it doesn't overheat but that cooling it doesn't generate a ton of fan noise. The Mek has eight fans in it - three at the front, one at the back, as well as two on the graphics card and two on the CPU liquid cooler. I've monitored temperatures during gameplay and GPU and all CPU cores run cool, maxing out at no more than 70C. The fans are relatively quiet and not noticeable above the usual volume of gameplay. So excellent cooling with low noise.

For expansion there are two open DIMM slots and two open PCIE slots, although one of them would put a PCIE card very close to the graphics card fan so it may not be the best choice.

The only minor con I've noticed is although there are a ton of USB ports, there is no USB C. This is a nit because USB A to C cables are readily available. Also it would be possible to add a cheap PCIE USB C card if necessary.

In summary I'm delighted with the Mek, and my one minor interaction with their support team was positive.

So far so good with this machine. I've been running it for several weeks now. Its very quiet, and doesn't run hot. The case was in good shape. The VGA connector on the back was bent, but I don't use that anyway. The included Bluetooth fab and WiFi fab, both worked as soon as I plugged them in - as they are not on the mb. I added a 4 port network card after buying this box and it didn't work as expected in the PCIe 1x (small)slot. When I uninstalled it, and plugged it into the PCIe x16 slot, it worked right away. There are no more slots available however - those two were the only ones on the mb and I'm not sure the small one even works. Thus 4 stars.
the dell optiplex 5050 is a fast compact pc with windows 10
