This laptop was purchased to be a general purpose laptop for work and entertainment.  The 5600U and 16GB dual channel RAM handles older games well and newer games at low settings.  The aluminum frame gives it a nice, sturdy feel and the backlit keyboard is great for using at night.  14" is the perfect size to keep it relatively compact and light.  There are plenty of ports including 3 USB-A, a USB-C and a RJ-45 jack.  Mine was in like-new condition with no signs of wear.  Mine came with an HP 65 Watt power supply.

I upgraded mine to Windows 11 Pro and switched out the storage for a 2TB intel M.2 card.  I also run this laptop connected to a Dell docking station with dual monitors and it works perfectly.  This laptop is priced at less than half what a new Pavilion or Envy will cost.  For the features it includes, (ports, aluminum construction, fingerprint reader, upgradeability) it's the best bang/buck.

I really do like this laptop. It was a very good deal for the money. However, the first one came and did not work at all. It kept shutting off and we were unable to get on the Wi-Fi. There was no sound either. I highly doubt they checked anything other than just wiping it clean. I emailed the seller as I was instructed, that was about a week and a half ago and I still havent heard anything. About day three of no reply from the seller I contacted Amazon directly. Very nice young lady who issued a new laptop immediately I still dont understand why the seller never called me back or emailed me. I may or may not recommend.

Received this product today and cannot power it on.  According to the HP website, 9 or so white flashes when you try to power on indicate a broken power supply.  There is a reset for non-removeable battery type laptops from HP but that reset fails to work.  I tried to contact Amazon to just get a new power supply but there is no option since this "comes from a third party seller".  3 stars for not sending a fully working unit and not having any way other than going out and trying to buy another power supply to have a working system.

THE GOOD: This laptop is good at a great value. Battery life is great. Speed is nice haven't had it hang on me. It's lightweight and I am able to bring it with me to work anywhere.
THE BAD: The bottom left ctrl button on the keyboard was broken, every time I tried to copy and paste I would be left with v. I was confused thinking I kept missing the ctrl button. Contacted support and they offered to return the laptop, but since I already had all my security features and applications installed, and didn't want to bring it back to redo all of it.

I bought this laptop so I can demonstrate music software for the recent IMSTA Festa and AES shows in New York city. As opposed to bringing my desktop...lol.

This thing runs Windows 11 Pro and ran all of my music software with plugins smoothly. I even created a few beats with this machine. Great buy and another reason why I love HPs laptops.

The laptop comes (mine at least) with pre-installed Windows 10 21H2. This is an out of support version of Windows 10 and is out of service for a couple of months.
More than that, the OS comes with a dozen of HP drivers missing for critical devices like wifi card. This means that out of the box there will be no network/internet connection once the computer is turned on. Of course it still has a RJ45 port, but I am sure that 90% of people don't have wired network at home. So you will have to download the required driver from HP site to another computer, copy it to a flash drive and then install it from the flash drive on the laptop. You have no idea which exactly driver you will need because on HP site there is driver for Intel wifi card, for MediaTek card and for Qualcomm card. You will need to try all of them in order to find the correct one. Once installed successfully, you can finally connect the laptop to the internet and download all the missing drivers and Windows updates. Note that before updates for Windows are installed, the computer is vulnerable due to very old version used as mentioned above. Well, I installed Windows 11 and it, BTW, has built in driver for the wifi card used in this computer.

And now the real problem. The battery is really worn out. The spec suggests capacity of 45Wh, but the actual capacity is 36Wh. This means that the battery is 20% less than a new one. Dear seller, this is not what I call _fully functional, and in excellent condition_. This is not properly tested and definitely not in excellent condition. I personally would prefer a couple of scratches to a worn out battery.

The good: the laptop is lightweight, good size for a kid's school computer and the screen is acceptable.

Addition: despite the description, the laptop does not have fingerprint sensor. I see that this was already stated in other reviews, but the vendor did not even update the item description. [Palmface]

I was a little nervous buying refurbished, but the vendor had a good rating so I took a chance. So so so glad I did. It works perfectly, looked good cosmetically, and packs a lot of punch at a low price point.

Here was the only snaffu which I will solve for you here in case you get hit with it. First time setting up windows, it asks for your windows password - which is not your personal password. It will make you think its looking for an admin password and that you have to contact the refurbisher - but you dont. There is no password. Leave it blank and hit enter as though youve put in a password.

Amazon refurbished support didnt know that when I called them. I happened upon it while googling for a default windows password to try. The default password is no password at all.

I have used HP laptops for several years. I was looking for a replacement for a three year old model. A brand new version of what I got retails for around $1100. This refurbished unit was in perfect condition. It was supposed to have a fingerprint reader but I contacted the vendor and discovered that they had been misinformed. They rapidly rectified the issue in days with just a couple emails.

The computer itself was clean, the display is delightfully clear and bright. The AMD Ryzen CPU is more than twice as fast as the machine it replaces. It has run everything I need with plenty of headroom (typically running less than 6% CPU. The NvME SSD is blazing fast.) The 16 gigabytes of RAM is provided by two SoDIMM which allows dual-channel, interleaved access making it even a little faster. I've used it on an external monitor and gotten great 4K results at 60 Hertz. This was a great bargain. Plus, the vendor support was excellent.

I want to call out the specs on this again. AMD has an excellent line of CPUs and are comparable to Intel's latest generation. The construction of the ProBook follows the same frame design as the EliteBook which is the top of the line business machine, with fewer ports. It would be hard to match this for anywhere near this price. I've used other Amazon refurb products and been pleased at the value. Unless you're looking for the fastest gaming machine this will service any normal home or business user.

$350 (after taxes) for a Ryzen 5600U is a great price. The battery life also seems pretty decent at 6 hours when browsing on powersaving mode (2.5 hours otherwise). However, the fans, clock speeds, and voltages are locked so neither overclocking nor undervolting will be possible.

When stress-testing on Cinebench R15, the laptop's thermals are way too weak for sustaining the 4.1 Ghz CPU turbo (activates below 70 degree Celsius), but it's good enough to sustain the 3.2 Ghz turbo during which the CPU never exceeds 85 degrees. The Vega 7 integrated GPU is also good enough to run Sekiro on medium graphics, so I believe its got enough strength to run most games.
Love this laptop. Its fast and light. Totally recommend

Esta laptop fue comprada para realizar tareas de Project Managers y como computadora personal.
Vdeo: excelente resolucin y frecuencia de actualizacin
Batera: excelente autonoma, hasta el momento 4hs sin ningn mensaje de batera baja fue lo mximo probado.

July 2023 update / Julio 2023 actualizacin
En Marzo/Abril aproximadamente la pantalla empezo a temblar/parpadear despus de un momento de estar viendo videos en YouTube o jugando algn juego somo Sims. Instale siempre los ltimos drivers de video y chipset, as como tambin actualice la Bios. El problema se iba por unos das pero luego volva. Contacte al servicio de Asus que me dio unos drivers extra pero no resolvieron el problema. Restaure la notebook a valores de fbrica y tampoco. Ahora, actualic la version de Windwos 11 Home a Pro y cambiar la frencuencia a 60hz. Sigo probando pero por ahora parece "solucionado".
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Around March/April the screen started flickering/flashing after a moment of watching YouTube videos or playing a game like Sims. Always install the latest video drivers and chipset, as well as update the Bios. The problem would go away for a few days but then it came back. I contacted the Asus support service who gave me some extra drivers but they didn't solve the problem. I restored the notebook to factory settings and it did not work. Now, I updated the version of Windows 11 Home to Pro and change the frequency to 60hz. I keep trying but for now, it seems "solved".

I was looking for what I consider a MINIMUM specification for a Windows 10 laptop used for travelers:
At least 1920 x 1080 resolution
At least 14 inches diagonal display (15.6 inches even better)
At least 12GB, preferably 16GB, RAM
At least 512GB SSD
A modern CPU with at least 8000 benchmark rating.
At most 3-3.5 lbs
Good Service and Reliability
Ergonomic Keyboard

This unit fits the bill almost perfectly, except:
The display is not bright enough for use in high illumination
There is only 12GB of RAM - unchangeable
The screen size means that it is difficult to read unless you have tip top vision.

If money were no object, I would opt for the LG Gram 16 inch of this year; it has as many pixels as a typical 17 inch monitor, yet weighs UNDER 3 pounds, and has good battery life.  Reviewers have criticized its mediocre brightness but the sheer screen "real estate" and the feather light weight are the most important factors for a mobile laptop that's easy on the eyes.  However, models begin at around $1000, and progress up to $2000 ish.

Another option is the highly rated Dell XPS with hit UHD display.  However, the screen is so small (13.3") that a presbyopic would need magnifying glasses to make out the letters and digits!

Nice performance, to be an entry model works very well for standard office tasks. More than a week using it and very satisfied so far, 512 GB SSD drive and 12G memory is good enough for what we needed.

Seems like a good computer so far but the battery only lasts a couple of hours-- Update! Was a great computer for 2 1/2 years of light use -then the motherboard crapped out - $600 is too much to pay for 2 1/2  years.
I got this for school and I love it! It is very light,  responsive, and fast. My sister will be getting one for herself with a larger screen.

Haven't found anything to dislike yet.  The laptop is light and thin.  Big improvement over my old laptop.  I like that it is solid state.  Faster than the old Dell.  Could use a lighted key board, but that is not a deal killer.

So this computer is perfect for someone like me who uses it primarily for work and very little for play. It's my first with a solid state drive (SSD). Much quicker than my old Sony Vaio with the old outdated hard drive, which was a $1,200 flagship model approaching 10 years old. SSD uses less energy because it has no moving parts and is more suited for the bumpy life of a laptop. This also has wicked fast 3.2 USB ports. About 10x faster when using jump drives that are rated 3.0 or above. This means I an easily use an external drive without the lag if I need more memory in the future. I see some complained in the reviews about the screen quality. Keep in mind this is an anti-glare sceen. If you are not familiar with this type of screen expect something different. They do look different and are easier on the eyes when working for long periods of time. If you are use to bright crisp screens and eye strain, look elsewhere. This screen also has some privacy qualities because it's harder to see from the side. Another plus is there is are no preinstalled obnoxious programs. Does have a week long trial for windows 365. There is no fingerprint scan. Had some issues with the last one so I see fingerprint readers as one more thing to malfunction while trying access your computer. No touchscreen. Almost never used it on my Vaio. I use the voice commands more. One thing I would like to have seen is a USB C connection, the reason why I knocked it down a star. USB C is the future and Lenovo dropped the ball big time on this one. Has one port for a regular 2.0 USB, two 3.2 USBs (souch faster), HDMI, a card reader, and a headset/microphone jack. The internet connection via wifi is great. Bluetooth also works great as I use it for an external speaker. The speakers on the computer are a little disappointing. Okay for regular function, not great for music. With a 12 gig ram and a solid state drive there is no lag with data transfers and it starts up quickly. Haven't fully tested the battery, but it lasted 5 hours on my last use. This is a nice computer with up to date drive technology and no fluff that I wouldn't use anyway.
It doesn't last even 2 hours if unplugged. It claims 9 hours of battery life.

I love it! It's incredibly fast given its 12Gb RAM! Its screen quality is so good that I want to watch Netflix on it instead of my TV. I use it for work and it has been absolutely great. The battery lasts a lot.
It doesn't have touch screen but for me it's perfect, because I didn't want it with touch screen
The only downside for me is that there's no option to include office with it, so you have to do the installation on your own

I absolutely love this computer.  It is light weight and took no time in setting up.  If you do your settings for privacy and not sync with other devices, if not needed, it really helps with speed and connection with internet.  Either or, it still is very, very fast.  It sits perfectly on my lap unlike other laptops I have had that were too bulky and very heavy.  I feel happy and satisfied, knowing I can get online with a reliable computer.  I waited a few weeks before rating, definitely 5 star for me.
Great product.
My KIndle Fire 8.9" is easier to use, especially when I generally use Amazon for everything. The screen is very nice,though. Probably the best.
Shipped quickly - battery charge is slowly losing - have to charge all the time and only lasts less than an hour!!

Better screen than any other tablet - period. It's awesome that it takes MicroSD too - means I can review GoPro footage and my still camera's photos on the fly, on a big screen, even in daylight. Superbly light and easy to hold. Software is Android, which takes getting used to but is very capable.

Great tablet with out standing screen display quality. Compared it to iPad and it blows it away. Unlike the iPad and other apple products, you do not have to put in your credit card info just to get access to hundreds of thousands of free apps. Invest in this tablet you will be happy you did.
after a year started to show problems

I had been wanting one of these for a while. Caught this one in the open box area of amazon for just a little over $200. You could tell the box had been opened, but all accessories are there and it looks brand new. So far I love it. Writing this review on it.

I purchased this to replace my galaxy note 8 that suddenly stopped working. I've mostly used it to play games and check my email. It's okay and does the job but there are still some more things I have to learn to use it to the fullest potential. I really love the screen.

This tablet is ok, but am disappointed that Samsung loads it with a bunch of apps that I would not use. There is so much pre-loaded garbage that can not be deleted. I use it for playing games and looking at FaceBook. I wish I would have waited and gotten an IPad.
Everything about this tab is great and beautiful except the occasional lag and clunky user experience. The smooth and seemless user interface is the only thing I miss about apple.

Excellent tablet to follow up my Galaxy Note 8.0. Beautiful screen, very responsive, additional memory is halpful (3gb as I recall).  The only odd thing is that pressing app buttons sometimes moves the screen instead of starting the app.  You can't be at all sloppy with pushing straight down.  My Note 8.0 was not as sensitive in that regard.
Great tablets but chargers (travel adapter part) were non-functional.  Had to use charger from a phone.  In response to inquiry, vendor indicated that they would send chargers (hopefully that work).
Other than the green hue at the top of the screen. It's a really nice tablet. You can't see the hue as much if you turn the brightness ask the way up.

This will not be a techie review, there's enough of those out there already.  What I will say about this Tab is that it is quite possibly the best tablet device in its class!  Fast! Brilliant! Extremely light! Beautiful! Stereo Speakers! Expandable storage! Nothing else compares.

If I were you, I'd get a Samsung Tab S 8.4! Really!  I would!

I bought this tablet as a Father's Day gift and he loves it! It's the perfect size, and very lightweight. Swiping through the device is smooth and quick. Best price I've seen it at the time of purchase and is really worth the cost. I did my research, like I do with all my products.  You get your money's worth with this tablet.

We purchased two of these. One for me and one for my wife. We really like them. However we are using them for personal use and I can't rate it for high end business use, but they sure meet our needs. So much better than firing up the lap top. It is rapidly becoming obsolete. The is way faster and easier to use.
Great device for browsing Internet and reading books. Same size as iPad mini and screen is just as good. Going from apple products to android is a bit tough at first with the difference in OS.

Nice tablet overall, however I have experienced the following problems:

1) The space bar does not work sometimes, causing whatever I type to lack spaces.
2) The tablet has started to randomly reboot, sometimes several times per day.

Due to these issues, and no clear resolution from Samsung, I would not buy another Samsung tablet.

Love it, got this to replace my old first gen nexus 7 after it got so slow i couldn't stand to use it. This works great only wish it didn't have so much bloatware, and that I could move things onto the SD card without it telling me I have set something up first. Other than that it works wonderfully, love the fingerprint scanner.

This is a top tier tablet, but buying it refurbished wasn't the best. There was small scratch on back that seller didn't say anything about and the battery isn't the best anymore. Other than that, awesome tablet.

I love it!!! My husband bought this for me as a Birthday/ Christmas gift. It is a perfect size and I love the white. I'm glad I got the 8.4". This is big
enough. I thought I wanted the 10" but that is much bigger. I love this because I can slide it right into my purse with no problem.

I reviewed and researched for months before finally buying 2 of these (in the white of course because who wants doo doo brown?). This was supposed to be a premium tablet. Yet, it is impossible to hold it, either in portrait or landscape, without accidentally touching the screen or the physical home/back/task buttons. If you hold it in portrait, the edges available for you to hold is so tiny that you touch the screen all the time. If you hold it in landscape, you will keep pressing the back button accidentally.

The multiple-window feature is marginally useful. But having it activated by a in-bound swipe from the right edge is simply crazy. There are so many apps who use the same gesture to turn pages. I have to disable this feature immediately.

And I expected a tablet with 1.9GHz quadcore cpu to be fast and smooth. On the contrary, it's not fast at all when I scroll between pages of my kindle ebooks. Much slower than my nexus 5 cell phone.

The only thing nice about it is the screen. But if you can't hold it properly,what is the use of it?
